review: I really appreciate what they did here : the story, characters, art design and the voice acting are all great. Puzzles were fun to play, not too hard, not too easy either. Again, great job on all parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017781735', 'num_games_owned': 1823, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1621792368}
review:
Technobabylon is an amazing game. I recommend it very much. 10h game (I did try to get most of the achievement so I redid some scenes), very nice pixelised artwork, interesting story. All good.
I will not play it again to get the achievement Talking Heads (played through the game with the commentary on). I really hate this type of achievement that need to redo this type of game or forced you to play with comment for steam achievement. But in any way, that doesn't change my opinion of the game which is very good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085450333', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1621873645}
review:
I really enjoyed playing that game.
+ Riddles
I really like it when the riddles are logical, when don't have to connect weird things and do weird things to solve it. In some of these games you just have to try everything with everything, but I did not have that feeling here. Sure, some things were unprobable, like the laser thing, but it was still within the limits.

+ Story
The story was just amazing. Really, really amazing. A bit dark, a bit gritty, but well thought out. And it was also touching several interesting topics, like artificial intelligence and morality.

+ Art & music/sound
I really like pixel art, what's more to say? The music/sound fits to the theme and some sounds (like squishy noise the elevator makes when he hits the body on the floor again) are pretty amazing. 

+ Speed setting
Being able to set the speed of the game is pretty nice. Awesome idea.

- Usability/Controls
That's the only thing I didn't like that much. I really like it when I have keyboard shortcuts to save/load, use items, move with cursor keys, ... Well, it isn't bad, but I think, they could do better here.

Overall: Pretty amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219425039', 'num_games_owned': 3057, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1621351277}
review:
Grade: S+ (93/100)

I found the game to have a gripping and emotional story that kept me engaged from start to finish, along with voice acting and well-drawn environments to keep the immersion value high. Also enjoyed the Trance mechanic, although it would have been nice to have used it more.

Overall, highly recommended, as with other games from this publisher.

Full Review: https://ravencrowgames.blogspot.com/2021/05/review-technobabylon.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198027591554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1620843912}
review: Great Sierra style game with an excellent story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975761700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1620326043}
review: This is an amazingly well written story. The thing that really puts this far above average are the characters. Many point and click games suffer from having characters who don't always reflect the world around them and are not always consistent, bending the rules of their own character. This games characters are absolutely spot on all the way through. That paired with a mystery story that doesn't give itself away too fast, it had me immersed the whole time. Definitely try this game out, it is one of the most complete point and click experiences you will have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973512794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1620057115}
review:
Great game & nice to see wadjeteye keeping the old school PnC genre alive, but with a modern flair to make them less frustrating.

Echoing what people have already stated: good voice acting, logical puzzles (I only had to check a guide on 1 right near the end (apparently I'm blind), great world, characters, humorous in some places.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961623887', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1620074374}
review: The devs seems to be falling into the woke hellhole, but it hasn't gotten so bad that they stop making fun games in favour of hitting you around the head with the ideology, though it was eye rollin'ly bad in places. There are a few places where I head scratched at the obscurity of the puzzle, but the actual story is kind interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015275441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1619097867}
review: Technobabylon is a cyberpunk point & click adventure set in the 2080s in a fictional city somewhere in Africa. The city is dingy and has problems, but I've certainly seen darker dystopias than this one. I found the game world to be more wonderous than horrific. The characters are interesting, voice acting superb, artwork gorgeous, music fitting of the genre, and the puzzles are appropriately logical & difficult for the most part. The story flows at a good pace and nothing particularly feels out of place. The game has some wacky mouse acceleration that I had to find a workaround for, but that is my only complaint. I enjoyed this one a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004578744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1618693121}
review: Interesting story and cool worldbuilding. Nice characters too and often quite funny. Most puzzles were good, even though I tired of a few of them. Might be my patience that's thin, rather than the game's fault though...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972351797', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1618327327}
review: Great adventure game all around.  Writing and pacing are both excellent.  Art and voice acting are great, and the puzzles felt generally fair/logical...no Nikstlitselpmurs here...highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985641814', 'num_games_owned': 1209, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1618040007}
review: Cool game. It's everything a good point and click adventure should be. Interesting and suspenseful story, unique and memorable characters, good acting and most importantly the puzzles are just right. author: {'steamid': '76561197965129510', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1574544723}
review:
Oh Technobabylon, thou art a game so grand
Easily one of the best, a point-and-click to stand
Thy price, well worth it, a game so true
I give thee a perfect score, a thing to do

Thy story, very good, a tale to tell
I lost myself in thy world, a living hell
A game that captured my heart, so dear
I am grateful to have played thee, a cheer

So I thank thee, Technobabylon, for thy charm
A game that left a mark, no alarm
Easily one of the best, a point-and-click divine
I am grateful to have played thee, one time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1530365800}
review:
Point'n click cyberpunk traditionnel.

Le haut du panier de chez Wadget Eyes. Le pixel art est bon, grosse ambiance, enquête intéressante qui prend rapidement de l'ampleur, très accrocheur. Les personnages sont pas du tout stéréotypés, on peut facilement s'identifier à eux et comprendre leurs motivations, d'autant qu'on switch régulièrement entre trois d'entre eux, qui ont des "capacités" qui leur sont propres. Beaucoup de thèmes abordés, certains propres au style cyberpunk, mais pas que.

Quelques frustrations en ce qui concerne les énigmes, avec parfois des objectifs pas assez clairs: on fait des trucs, mais on ne sait pas trop pourquoi. Rien de bien pénible cela-dit, mais je pense que les plus néophytes sortiront assez souvent la soluce. Mention spéciale à la toute dernière grosse énigme, avec vraiment beaucoup de possibilités, elle m'aura fait beaucoup me gratter la tête et plisser des yeux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141621687', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2033, 'last_played': 1616073548}
review:
Willkommen in der Technokratie, der "wundervollen" Brave New World!
Technobabylon ist mein erstes Spiel vom Publisher Wadjet Eye Games und eventuell bleibt es auch dabei...
Als Fan von Science-Fiction Settings / Stories und als aufmerksamer Beobachter unseres vorherrschenden und im Werden begriffenen Zeitgeists, war mein Interesse an dem technokratisierten Babel geweckt und ich schlug im Sale schließlich zu.
Mein erster Ärger mit dem Spiel stellte sich schnell ein: Die Bildschirmauflösung.
Ich hatte schon lange keine größeren technischen Probleme mit Spielen, selbst die letzten DOS-BOX Abstecher verliefen immer ziemlich reibungslos. Aber bei diesem Spiel hatte ich echte Startschwierigkeiten. Nach entsprechenden Einstellungen beim Start-Up konnte ich das Spiel im Vollbild-Modus starten, aber der Mauszeiger wies unerträglich stockende Bewegungsmuster auf, so habe ich dann schließlich auf ein Vollbild verzichtet und mit dem Fenstermodus vorliebgenommen. Im Hintergrund konnte ich so immerhin einen Übersetzer offen halten (den ich aber während des Spielens, wie es sich heraustellen sollte, nicht benötigte), das Englisch war problemlos verständlich - was die Sprache betrifft bereitet mir die Extensitivität des Vokabulars von Sunless Sea mehr Kummer.
Nun gut, die Immersion war durch den Fenstermodus jedenfalls etwas in Mitleidenschaft gezogen.

Der erste Eindruck vom Spiel war dennoch ganz ordentlich, ich tobte mich im ersten Level erstmal an der Umgebung aus, klickte alles was sich fand mit beiden Maustasten an (erzeugt unterschiedliche Reaktionen) und bekam recht unterhaltsame Kommentare dazu (was schon mal ein großer Pluspunkt war, darauf achte ich immer bei Adventures!). Außerdem versuchte ich mich an absurden Item-Kombinationen (die Kombinationsmöglichkeiten im Laufe des Spiels sind allerdings im Vergleich zu anderen Titeln eher unterdurchschnittlich, das Inventar ist selten mal richtig prall gefüllt), auch hier gab es erfreulicherweise meistens einen individuellen Kommentar.
Zügig wurde ich vom Spiel mit der Trance-Funktion vertraut gemacht, die mir zunächst richtig toll und stimmig erschien.
Es sollte sich herausstellen, dass die Trance-Nutzung im weiteren Verlauf zwar noch recht oft von Bedeutung sein sollte, aber sie wurde dann doch nicht so spannend genutzt, wie ich es mir am Anfang bei Einführung des Features erhoffte.
Nach kürzerem Hängenbleiben im ersten Level durch Verwirrtheit im Dialogfenster erlebte ich schließlich den ersten Szenen-Wechsel und Rollentausch. Ich steuerte nun ganz anderen Charaktere (Charakter-Wechsel sind ja nicht unüblich in Adventures und tragen meistens zur Abwechslung bei), und wurde in den ersten Ermittlungsfall geworfen. Auf den beiden Protagonisten im Einsatz, Charlie Regis und Max Lao, sollte der Fokus erstmal ein Weilchen bleiben. In der folgenden Handlung durfte ich anfallende Aufgaben teilweise unterschiedlich lösen, das gefiel mir sehr, aber man muss dazu sagen, dass es nicht so oft möglich war Rätsel auf verschiedene Art und Weisen zu lösen wie z.B. bei Quest for Glory. 
Das fand ich etwas schade, da hatte ich doch Hoffnung, dass es öfter zu entsprechenden Situationen mit Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten käme; die meisten Entscheidungen kommen im Diaologfenster zu Stande und man kann ziemlich genau erahnen, welche Antwort zu welchem Ergebnis führen wird. Aber einen Pluspunkt für das Einbauen von solchen Möglichkeiten gibt es auf jeden Fall, da gibt es weitaus linearere Adventures... Ein paar Verzweigungen mehr bei der Rätsellösung bzw. dem Handlungsstrang haben noch keinem Point & Click geschadet.
Die Steuerung der Charaktere wechselte noch ein paar mal, man brachte den Handlungsablauf von unterschiedlichen Perspektiven aus voran und erwartete schon gespannt, wie die Handlungsstränge zusammen laufen werden.
Es war auch schön, wie die Eigenheiten der unterschiedlichen Protagonisten durch Kommentare und in Dialogen deutlich heraus stachen. Einen besonderen Sympathieträger gab es für mich unter den Charakteren leider eher weniger, aber die Kontraste zwischen den Persönlichkeiten waren gut portraitiert. Der eher reaktionäre, altmodische Regis', die technikaffine Max Lao und die Trance-süchtige, eskapistisch veranlagte Latha reagierten sehr individuell auf Situationen und auf die Umgebung, wodurch sich unterschiedliche Sichtweisen auf den Zeitgeist herauskristallisierten, die zum Interesse am Setting beitrugen.
Die verschiedenen Handlungsstränge und die spätere Auflösung des Plots empfand ich persönlich als sehr gut in Szene gesetzt und clever verknüpft. Einige Tendenzen konnte man erahnen, aber es gab durchaus Überraschungen - was einer Geschichte eigentlich fast immer sehr zuträglich ist.

Insgesamt war das Artwork und die Story gut gewählt, die Pixel-Grafik ist nach wie vor optimal für das Point & Click Genre, hier gibt es zwar auch hübschere Darstellungen, aber alles in allem zeugte die Levelgestaltung schon von einer gewissen Genre-Versiertheit. Der Plot weist sehr viele Parallelen zu anderen Science-Fiction Geschichten/Prognosen auf, und man hat das Gefühl, so manch einer weiß, wo uns die Reise hinführen wird... Der Aufbruch in eine für manche utopisch, für andere dystopisch erscheinende Technokratie, in der die virtuellen Welten und die Kontrollinstanzen uns irgendwann über den Kopf wachsen und das Mensch-Sein in Frage stellen werden, ist ein gerne gewähltes Thema. In dieser Geschichte werden ganz besonders viele Zukunftstrends thematisiert - ob es um verblüffend menschlich wirkende Androiden geht, um das Klonen, um das Simulieren von 'ausgestorbenen' Krankheiten, verschwommene Geschlechtergrenzen, um ethische und humanistische Fragen im Wandel der Zeit „unter welchen (Labor-)Bedingungen ist Menschenfleisch eine Option?“ oder „Ist die Überwachung von vernetzten menschlichen Individuen durch eine 'allwissende' zentrale, künstliche Intelligenz erstrebenswert?“ - all diese 'Zukunftsmusik' ist nahtlos in die Spielwelt integriert. Und obschon es mich stets hin zum Science-Fiction Genre zieht, bin ich doch gleichzeitig immer wieder beunruhigt über die erschreckend prognostischen Anwandlungen von Genrewerken. Bewusst eingesetzter Symbolismus zeigt - die Agenda läuft im Hintergrund wie sie es soll. Aber das ist meine persönliche Wahrnehmung der Thematik, einen anderen mag es nicht verstören, bei mir hinterlässt es einen faden Beigeschmack.
Und trotz des Lobes in vielen Bereichen, muss ich in meinem Resümee auch noch erwähnen, dass alle (zum Teil auch gelungenen) Bemühungen ein abgerundetes, packendes Spielerlebnis zu kreieren nicht verhindern konnten, dass mein Enthusiasmus irgendwann in der Mitte des Spiels gewaltig auf der Strecke blieb und ich mich zum Weitermachen eher aufrappeln musste...also ich musste mich definitiv nicht vom Bildschirm reißen... Irgendwie stellte sich bei mir nie wirklich ein vollwertiger Spielspaß ein, alles wirkte auf eine seltsame Art 'limitiert' (kein Wunder, dass auch der Entwicklungsverlauf von "Technobabylon" wohl eher stockender Natur gewesen sein soll, was ich so gelesen habe), das Spiel verharrt in seinen Grenzen, das Potential war da aber es wurde gefühlt nie vollkommen ausgeschöpft. 
Von mir würde das Spiel daher auch in etwa 6 von 10 Punkten bekommen. Man kann es mal gespielt haben, aber hätte ich es nicht gespielt, hätte ich auch nicht viel verpasst - die Zeit, die ich darin verbracht habe war 'ganz okay'.
Ich persönlich würde Genre-Fans bevorzugt "I have no Mouth and I Must Scream" und "Beneath a Steel Sky" ans Herz legen! Vor allem Ersteres punktet mit einer viel angenehmeren, ungezwungeneren Charakter-Palette, einem sehr interessanten, innovativen 'Karmasystem' und einer beklemmenden Atmosphäre, die mich noch lange nach dem Spielen in ihren Bann zog und mich ermunterte, im Anschluss die Kurzgeschichte zu lesen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007290272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1615997419}
review: The art and voices are nice, but this is pretty weak offering compared to more recent games by Wadjet Eye. It's much shorter than their recent games, is much more linear, and some of the puzzles require luck/guesswork and or save scumming to pass. Working my way through illogical combinations of conversation choices or objects and having to reload if you get them wrong is not my idea of fun.

You can get all achievements in one run with some reloading, though you do need to be prepare for them (eg start the game with commentary on, save a lot in case you miss some and have to go back later on). One of the achis is very hard to get and because of it I almost didn't finish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966554517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1615288471}
review:
I've recently come to realize that I actually like Point and Clickers now, for some god forsaken reason. Maybe it's an age thing. Whatever the case, I remembered Technobabylon from several years back, when I tried playing it for the first time. I got about three hours in that time, but then just sorta drifted away and haven't touched it since. But with my newfound love for clickers, I figured I'd give it another shot.

Turns I liked it quite a bit more this time around. So much so that I played through it in one sitting, despite the fact that I was actually supposed to be working. Time well spent, eh.

Anyway, don't have many negative things to say about this one. The story was very good, and I was even surprised by some of the twists, which doesn't happen often. The aesthetic was great, in all it's grim dystopia-ness. I don't usually go for cyberpunk-esque stuff, but here I didn't mind it at all. The comparisons between trance and the real life equivalents were laid on quite thick, but that's a minor gripe towards writing at best. The puzzles were very satisfying, fair, and mostly very logical, to a point where the few times I had to take a peek at a walkthrough, I instantly felt like I should've figured it out myself. The only part I really, truly hated was the arcade bit with the whatever-the-hell-ball it was called. I actually didn't even realize that you were supposed to do something to help yourself gain an edge, and powered through dry, and it was pretty horrible. Even if it only took like 15 minutes at most.

But yeah, ultimately not much to say. All around a great point and clicker. Very much worth your time and money. Something of a hidden gem, even.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975150987', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1614435177}

review: A fantastic setting and worldbuilding, full voiceover, neat pixel animations, interesting "trance" sequences, and an overall decent story. The music is okay though nothing too catchy, but it serves its purpose. The story and theme gives us an interesting perspective of the future. Fans of Sci-Fi and not-so-distant-future settings should enjoy this game. Recommended for everyone seeking a good adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048527305', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2226, 'last_played': 1612646017}
review: Beautifully crafted, well-written, and, thanks to the fair riddles, a very accessible adventure game. The character design is very good and the story has some great and unexpected twists - and it is the first adventure game that I ever finished because besides getting me hooked, it had no situation in which I got so stuck that I had to relate to a walkthrough. I also really, really enjoyed the well-done cyberpunk setting, which on one hand draws a lot from Ghost in the Shell and other classics - which is not a bad thing, of couse - but at the same time manages to emphasize on some timeless issues. Go see for yourself and play it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993419334', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1612290628}
review:
Despite what it says on the tin, this review will not be very positive. To be clear, I liked Technobabylon; it has quite good gameplay, with smart puzzle design (even though it sometimes falls in the "I just can't find the McGuffin I need" camp) and a very interesting world. It even successfully comments on a multitude of real-life problems and technological advancements in a thoughtful way, which is difficult to get right and is something I appreciate. As such, there is no doubt that this game is a good one, and definitely worth playing for cyberpunk fans (the genre, not the game).

However, when I remember Technobabylon, I can't help but think of it as a big waste of potential. For all the things I like about it, it misses the mark completely in the execution of its storytelling, despite the forementioned quality of its philosophies.

Let's talk about the biggest problem first, which is pacing. Structurally, Technobabylon is quite simple: You get to a new area, you solve a lengthy series of puzzles, you then watch a cutscene. Rinse and repeat. The problem is that it doesn't make sense with the story beats - you have an intense situation where the narrative is telling you that time is of the essence, but instead you have the same amount of puzzles that needs solving which completely shatters the illusion of urgency. You might think that would be the worst of it, but no! Because there are also situations that are supposed to be mundane or quick (like having a meeting and talking to someone) which stretches into a huge, pointless tree of puzzles for no real reason outside of filling out a gameplay quota. And that's not even mentioning the redundant dialogue sections that repeats the same exposition several times throughout.

Because of the poor pacing, we get our second problem: a lack of emotional investment. When you spend an hour clearing out a virtual bar (yes, that happens), there is simply no space for dramatic interactions and confrontations between characters, scenes that actually matter. We get to know what drives our characters (or at least a couple of them), but we never see [i]why[/i]. As a result, they become flat and stereotypical, with little to no development and stakes that are difficult to care about. What happens might be cool, even topical, but it's never devastating or even tense.

And then there is the plot. I don't mention plots very often since I'm not very interested in them, but in this case, I can't help but to. Things simply happen in this game. While there are explanations to why, they are often near nonsensical, with conveniences building on conveniences in order to make it all work. There is a severe lack of reasons that would make sense outside of this game, reasons that one could actually relate to. And the endings... not only are they poorly set up (the ending that seems to be bad actually ends up being the good one, and vice versa), there is also a lack of character consistency between them, with the same characters being benevolent in one ending only to be menacing in the other. It's just poor craftmanship overall, only really saved by good performances and, frankly, a lot of bells and whistles.

I did like Technobabylon. But when I think about the game it could have been, I can't help feeling pessimistic about the whole experience. I don't think anyone is going to be displeased with playing this game, and mechanically, I think it might even be one of the best Point & Click games out there. But while there is a lot to like here, there is little to love; and I [i]really[/i] wanted to fall for this game. Alas, it was not to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023623749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1484401710}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972355522', 'num_games_owned': 1811, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1530763266}
review: Technobabylon is the best traditional point-and-click adventure I’ve played in years. It doesn’t seek to innovate, but manages to check every box a good adventure needs (compelling player characters, sensible puzzles, interesting mysteries) while deftly dodging the most tired cyberpunk tropes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015468878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1611157343}
review: Масштабная и разнообразная point-and-click адвенчура от Wadjet Eye. Игроку придется примерить на себя в мире киберпанка роли 1) старомодного детектива 2) его более современной напарницы(ка?) 3) поведенной на виртуальной реальности безработной девушки. У каждого персонажа свой взгляд на вещи и различные способы решения проблем. Если бы не крайне невнятно сделанные головоломки последней главы, можно было бы назвать одной из лучших игр студии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058024984', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1611073143}
review:
Тут має бути нейтральний огляд.

Technobabylon - приклад добре оформленого кіберпанк-квесту. Приємні фони та ОСТ, різноманітність локацій: від класичних для жанру брудних вулиць до багатоповерхових офісів корпорацій. Помірний неон "Того, хто біжить по лезу" з геометрією старого "Трону" і, відповідно, колірні гами Сіда Міда (наскільки це можливо в простакуватій піксельній стилістиці). Ставші "обов'язковими" для сеттингів про похмуре майбутнє всеосяжний кіберпростір, андроїди та масивний АІ, у якого (на думку деяких) занадто багато влади. Мені сподобалася наявність кількох керованих головних героїв, як вписані теми клонування та синт-людського м'яса, іронія над підлітковою модою на штучні хвороби та катастрофи минулого. Ця гра багато робить добре, але найважливіше - історія та геймплей - на жаль, залишили мене байдужою у кращому випадку.

Сюжет - най буде, це на любов і смак, але чому більшість головоломок руйнують логіку розповіді? Наприклад: ми на розслідуванні вбивства і маємо взяти зразок у лабораторії. Начальниця лабораторії про цей зразок [i]розповідає сама[/i] і зазначає, що [i]він може допомогти у справі[/i]. Але в лабораторію пускає лише після того, як гравець показує їй старе фото і тисне на почуття, а сам зразок її навіть попросити винести на час розслідування не можна. Її інтерн теж допомагати не хоче - мовляв, його вже й так підозрюють у крадіжці. Тому ми маємо вкрасти зразок самі. І повернутися до начальниці лабораторії, щоби обробити його. На її очах. ВТФ? Якби таких рішень було всього пара-трійка за гру, гаразд, але коли буквально половину ігрового часу сидиш і задаєшся питаннями в дусі якого біса це взагалі працює, або якого біса серйозні по лору агенти обмундировані гірше копів минулого століття і їм доводиться на місці вигадувати щось з г|вна і палиць, або якого біса герой не зарядив зброю під час таймскіпу (очевидно, все це - щоб трапилися головоломки, але сюжет не виправдовує), etc. задоволення мало. До самої історії теж питання є, про деяких персонажів просто забувають, другорядні сюжети залишають без розвитку... Але забагато виходить вимог до квесту, тож чорт із ними, з питаннями.

Напевно, об'єктивно - 7/10, тому що гра добре зроблена і ретро-піксельний стиль будить у серці ностальгію, але, на жаль, це і кіберпанк-тематика - єдине, що мотивувало мене закінчити її. Technobabylon чудово виглядав би у форматі мультсеріалу і напевно сприйнявся б мною набагато краще, тому що вимушений квестовий геймплей не доводив би те, що відбувається, до абсурду, oh my, yes. Але що маємо, те маємо. Я впевнена, що комусь ця гра дуже сподобається, вона точно не погана - просто не знайшла емоційного відгуку особисто в мене, тому рекомендувати не можу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036489517', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1608983272}
review:
Киберпанк, который точно пойдет на вашем ПК.
Безумно интересный квест. Вполне себе логические загадки, есть разные способы решения. Симпатичный, самобытный арт. Изумительная озвучка, герои колоритные и запоминающиеся. Шикарная атмосфера и убедительный мир. Много деталей. Тут вам и ИИ, управляющий городом, и биохакеры, и импланты, и китайские мозговые трояны, и ресторан, подающий искуственно выращенное человеческое мясо, и много того, что мы представляем себе, когда слышим слово "киберпанк". Сюжет так же хорош. Затрагивает различные вопросы этики, показывает высокотехнологичный мир с разных порой неожиданных сторон, о которых нечасто задумываешься.

О минусах, но это субъективно, конечно:
Играть рекомендую в оконном режиме (тут к сожалению надо будет залезть в файл настроек, из самой игры сделать это не получится), потому что в полноэкранном это выглядит как кошмар, глаза от растянутых пикселей начнут вытекать уже через пару минут. Шрифты ужасные. Буквы толщиной в 1 пиксель смотрятся ужасно, хотя и понятно, что ребята старались втискивать массивы текста в ограниченное пространство.
Не очень понравились некоторые моменты, требующие от игрока активных действий на время (проход вдоль конвейера или игра в мяч), не люблю такое в квестах, но тут оно не очень сложно.

В целом игра очень понравилась, сразу же побежал покупать Unavowed от того же издателя.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996375081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1637012775}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070453615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1668786991}
review:
기억 탈취 연쇄살인사건에 세 주인공이 얽히면서 벌어지는 사이버펑크 어드벤처 게임. 사건 전담 수사관은 자신의 유산을 볼모로 협박당해 사적 제재를 감행하고, 홀연히 자취를 감춘 그를 동료 수사관이 찾아나서는가 하면, 한 가상세계 중독자는 뜬금없이 자기 집에 갇히더니 곧 목숨을 위협받는다. 이들이 각자 마주친 위기와 수수께끼를 풀어나가며 범죄의 실상과 도시의 비밀에 다가가는 스릴러 스토리.
게임 곳곳에 미래지향적인 면이 잘 표현된 것 같아 흥미로웠다. 유전공학, 빅 브라더, 가상세계를 중점으로 공상과학 요소들이 배경이나 스크립트에 제법 자연스럽게 드러나있다. TMI로 이 게임의 세계에서는 하도 핵전쟁을 많이 겪어서 '핵까네!(Nuke it!)'라는 욕설이 있다.
트릭과 퍼즐은 일반적인 포인트 앤 클릭과 사이버펑크 요소가 섞여있다. 적재적소에 아이템 찍는 와중에 과학기술의 영역을 들락날락하는 느낌. 대부분 그럭저럭 할만했는데 몇몇 퍼즐은 꽤 어렵고 피지컬이 필요한 구간도 있다. 가장 악랄했던건 중반부의 식물 종자명 퍼즐.
퍼블리셔의 게임 중 코멘터리 모드에서 자막이 나오는 거의 유일한 게임이기도 하다. 덕분에 개발자들의 의도에 더 공감할 수 있었다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047398251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1610208507}
review:
This was fantastic.  

Was having a craving for a point and click game, and this hit the spot.  A story that kept me engaged.  Good puzzles that weren't too abstract.  

I'm all about some Sci-Fi.  I like stories that question where our society might end up.  What kind of technological developments will we achieve and what will people's reaction to those be?  Technobabylon explores some interesting topics for a world we might be headed for.  Although I can appreciate the extreme setting a game like cyberpunk can give, I like how this story is told without it being too over the top.  It just makes more accessible to me as a participant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061584714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1605373100}
review: ziemlich cooles Spiel mit überraschenden Wendungen im Story-Verlauf...wirkt erwachsen und ist sicher nichts für Kinder, recht gute Englisch-Kenntnisse wären auch nicht schlecht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171569614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1609768805}
review: It was a decent game. I quite enjoyed the puzzles, although the characters were pretty one-dimensional and the storyline could've been more original. After for instance Darkside Detective this was a more challenging treat. The world was interesting although it felt more like what people in the late 1980s might have imagined 2080s to look like... I paid 5 e for this and I think t was worth exactly that :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030725138', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1609699339}
review: Well-made short cyberpunk adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979831127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1609646125}
review: I can't recommend this game highly enough.  I've been playing point-and-click adventures since the Sierra and OG LucasArts days and this one has it all; great story, great voice acting, great length, and a variety of varied and very interesting and imaginative puzzles.  Nothing too hard, but none of them too easy either.  Great work!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034942790', 'num_games_owned': 4845, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1404, 'last_played': 1609535062}
review:
Ostatnio naszła mnie chęć na mała falę przygodówek i to jest jedna z tych które mogę z czystym sumieniem polecić :).

Świetna gra przygodowa. Grałem w nią po skończeniu Whipers of a Machine, która zresztą też mi się bardzo podobała. W zasadzie tematyka obu jest dosyć podobna, a historia jest interesująca i "na poważnie" bez udawania głupkowatego/nachalnego humoru. Jednak jakbym miał ocenić to jednak przygoda w Technobabylon jest bardziej złożona, a gra sprawia wrażenie dłuższej (i pewnie jest dłuższa). W Technobabylon łatwiej się za to zaciąć i kilka razy mnie to spotkało, choć w końcu udało się to przezwyciężyć po dłuższym kombinowaniu. Raz tez wystąpił przed finalną cena błąd (zostały otwarte drzwi i nie zamknęły się za mną, a w efekcie nie mogłem przez nie przejść spowrotem, co zmusiło mnie do doczytania wcześniejszej sytuacji i powtórzenia partii gry), ale to szczegół.

Za to Technobabylon sprawia trochę gorsze wrażenie jeśli chodzi o techniczne aspekty związane z rozdzielczością gry (nie można ustawić natywnej rozdzielczości, tylko niższa i albo ją rozciągnąć na cały ekran (wtedy miałem wrażenie że wszystko jest duże) albo grać w oknie (co na końcu zrobiłem). Tak samo konfiguracje grafiki trzeba robić poza grą co jest dość dziwnym rozwiązaniem w obecnych czasach. Więc pierwsze wrażenie było trochę zniechęcające, ale szybko poprawiło się przez ciekawą fabułę i fajnie podłożone głosy :).

Ogólnie rzecz biorąc mocno polecam. Przy okazji odkryłem, że ten wydawca ma bardzo dużo dobrych przygodówek (m.in pamiętam świetne Gemini Rue, które kiedyś grałem poza Steam). Więc będę miał na oku inne gry tego wydawcy i spróbuje kiedyś zagrać :).

author: {'steamid': '76561198063430580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1609272809}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960389353', 'num_games_owned': 1821, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1609132598}
review: An above solid sci-fi mystery. If you like Wadjet titles, you'll like this. If you don't, it's a good place to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993947170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1480367839}
review: As someone that has played a whole lot of point and click adventure games, I have to say that Technobabylon is one of the very best in the genre. It features a great story and some clever puzzles, as well as some very creative usage of adventure game studio. If you are a fan of the genre and/or you like cyberpunk/futuristic settings, you should be picking this one up. With the pricetag being as low as it is, there are no excuses!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012170190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1609028380}
review:
Je recommande très très chaudement Technobabylon!

L'histoire est excellente, une des meilleurs histoires que j'ai eu l'occasion de découvrir, pleine de surprises et de rebondissements. L'univers décrit est riche, cohérent, surprenant, extrêmement intéressant à explorer et à découvrir. Les puzzles sont intéressants, certains sont justes incroyablement créatifs, et apportent toujours de la valeur à l'histoire.

Si vous voulez du cyberpunk c'est à Technobabylon que vous devriez jouer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007362350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1608946718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051458918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1608443296}
review:
Technobabylon's characters and story are best of breed for an old school point and click adventure from the nineties. If you can get past the quaint art style, you'll enjoy its characters, environment and events immensely.

I wish I could play through it the first time, the second time.

For new point and click players: the puzzle space is limited and it's a fairly easy game in its class. I would call it a good and easy introduction to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035885343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1608071018}
review: An enjoyable point and click game. The characters were likeable and interesting, and bolstered the already interesting story. My only issue was the pixel style test was difficult to read.

author: {'steamid': '76561199021412007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1696869492}

author: {'steamid': '76561198166116005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1607392906}
review:
Love the storyline and the characters, but the puzzles are kind of illogical. I don't mind challenging puzzles, but if they don't make sense (for example [SPOILER], using a genetically modified glowing fish as a flashlight to read a note instead of a flashlight), you feel cheated and you end up pixel-hunting. But I guess that's also a function of the point-and-click genre. 

Anyway, still worth it for the story, but if you're looking for a good modern point-and-click adventure, go for Wadjeteye's newer title, Unvavowed. It's awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072365101', 'num_games_owned': 5420, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1461693187}
review: Great pnc adventure without weak spots. Wonderful setting, story, characters... just anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032588847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1502758850}
review:
Wadjet Eye Games knows how to do old Monkey Island style graphics. THAT's perfect. 

BUT!

Most Wadjet Eye Games tend to have a dry feeling to it, instead of a gripping atmosphere that FEELS diverse.
Atm most of their games are bland unfortunately, no depth. I think they might profit if they invest in better story arc techniques that don't seem to linear. That is one of the most important factors for Graphical Adventure games in my opinion.
Being good at balancing linear and non-linear gameplay. You want objectives to be clear and you don't want to get lost and possibly block yourself from progressing.

I recommend this game because Wadjet Eye Games has a good tested merit/dedication to their Graphical Adventure game series, but only purchase if you are big fan of Graphical Adventure games and can settle if the game isn't perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977098080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1607299725}
review: A fun point and click game, in a cyberpunk setting, with humour, good but not impossible puzzles (didn't need walkthrough), well-written characters with good voice acting, and a plot that is certainly interesting (not too sure if it entirely makes sense, but maybe there's some deliberate ambiguity.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970676004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1607227337}
review:
Technobabylon is a very good cyberpunk point & click adventure with a well-written story, interesting and in-depth characters, sound  puzzles, good voice-acting and charming albeit occasionally inconsistent artwork.

In my opinion the puzzles are well thought-out and respective of the players time and patience. I have gotten frustrated with other adventure games that require seemingly arbitrary backtracking and/or item-combinations to progress. Technobabylon doesn't make this mistake and neatly contains the solution to puzzles within the reach of one's own logic. Also, I was positively surprised by the game giving the player limited agency over the outcome of some puzzles, conversations and even the ending. In order to respect my own time, I have consulted a guide a few times during my play-through, when I got stuck in a chapter not knowing on how to progress. This isn't to say, that the game was too hard, much rather, sometimes I failed to understand my objective to solve a puzzle. In moments like these I wished for the main characters to mumble a potential hint, that would bring me back on track towards my objective.
Speaking of main characters, you will mostly be in control of three main characters; Trance-addict Latha, CEL agent Charles Regis and his subordinate Max Lao. While all characters of Technobabylon are interesting, with their own motifs and backstory, I grew particularly fond of the subtly humorous Max Lao and enjoyed the comedic relief of subservient Chantelle. Still, the game isn't a comedy and will explore some surprisingly dark and gruesome story-beats, that albeit rendered in pixels were sufficiently graphic to spur my imagination. 
Technobabylon's graphics may be its weakest link, charming yet inconsistent in quality. This isn't to say the graphics are outright bad, they just aren't up to the same standard as voice-acting, story and puzzles. Most notably, while the character portraits are looking great, the character-animations and resizing weren't as refined, and some backdrops were rendered much more crudely than others.
Apart from graphics, I had a minor issue with last chapter's story, in particular [spoiler]Galathea's origin story was resolved anticlimactically and without much reaction from the involved parties[/spoiler] in my play-through. Nonetheless, I think my criticisms are about minor issues, and do not hamper the experience of Technobabylon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119966026', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1536, 'last_played': 1607234846}
review: о боже 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027502227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1607219144}
review:
Being a huge fan of Wadjet Eye Games, I simply had to play this game they, well, didn't make but published so I expected a certain level of quality.

Technobabylon really looks and sounds like a WEG game. The art is gorgeous, the music and voice-acting great, the puzzles challenging but never too frustrating (apart from the ball game - I will never get that achievement which irks me). I also really appreciated the world building! I just wish the Trance would have been a more interesting world. It's established as this place you can get addicted to and you'd rather spent you life there instead of in the real world but when you travel there, it's just... meh.

The only real problem I personally had was the story. I had trouble getting sucked into it and it was hard to relate to the main characters, two out of three weren't particularly sympathetic.
While I knew what I had to do, I was often unsure of what was at stake, what the consequences would entail on a global level. Also neither ending seemed to be happy. Maybe because they're meant to establish the conflict in the sequel but they still left me scratching my head, wondering if my choices were the right ones. But as I said, that's just me.

Regardless, I'd recommend this game to sci-fi and adventure fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197234309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1607202250}
review: This was a fun game for me. Definitely hits the cyberpunk feel, well done pixel graphics. An intriguing storyline that keeps you interested with sometimes unexpected progression. If I ha one thing to complain about it may be the switching back and forth between 2 converging storylines seemingly more than necessary. Also rather than playing the flashback portions they could possibly just be memories recalled. It works the way it is however and that was honestly just weird feeling, not a deal breaker. I thoroughly enjoyed the game and recommend it to anyone. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035862621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1606554838}
review: While the art took some getting used to, Technobabylon was a delightful point and click adventure with a surprisingly rich world. The puzzles are challenging, yet gated well, so you're not stuck wandering around an entire map when you're stuck. The cyberpunk and tech elements are inventive and fun. Recommended if you're looking for a point & click adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991946829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1606937474}
review: A cool little sci-fi cyberpunk adventure game. Very intriguing story, interesting characters and some challenging quests here and there. At 14 hrs of gameplay time, it's not too long: just right. Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001675763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1606806300}
review:
This is probably the best game of this type I've ever played.  With Cyberpunk 2077 coming out in a few days allegedly, I've been chomping to get into a decent cyberpunk game.  This was well written, beautifully illustrated, and made me feel clever.  Some puzzles made me hit the wall and I had to pull out the walkthrough in a few cases, but browsing through different strategies was really eye opening. Some puzzles have a lot of breadth as to their solutions.  To mildly spoil one encounter, you can resolve a situation where an opponent is dug in with a pistol by arming a drone with a grenade.  This drone can then be simply piloted to the opponent and detonated, killing them, or for the more merciful, you can solve a sort of Towers of Hanoi puzzle to have the drone detonate a power system instead, knocking out the lights so that the opponent can be subdued and arrested.

With one notable exception, there aren't any choice and consequence situations like that which effect the ending of the game, but it does effect the story as you go.  That said, this was a great Cyberpunk noir detective story, and I highly recommend it to anyone who grew up with the LucasArts classic adventure games.

Disclaimer: For those noting my play time, the game is definitely not 12 hours long.  I have a toddler and have to wander off from my computer suddenly and sometimes for long periods of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171908327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1606833490}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970613375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1649946419}
review: YES. Deep Story and fantastic gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982581727', 'num_games_owned': 4571, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1598375707}
review:
Gutes Point & Click mit einer Story und einem Setting rund um eine künstliche Intelligenz, welche die Stadt Leitet und über reich & arm, Leben & Tod entscheidet.
Es wurden verschiedenste moralische Fragen aufgeworfen und thematisiert.

Die typischen Point & Click-Mechaniken wurden hier noch erweitert bzw. aufgelockert durch den Wechsel der spielbaren Charaktere, und ihren unterschiedliche Fähigkeiten.
Nicht unbedingt neu, aber immer wieder gern gesehen :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996445381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1611608199}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962209043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1606421727}
review: Fantastically recaptures the feel of '90s Cyberpunk point-and-click adventures such as Dreamweb or Beneath a Steel Sky.  Well written and acted, and with good puzzles, music and art direction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797526924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1605811973}
review:
Technobabylon è un gioco davvero ben fatto, dalla storia fino alla grafica in vecchio stile pixel art anni '90 per veri appassionati del genere delle avventure punta e clicca. Dicevamo dunque la storia, articolata su due piani temporali (il passato è mera narrativa e offre un intermezzo per capire meglio la psicologia dei personaggi principali), che offre spunti etici a una realtà in cui la presenza della tecnologia nelle sue varie forme, e in particolare della super Intelligenza Artificiale denominata "Central", ha preso il sopravvento. 

Punto a favore: presenza di personaggi lgbtqia + rende lo scenario davvero diverso e futuribile

Punto a sfavore: la localizzazione del gioco non presente in lingua italiana

author: {'steamid': '76561198035085257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1605484330}
review:
voici un point&click dans un futur post apocalyptique baigné de révolutions technologiques, le tout avec des personnages confrontés à des ambitions, des sentiments et des dilemmes eux bien humains.
le background historique et culturel est assez bien écrit et mentionné/utilisé à plusieurs moments de l'histoire (sans trop en rajouter)
vous voulez des références cinématographiques pour aiguiser votre curiosité? : [spoiler] Blade Runner, ou encore  Virtual Revolution [/spoiler] et dans une moindre mesure [spoiler] Matrix et Ghost in the Shell[/spoiler] y'en sans doutes plein d'autres que je n'ai pas vus
mais un jour ce sera l'inverse, les films de SF s'inspiront des jeux vidéos, si ce n'est pas déjà le cas...

mon avis général : Wadjet Eye Games est désormais une valeur sûre en jeux d'aventures et ce jeu ne fait pas exception.
On retrouve un scénario de cinéma grand public, un univers futuriste, plusieurs personnages principaux à incarner, et toujours ce même graphisme (c'est une exigence de base de leur directeurs ou leur équipe de designers est à la fois bonne mais absolument non innovante ?) C'est plutôt assez bien emballé avec une durée de jeu très correcte. (bémol : la musique pourrait être bien mieux par contre et certains dialogues sont assez longs, difficile de tous les lire mais ça permet de tester votre patience et votre intérêt pour l'histoire:]).

Je recommande mais ce n'est pas non plus extraordinaire. je dirais 15/20.

ps : l'option d'avoir pendant le jeu des commentaires de l'équipe ayant développé le jeu, oui pourquoi pas (ça existe pour des films par exemple) mais franchement c'est vraiment si vous aimez le jeu comme un fou car on n'apprend pas grand chose on n'en retient rien...inutile de refaire le jeu pour ça

author: {'steamid': '76561198023020656', 'num_games_owned': 1270, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1384, 'last_played': 1605531368}
review:
Un buen ejemplo de las aventuras de Wadjet Eye games (Y si, usa el mismo engine con todos los problemas tecnicos que ello conlleva). A saber:
- Puzzles muy logicos y en algunos casos con mas de una manera de resolverlos.
- Bastantes logros ocultos, me lo he pasado y aun no he conseguido el 50%.
- Buena historia.

Contras:
- Tiene algunos problemas tecnicos, incluyendo que steamcloud no funciona (Aunque la tienda diga que si).

author: {'steamid': '76561198134648334', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1605651984}
review:
I can guarantee you that if you liked the demo you're going to like the full game. 
(BTW if you liked the atmosphere in deus ex you will probably like this too)
I'm not big into point and click games but this was really good in my opinion.

I was looking for a better story after playing a game called "Cloudpunk" and being disappointed with the story and voice acting, since there is no REAL gameplay it only really had cool voxel environments to fall back on. Technobabylon succeeds where Cloudpunk fails, it comes off as a good experience rather than just a neat concept. 

I had to look up a walkthrough a couple of times, but it was not too rough. The ending is not exactly perfect(I guess it inherits more than just atmosphere from deus ex in this regard), but I'm still more than happy to have played and finished Technobabylon

author: {'steamid': '76561198034889051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1604986227}
review:
Excellent game!  I wanted to look for more games produced by WadjetEye and their partnering studios after playing Primordia.  This did not disappoint.  The storyline was well written and the world that the story takes place in was well crafted.  Concepts within the game such as consciousness, agency, and societal impacts of AI are woven into the fabric of this story very well.  The actors were compelling and I really liked how you can see the motivations for the actions they take throughout the story although there are still some twists the totality of the actions are coherent with the characters goals.  

Like with Primordia, the graphics are simple but efficiently and effectively convey the mood, the atmosphere, and the overall story.  Voice acting was great.  Soundtrack was fitting with the game, I happen to like that genre of music anyway and I think they made a good choice as to the selections used.  I was able to disappear in to a very interesting cyberpunk fantasy world for awhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164831891', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 785, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1605832231}

author: {'steamid': '76561198331862151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1604294111}
review: Another great game of Wadjet Eye Games. Sci-fi point and click game of great writing, fantastic voice over, well-structured puzzles. I'm most impressed by the game's way of dealing minorities and marginalized people, because I know many fanboys who say that sci-fis are not belong to those people(laugh). Technobabylon is just the opposite. It describes those minorities in future world with great care and respects. I appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043904691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1603055443}
review:
([i]Full disclosure: I did not finish this game, so keep this in mind while reading[/i])

I REALLY wanted to like this game.  I'm into the cyberpunk/pessimistic future where corporations act like government and true power is determined by how well you navigate through the webspace, and this game looked straight up my alley.  And let me say that it has all of those things I came to expect: a net-runner doing some IRL running to stay one step ahead of a cunning villain, two futuristic cops that explore both the pros and the cons of living augmented to keep up with an ever-evolving society, and a dark city that hosts even darker conspiracies amidst the glow of technology and progress.

Too bad the puzzles fucking suck.


[h1]Absolutely Techno World[/h1]
Let's start off by saying that the world-building for the game is very well done.  Things are just familiar enough that anyone who's never really checked out a cyberpunk story can get up to speed on the "rules and guidelines" of what makes this word tick, while other players more familiar with their Snow Crashes and Neuromancers can pick things up as they go.  You can easily believe how hard it is for Latha to live in the real world because of how difficult it is for anyone without a clear advantage to even have stability, let alone success, which makes her dependence on the Trance all the more understandable.  Old school Charlie Regis has his charm with how he gets the job done by channeling his inner John McClane as a hammer stuck in a world of laser pistols.  Everything feels like it comes together so well and I wished that I could learn more about this world.  Beyond what the game allows you to learn from going off the beaten path, I mean.


[h1]Tragically Babylonian Puzzles[/h1]
Unfortunately, this world is only as accessible as your patience with puzzles.  And these puzzles aren't necessarily hard.  They're just... [b]obtuse[/b].  Part of this is based around how much you have to interact with all the clickables in the world: what's meant to be moved, picked up, interacted with, only looked at, etc.  And while there are a couple points where you can find another way to solve a puzzle, those moments are a bit too far in between.  When you're stuck, you find yourself forced into the usual "take every item and rub it against the background in hopes it will go [b]DING[/b] instead of [i]phhbt[/i]".  What's especially irksome are the moments where you'll be stuck for about half an hour trying to progress, only to realize that you didn't click on something that works differently than what you were expecting it to be.  

And can I just touch on Latha's sections for a moment?  Because her sections absolutely do NOT have the same quality as the other characters.  Her puzzles can be summarized as "Rubbing Wetware On Everything 101", cause if you're stuck, you probably didn't rub enough wetware on EVERY.  FUCKING.  THING.  Once I had finished a particularly frustrating chapter with her (about the halfway point of the game), I realized that my desire to finish the game paled in comparison to my desire to avoid having to look up what pixel Latha needed to lube up with wetware every 20 mintues.


[h1]So:[/h1]
Overall, as much as I enjoy cyberpunk subjects and adventure games, I can't really recommend this particular union.  The fascinating world is held back by questionable puzzle design and a gimmick that's only as effective as your puzzle-solving intuition.  If you feel you have a keen mind and some extra patience, then good on you.  As for me, I'd recommend something like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/631570/Whispers_of_a_Machine/]Whispers of a Machine[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198035798418', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1598583990}
review: Excellent point & click. Pour quelqu'un qui lit beaucoup de science-fiction, l'histoire est légèrement prévisible, mais reste le point fort du jeu. Les casses-têtes sont difficiles, mais justes, à l'exception de quelques mécaniques qui sont franchement obscures, mais cela reste dans l'optique d'un jeu de ce style, qui se veut un peu rétro. Recommandé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1603015819}
review:
[b]Un très bon point&click de science-fiction![/b]

! Un patch FR existe !


Dans la ville futuriste de Newton, une IA omniprésente nommée [i]Central[/i] gère entièrement la ville, dirige le CEL (une agence qui regroupe tous les services publics de la ville, dont la police) et intervient à tout moment dans la vie de citoyens hyper-connectés. Une série d'assassinats est attribuée à celui qu'on appelle le [i]Mindjacker[/i] car il extrait des infos du cerveau de ses victimes.


On contrôle alternativement trois personnages dans [i]Technobabylon[/i] : un vieux flic du CEL réfractaire à la technologie, sa collègue davantage soucieuse de procédures et une jeune addict à la Trance (une forme d'Internet en réalité virtuelle). Chacun d'eux apporte de la diversité dans le gameplay en fonction de leurs capacités en cyber-technologie.

Le scénario reprend des thèmes classiques de la SF notamment sur l'évolution des sociétés humaines, la définition de l'humanité, les perspectives et limites de l'IA, le monde virtuel, les avantages et les risque de l'ultra connectivité ou encore les addictions. Deux conclusions sont possibles selon un choix crucial effectué vers la fin de l'aventure.

Les dialogues sont particulièrement riches et très nombreux avec beaucoup de pnj qui ont chacun leur personnalité et une existence crédible.
Il y a souvent beaucoup à lire ou à réfléchir et le risque est parfois de perdre le fil de tous les aspects du scénario après une longue conversation ou pendant qu'on tente de surmonter les obstacles qui se dressent devant nous mais les dialogues offrent toujours la possibilité de récapituler la situation avec nos interlocuteurs (et c'est bien plus agréable qu'une banale liste d'objectifs).

La progression n'est pas si facile même si tous les problèmes ont des solutions logiques et cohérentes : manipulations correctes d'appareils, combinaisons adéquates d'objets, récolte consciencieuse d'indices, observation attentive de l'environnement seront notamment nécessaires. Les amateurs du genre vont adorer mais les joueurs moins familiers des point&click vont peut-être galérer un peu ici ou là.

L'exploration est récompensée par le découverte de davantage d'éléments sur l'univers et de détails de l'histoire. De nombreuses petites variantes permettent d'obtenir de nombreux succès (perso, j'en ai eu 25/40 en ayant pourtant terminés les 2 fins).

Si la mort est possible, elle reste absolument sans conséquence car notre progression reprend simplement après annulation de l'action fatale.


Le jeu est très agréable visuellement malgré les gros pixels à l'ancienne, l'ambiance cyberpunk est réussie, les environnements sont plaisants et bien animés, la musique est soignée et toujours adéquate et les doublages (en anglais) sont convaincants.
Une bonne traduction FR est disponible grâce au patch FR de [i]planete-aventure.net[/i].

Il y a enfin une possibilité d'activer les commentaires des développeurs qui apportent des éléments très intéressants sur l'élaboration du jeu et ses modifications par rapport à sa première version. Cette fonctionnalité n'est jamais envahissante dans le jeu.



Vraiment recommandé aux fans de point&click et de science-fiction.

J'ai bien aimé.




[quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067265072', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1600546554}
review:
Wow! Technobabylon. What can you say. Certainly one of the best Point & Click Adventure Games i have ever played. A game where everything comes together to  be the perfect Point & Click experience. No fancy stuff needed, just good old fashioned development by a very simple formula. Focus on the core elements of a well made adventure game, take the bits and pieces from some of those great games, mix them together and enjoy the delightful outcome.

- Amazing Cyperpunk/SciFi Setting.
- Some great Science-Fiction ideas and some great references to books, movies and other games.
- Well-written story and dialogues. Just for the story alone it's worth playing.
- Well-implemented Main and Side Charackters.
- Fantastic atmosphere in which you get sucked right into from the start, until the very end.
- Wonderful Art and Soundtrack.
- Terrific Voice Acting. Really one of the best i have seen in a long time.
- Challenging Puzzles, but never unfair and they never really disturb the game flow. Except for one part of the last puzzle, which is just a mess.

I played with commentary on and it was absolutely worth it. Getting the explanation for every scene, like what they where thinking at that moment and what references the used, what kind of people the devs are. That background really was the icing on the cake for me. 
So if you like that kind of games don't think twice, you wont find anything better out there. If it is'nt your type of game normally ,it just might be the kickstarter you need to get into this beautiful genre. Highly recommended and well worth the money. Ok, i think i've run out of superlatives here. ^^

Ps.: Keep up the good work at Wadjet Eye and Technocrat. Thanks!

Personal score: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994339774', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1700735674}
review:
Nie mam najlepszych doświadczeń z grami, przy których tworzeniu udział miało Wadjet Eye Games. Pozornie ten producent/wydawca przygodówek spełnia wszystkie wytyczne dobrych point’n’clicków: ładne pixelartowe grafiki, porządne udźwiękowienia (muzyka + dialogi), ciekawe światy przedstawione… A jednak nie umiem wymienić ani jednego tytułu sygnowanego nazwą Wadjet Eye, który zrobiłby na mnie pozytywne wrażenie. 

Nie zmienił tego Technobabylon, który w moim mniemaniu jest mierną grą przygodową, powielającą błędy narracyjne i najgorsze grzechy gameplay’owe gier z lat dziewięćdziesiątych. 

Zaczynając od początku – gry jako medium artystyczne w zakresie kontaktu z widzem osadziłbym blisko filmów. Tym samym moim zdaniem gry i filmy nie mają tego komfortu, jaki mają książki, czyli możliwości spokojnego, czasem żmudnego wprowadzania do świata, osadzania nas w nim poprzez ekspozycję. Oczywiście nie znaczy to, że nie ma książek, które by wrzucały nas w wir akcji od razu – ale jeśli tego nie czynią, albo robią to nieumiejętnie, nie jest to wielką zadrą. Tymczasem wstępy do gier spod stajni Wadjet Eye… są po prostu nudne. Nie ma niczego, co by nas naprawdę zainteresowało i zmotywowało do poznania reszty historii. Postaci zdają się bardzo płytkie, bo gra stara się je nam przedstawiać przez całą długość rozgrywki.  Świat przedstawiony skumulowany jest do jednej, maksymalnie dwóch lokacji naszpikowanej zagadkami. Wydaje mi się, że początkowe poziomy, swego rodzaju prologi, stanowić mają samouczek dla graczy. I może ma to sens dla początkujących, ale osadzenie takiego samego rozwiązania w każdym tytule jest po prostu… męczące, żmudne i niekreatywne. Autorzy traktują nas jak dzieci, chcąc wytłumaczyć banały, którymi w grach operujemy od trzydziestu lat – a jednocześnie nie mówiąc przy tym niczego, co faktycznie przydałoby się w rozwiązywaniu zagadek.

Tymczasem zagadki – clou gier przygodowych – naprawdę kuleją w Technobabylon. Większość, jeśli nie 100% zagadek wykorzystuje logikę z pogranicza „księżycowej”, odwołując się do „moon logic” znanego z gier lat dziewięćdziesiątych. Ponadto wszystkie rozwiązania są bardzo tendencyjne – mam na myśli to, że twórcy upatrzyli sobie jedną, jedyną solucję dla określonego problemu i nie tolerują żadnych odstępstw od przewidzianej drogi. To gra przygodowa, ale nie czułem się, że wczuwam w protagonistów, a próbowałem domyślić się, co miał autor na myśli – nie, co zrobiłby mój bohater, a co takiego oczekuje ode mnie deweloper. Poza tym, iż część zagadek jest żmudna, to okazują się one często dziecinnymi – ich poziom skomplikowania nie jest wygórowany, jest niemal trywialny, ale oczekuje od nas łowów na określony pixel lub mozolnego powtarzania sekwencji celem odkrycia tej prawidłowej, którą upatrzyli sobie autorzy.  Nie ma tutaj satysfakcjonującej dedukcji tylko absurdalne klikanie wszystkiego na wszystkim, będące niekreatywnym zabiegiem w przygodówkach służącym sztucznemu wydłużaniu rozgrywki, którego po prostu nie znoszę.

Powracając do tematu świata przedstawionego i fabuły – bo moim zdaniem to, obok zagadek, siła przygodówek i aspekt, który może uratować nawet okraszoną beznadziejnymi puzzlami rozgrywkę. Technobabylon ma słaby scenariusz. Znaczna część gry to dialogi – które nie okazują się niczym innym, jak wypluwaniem na nasze ekrany masy ekspozycji, przeważnie w rozmowie między postaciami, które już to wiedzą. Wiedza więc w formie ekspozycji ma trafić do nas, do odbiorców. Jest to zrobione nieudolnie, nierzadko żenuje, przeważnie irytuje.
Ponadto gra stara się zmusić nas do przejmowania się wydarzeniami, które tak naprawdę nas nie obchodzą – głównie dlatego, że zostały nam przedstawione w sposób nijaki, w zalewie masy informacji, którą przeklikaliśmy, lub bez żadnego build-upu. Jeśli opowiadasz nam o czymś po raz pierwszy, przedstawiasz to jako „bardzo ważne” (bez żadnego kontekstu lub zrozumienia odbiorcy), i na tej podstawie starasz się zbudować emocje… to po prostu nie zadziała, wszystko okaże się płytkie, a widz będzie co najwyżej zdenerwowany. Zwłaszcza, jeśli dzieje się w to grze – w której chcielibyśmy mieć wybór lub wpływ na decyzję bohatera. Tymczasem nie rozumiejąc wyborów naszych protagonistów mamy się przejmować ich losami.
Powyższe doprawione jest nijakimi dialogami – ach, nijakie to przynajmniej obojętne… nie, większość rozmów w grze, zwłaszcza w pierwszej połowie, jest po prostu głupia i wymuszona. Zdaje się, iż oglądamy przedstawienie teatralne dla dzieci, a nie rozmowę pomiędzy niby rzeczywistymi postaciami. Co chwilę łapiemy się za głowę dziwiąc się tępocie bohaterów lub sensowności wypowiedzianych właśnie słów. W drugiej części gry ulega to nieznacznej poprawie, ale niemiłe uczucie pozostaje do samego końca. Nie pomaga w tym wszystkim wpychany gdzieniegdzie na siłę, a więc nieśmieszny, humor.
Niestety świat poznajemy nie przez interakcję z nim – tylko przez przydługawe ekspozycje, niemalże jak w programów dla dzieci, w których Podróżniczka Dora próbuje nam wszystko dobrze wytłumaczyć. Albo zabrakło inwencji u autorów, albo mają oni graczy za bandę d…zieci.
W trakcie rozgrywki fabuła coraz bardziej rozjeżdża się w szwach, wszystko zdaje się bezsensowne: motywacje postaci, ich wybory, ciągi przyczynowo-skutkowe… Mamy raczej wrażenie oglądania gorączkowego koszmaru, a nie rozsądnie poprowadzonej narracji. I to nie jest nawet nieszablonowy, odkrywczny koszmar – lecz pełznący po ziemi truposz dobrej fabuły. Pod koniec zdaje się, że wiele rzeczy było wciskanych na siłę, aby tylko jako tako się zgadzało – przez co jedynym odczuciem, jakie faktycznie się przebija, jest niezręczność sprawców Technobabylon.
Nieciekawy jest również sam świat, a sposób w jaki go odkrywamy na pewno nie pomaga. Każdy kolejny oklepany do bólu cyberpunk z wieczną nocą poruszający znowu te same problemy (ale w gorszy sposób) musi rozczarowywać.

Szwankuje również zrównoważenie między dialogami a zagadkami – niemal każda lokacja składa się z długich dialogów, po których następuje sekwencja wielu łamigłówek. W rezultacie nudzimy się jednym i drugim, przestajemy skupiać się na wydarzeniach, marzymy już o przejściu do kolejnej części rozgrywki – i tak w koło Macieju. Zabrakło wyczucia rytmu.
We wszystkim nie pomaga grafika – chociaż porządnie wykonana technicznie, zdawała się po prostu… niepasująca? Nie umiem znaleźć odpowiednio wyrażenia, ale czułem się wyalienowany przez samą oprawę graficzną – a nie przez to, co ona miała symbolizować. Na plus zaliczyłbym mimo wszystko udźwiękowienie dialogów, to zawsze miły dodatek, jeśli jest to wykonane na dobrym poziomie, i tutaj akurat Technobabylon nie zawiodło. Ale to za mało. Definitywnie nie polecam.

(edycja recenzji dotyczy poprawienia błędów z akapitami w tekście).

author: {'steamid': '76561198293429040', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1596512506}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988904686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1600136773}
review:
8.5/10
What can I say? It's another quality adventure game from Wadjet Eye.  I've been going through their back catalog in random order, and was, again, surprised at how well written and designed this was. Really, I could copy and past my review from any of their games as they all have the same quality writing, old-school artwork, good voice acting, and clever puzzles.  This one has a similar narrative to Gemini Rue, another dystopian cyberpunk thriller, but I feel like this one has a more compelling story and characters.  This one took me a bit longer to get through (about 7.5 hours as opposed to the usual 6), and as usual I wish I had a little more time in this world to explore and learn more about these characters and the world they inhabit.  Still well worth checking out. These guys are the best at what they do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033189810', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1600123523}
review:
This is one of the best sci-fi (cyberpunk?) stories I've ever experienced. The game is beautiful in every possible way - decent story, well-developed characters, even over-pixeled graphics looks good and well placed. Spoiler-free speaking, the story gives you enough choice to fill in control of a game, but not enough freedom to spoil characters' decisions based on their motivations that were developed during storytelling. The game raises eternal philosophical questions about the future of humanity, AI place in it, the free will of the people, and how far shall de determine the course of the development society by democratic measures or by the power of will of a concrete individual. And the best thing is that the game doesn't give you easy answers. 
The game focuses more on the story more than on riddles so it's not a challenge to figure out what to do to move forward. I suggest this game to everyone who loves quests and a well-told story, especially near-future sci-fi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012564453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1597038585}
review:
TECHNOBABYLON
Développé par Technocrat Games (2015)

Technobabylon est un jeu d’aventure cyberpunk qui fait honneur aux grands titres de l’âge d’or du point-and-click. Les mécaniques et le style du jeu rappellent de grands classiques comme King’s Quest ou Gabriel Knight, tandis que l’univers évoque tout de suite Blade Runner ou Beneath a Steel Sky. Le récit regorge de tournures surprenantes, parfois tortueuses, et le jeu propose dans l’ensemble une expérience mémorable et passionnante.

+ Mécaniques simples et fluides
+ Superbes ambiances visuelles et sonores
+ Univers, récit et personnages bien développés
+ Puzzles exigeants mais logiques
+ Gameplay changeant et multiples protagonistes
– Récit un peu tortueux

EXCELLENT si vous cherchez:
+ Une dystopie cyberpunk brutale
+ Des personnages de science-fiction attachants

À ÉVITER si vous cherchez:
– Un récit réaliste
– Une aventure humoristique

9.2 /10 Shnapenn’s Choice
Publié le 18 août 2020



*** Visitez le Shnapenn's Choice pour lire la critique complète:
https://shnapenn.com/ ***

*** Pour suivre la page Curateur du Shnapenn's Choice:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33186693/ ***
