author: {'steamid': '76561198135828936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1597157107}
review: Fun and well written little indie point-and-click adventure game. I like that you get to play as several characters and experience the story from different points of view. They are well voice acted and fleshed out. The puzzles make sense, and you can figure them out by paying attention. I feel adventure games often have some non-sequiturs and silly problems, but that's not the case here. Maybe veterans of the genre would call the game easy, but I found putting the clues together rewarding. Sometimes the solutions were really funny! Definitely recommended, especially if you enjoy cyberpunk / scifi e.g. Shadowrun or Deus Ex series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031030399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1617540597}
review: Schönes Spiel welches Retro-Grafik, Adventure im Stil der 90er, Cyberpunk und sehr gutes Storytelling miteinander vermischt. Es erzeugt ein schönes Sci-Fi und Cyberpunk-Feeling und die Rätsel sind meistens logisch und schnell, aber nicht zu schnell lösbar. Die Musik passt sehr gut zum Setting und untermalt das Spiel sehr schön und passend. Kompliment an den Komponisten. Leider hat das Spiel einen kleinen Bug, der aber nicht stört und über den man ohne Problemen hinwegsehen kann. Fans von Sci-Fi und Cyberpunk sowie allen die gerne Retro-Adventures spielen kann ich es nur wärmstens empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013646345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1597025447}
review:
I first heard about this game after some boring-sounding scrub started a Steam community thread a couple years back titled "Tricked by SJWs again" and complained about "gay interracial marriage"and "lesbian robots" or something. And -gasp- "trans people being seen as ubiquitous." In a cyberpunk game set in the late 21st century. Oh the humanity!

Anyway, this is a fantastic game and I wholeheartedly recommend it. The story is great, and they do well setting up suspenseful atmospheres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413350620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1595805525}
review:
[i]'Once you trust a self-driving car with your life, you pretty much will trust Artificial Intelligence with anything.' - Dave Waters[/i]

[b]Technobabylon[/b] is a gaming experience that, like most Cyberpunk themes, offers up the ideal escapist environment where you can swim deeply in the waves of futuristic possibilities yet never once feel the illusion dissolve into rational disbelief.  I was able to be carried along by the plot's varying themes of: an AI-controlled society complete with hackers striving to break down the barriers, a world of terrorism, an environment where virtual escapism into the [u]Trance[/u] is an essential way of living all intermixed with scientific research aimed at breaking beyond the next evolving stages.  

Does the story's appeal stem from the human desire to always strive toward the next historical achievements that makes it so attractive? 
Is it the realisation that no matter what the pivotal strides in technology there is always going to be a human element that is affected? 
Or is it all of this alongside the refreshing humour that is the secret ingredient keeping the player attracted like a magnet to filings? 
I know with complete certainty that players will take an immediate liking to [i]Cheffie/Chantelle[/i] who is just one of the unforgettable AI's and I cannot dismiss the 3 central characters either as each of them hold an appeal that never waivers throughout the whole experience. Whether it be [b]Charlie[/b] the mature bio-engineer turned CEL agent whose past haunts his every decision, or his CEL partner [b]Max[/b] with the street-wise crime laden history - there is no denying they make a formidable team each with their own strengths and strong personalities.  
But... it would be unjust to not talk of the young, [i]Trance[/i] addict [b]Latha[/b] who we meet at the very start of the game within a puzzle escape room chapter that will test the patience of anyone. Believe me, this first chapter is easily one of the toughest of the whole game and is a true test of what to expect going forward in how you will think logically and of the need to explore every single option available no matter how far-reaching. It is that solution that will be a template for the remainder of the puzzle solving going forward.

The story interlinks in a slow burning way yet, as you gradually build towards the twisting finale, it all slots into place; for me it felt like reaching a concluding season's end to an addicting sci-fi show where you develop such a bond with the characters, the world, the plot twists and the engaging puzzles interspersed with multi-choice branching for two opposing possibilities for an ending.

The artwork is exceptional in its simplicity where a 2D world is made to feel like a 3D one, the music is a blend of styles all aimed at the chapter themes, the point&click environment not too ridiculous in its options and an unforgettable VA experience that magnificently completes this in such a way that deserves recognition for what it delivers to the game.
There is a variety of settings to choose from, including a commentary option that is as equally entertaining as the story itself. 
There are over 40 achievements that, much like the chapters, vary from unlocking multi choice actions to a very challenging 'Gravball' game that really tests reaction and timing skills. There are save options available anytime in-game and it features an autosave that allows you to return back to the start of that chapter (if no autosave is made at the time) which is invaluable for those wanting to unlock all multi-choices in one sitting. 

The themes do vary from virtual game addiction, hacking, AI vs corrupt society and some themes that unexpectedly relate to embryos and much more so expect a wide ranging journey all tackled with a wonderful tongue in cheek humour to diffuse the heaviness of the subject matter.
The only possible downside to this for players could be that it is heavily filled with cut-scenes in each chapter so if you are not a fan of 'listening' to plots being fleshed out and, instead, prefer your games to be all action with yourself in the driving seat consistently then you may quickly lose attention span here. But hey, that's what the skip button is for right?
On the other hand, if you are a huge fan of Cyberpunk and thrive in this environment then trust me when I say there is satisfaction guaranteed with this title even if the price seems high, I assure you this is one gaming experience that you won't forget.

~~~ Liked what you see? You can find more reviews at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32839633]Have a Word[/url]~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198287210017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1595842217}

author: {'steamid': '76561198189257809', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1595778391}
review:
推荐给文字冒险爱好者，特别是喜欢赛博朋克题材的。

Technobabylon是Dave Gilbert参与监制配音的另一款Wadjet Eye Games发行的点点点游戏，可惜这次只有对话有配音，很多观察物件是没有语音的。
作为一款AVG，可以改进的地方也有很多。可检查物件的UI提示、快步走到下一个场景等等这些quality-of-life的功能都没有。有些对话的间隔没有调好导致情感表达地很奇怪等。。

剧情方面，故事的主线设计地还不错，但是具体“执行"有很多让人觉得不自然或者仓促的地方；角色塑造算是比较成功，几个角色都挺有个性的。

总的来说，是一款完成度很高，而且有不少新奇的赛博朋克世界观设定的文字冒险游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970957522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1595774546}
review:
Love pixel art a point & click, and this really appeased the itch. The story was fantastic, with some great twists along the way, and thoroughly shocked to find out that this entire game was built in the freely available Adventure Game Studio!

+ Brilliant story
+ In-depth world-building
+ Conceivable science-fiction
+ Likeable characters
+ Great puzzles
+ Stunning artwork

- Puzzle interactions sometimes a little lost in the background art (difficult to identify a pipe as an interactive object for example)
- Complicated repeated game mechanics (CI Splitter for example, explained how to use once early on, but then expected to be used 2 to 3 more times throughout the rest of the game without a reminder on how to use it)

Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078868278', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1595250959}
review:
Technobabylon has everything I'd expect from a good point'n'click game that doesn't amaze with beautiful, modern graphics. The moment you focus on the brilliant story, well-animated dialogue portraits and feel the world, you forget about the pixel-graphics. The story is intriguing, well-described and immersive... and not so distant, to be honest - it might actually happen at some point, which is kind of scary.

Game controls are good and intuitive. I really liked the "Trance" mode which allows you to interact with things in the virtual world. It adds another good layer to the already great gameplay.

The story itself is intriguing, as I mentioned. Long enough to not regret it ending too soon, yet not too long to get you bored. It has a couple of plot twists, plus there are multiple playable characters with unique personalities.

I recommend it to any point'n'click fans out there, which like thick atmosphere and immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043283892', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1590299673}
review:
Growing up with games such as Monkey Island, Discworld and Simon the Sorcerer, point and click adventure games hold a special place in my heart. However, having the attention span of a goldfish, I rarely finish a game from beginning to end and have found it especially difficult to revisit this specific genre. I stumbled upon Technobabylon by mistake and immediately played it through start to finish. It is a remarkable achievement by such a small team and really doesn't seem to get the attention it deserves.

While everyone is different, I absolutely loves the story. The artwork and music are perfect for the setting and tone. If you have any interest in point & click adventures or are on the fence about Technobabylon then take my advice and purchase it. You will not regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030819562', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1595000138}
review: Completed the game in 9 hours, but it felt longer because I was so immersed. Top notch voice acting, fascinating story and a world that made you wish the game was larger with more places to explore and people to meet. I think I enjoyed this game almost as much Fate of Atlantis and Quest for Glory I.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022878085', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1595136933}
review:
My favorite so far of all the Wadjet games. I loved the gritty cyberpunk setting and the numerous ways they told you about the world through storytelling. The story is good and leaves you wanting more. 

My only complaint is that I wish we got more cases and hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048962752', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1594405860}
review:
Another SCI-FI masterpiece by Wadjet Eye Games & Co. 
Nuff said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075881615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1592785261}
review: Fantastic cyberpunk story with enough depth to be a novel. The puzzles are unique and really fun but I did have to look at a walkthrough a few times. That said, this is one of the most enjoyable games I've played in a long time and I've since picked up most of the other Wadjet Eye games during the Steam summer sale. Don't sleep on this game because of the pixel art graphics or the slower-paced point-and-click gameplay - the story and voice acting are incredible and if you like the cyberpunk genre, you will enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000292173', 'num_games_owned': 1171, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3194, 'last_played': 1594617478}
review:
Fantastic sci-fi mystery adventure with tons of depth, incredible worldbuilding, and memorable characters with complex back stories...

Technobabylon is a MUST for anyone who loves a great story, beautifully told.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089283671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1593, 'last_played': 1594356330}
review: Amazing game!  I liked everything about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039644731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1594214299}
review: Good cyberpunk atmosphere, engaging story, decent graphics and music, well thought out riddles, excellent voice acting. Only at the end it felt a little bit long-winded.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963628015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1594157640}
review:
A fun dystopian cyberpunk point and click adventure.

I definitely had a good time with Technobabylon. The story was pretty solid (although you'll probably figure out mostly what's going on fairly early) and the characters are likeable. The puzzle set pieces are fairly self contained within a few screens so no hunting all over the map to find an item or solution.

Good points:
[list]
  [*]Good story and writing
  [*]Sensible puzzles that (mostly!) make logical sense - much less "try everything with everything" than other games!
  [*]Retro art - very reminiscent of old Sierra adventures - you get used to the pixelly look pretty quickly!
  [*]Creative solutions to problems involving several mediums - and more than one way to solve some puzzles!
  [*]You can die - but unlike old Sierra games it's not fatal! Intelligent autosaves mean no silly "didn't save for 3 hours? haha you've lost your progress" moments.
[/list]

Bad bits:
[list]
  [*]Dialogue, though well written is somewhat verbose in places and I found myself skim reading and skipping through
  [*]Controls (though mostly straight forward) aren't explained
  [*]Sometimes a bit *too* much narrative and not enough puzzle
  [*]No "show interactive objects" command so some screens are a bit of a pixel hunt (though not too bad)
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198145661544', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1594061001}
review:
Don't let this diamond slip your eyes because of it's blunt graphics. I do not like all those new adventure games not bothering with the graphics design and settling for this pixelated mess, which seems to be a panacea for all indie games and latest adventure games. Still you have to know this game is a masterpiece.

Firstly it appeals to all who are into the science fiction genre, kind of neuromancer style in an advanced cyberpunk world. This cyberpunk theme is not just the setting, but also utilized in a clever way and embedded into the gameplay itself, which means you will affect the physical world through your actions in cyberspace. The music score is right and the sound design is right too. The core of this game's brilliance ofcourse is the writing. The script is magnificent and thankfully renditioned masterfully by voice actors. Your choices matter and there is some flexibility on your approach on the game's riddles. The plot is fantastic with enough twists as well as not overcomplicating itself making clear towards the end what is really going on and what your goal is. Difficulty wise it's fine, only classic puzzles, all making sense as they would in the real world. No random guesses, no pixel hunting (except for ONE puzzle near the end of the game), just logic and resolve is needed to get you through the game. Took me about 10 hours without the help of guides and whatnot, definitely a worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035632391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1593886816}
review: This was a fun sci-fi adventure.  All point-and-click.  Lots of investigation and puzzles.  Three different characters are used throughout the story.  Technically four, but one is dialogue only.  The choices you make affect different parts of the game, but the ending is still decided close to the end.  The plot is intricate, but not too difficult to follow.  Overall, if you liked other adventure titles by this developer, you'll like this one no doubt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967680889', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1593886673}
review: I really enjoyed this. On the point and click side there's some interesting puzzles which are fun to interact with (the CI splitter was particularly engaging). There are some tricky points where the link isn't immediately obvious but on the whole, nothing so abstract that you can't figure it out with a little patient thought. On the cyberpunk side it's a solid hit. The tone and degree of humour fit well and the characters and dialogue are well written. The voice acting is great and really helps bring it to life. I've seen some users compare this to Whispers of a Machine, having played both I feel that whilst this game might be more linear it has a bit more charm. All in all, it was two enjoyable evenings of nostalgic gaming and given the sale price, worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088447834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1593823763}
review:
[h1]This should not have been a game.[/h1]

Technobabylon scratches a lot of market itches; it hearkens back to many hallmark cyberpunk aesthetic details to build a universe that feels lived-in, accessible, familiar, and philosophically intriguing while also populating said world with realized, nuanced characters that drive the narrative. And what an engrossing narrative it is! Technobabylon's mystery-thriller story is easily its strongest selling point and I cannot overstate that. There are plot twists, tense reveals, a few heart-breaking moments, and even some stomach-turns thrown in. It's an experience brought to life beautifully by high-quality vocal performances, decent if underutilized synth and techno music, solid character and background artwork, and butter-smooth animations. The effort in the audio-visual aspects of this game leave next to nothing to be desired.

But for all the writing and artistic prowess on display, Technobabylon has a devastating Achilles' heel: abysmal gameplay.

This isn't my first time playing a point-and-click adventure game. I had the chance to play (and replay multiple times) the more recent Whispers of a Machine not long ago, and it set a very high bar for what a point-and-click detective game can do. Choices the player makes genuinely matter, and I don't just mean in the context of the narrative (which is known to be limited), but rather in the actual [b]ways[/b] the user plays the game; depending on your style of play, your character will receive different upgrades, essentially forcing you to find alternative solutions to certain puzzles. THIS is how you add replay-ability to a puzzle game, not just by having cheap alternate endings (or else it would have been supremely cruel to have no manual saving). Whispers of a Machine uses alternate endings to entice the player to play in different styles. That is absolutely genius, and I want to see that more often.

Suffice it to say, Technobabylon has absolutely no play-style variety. It's just straight linear gameplay with frustrating pixel-hunt puzzles that only very rarely have more than one solution, and these few puzzles never have any impact on the narrative at large. More infuriating than the pixel-hunting, however, is that these puzzles are obnoxiously NOT intuitive. They're difficult to solve not because they pose a significant cognitive challenge, but because the user almost always ends up saying, "Oh, come the heck on...! How could I have known to do THAT?!?!". Even worse is the total lack of any kind of helpful tutorial; the player is just thrown in the deep end with a bunch of sci-fi gizmos and just expected to know how to use them (you better have read the complete works of William Gibson and Shirow Masamune...). Proper explanation of what you could do with certain items is also missing; how the heck should I know that the tissue paper I took is supposed to collect blood from a surface I can't even tell HAS blood on it? In what way is it intuitive that a police detective would use non-sterilized tissue paper from a TOILET to gather evidence in a HOMICIDE INVESTIGATION? Forgive me if I don't want to spend 15 hours clicking away in random combinations of items, objects, and locations trying to advance the awesome story which has stopped dead because I don't know what to do. I argue, then, that the best way to play this game is to just have windowed mode enabled and a walkthrough open in your Internet browser that you reference frequently. I never needed a walkthrough in Whispers of a Machine because its puzzles aren't based solely on how wild your sci-fi imagination is, but instead on how good a detective you are. For Technobabylon, I needed a walkthrough within the first 10 minutes of gameplay, which is utterly ridiculous.

It's disappointing that Technobabylon shackles itself to the medium of video games when it clearly would have been more functional as a novel or television series (I mean, if Altered Carbon could get made, that's proof enough people will eat up just about any cyberpunk material). As it stands, Technobabylon needs a complete and total overhaul because nothing about its game design works, and that is such an absolute shame. I was genuinely excited when I bought Technobabylon, and I 100% wanted to love it, but while I have praised and will continue to praise its ambitious and nuanced story, great voice work, and impressive visuals, I'm left with a horrible taste in my mouth from how poor of a point-and-click adventure game it is. As such, I can't give it a good recommendation.

Happy gaming!
- LC

author: {'steamid': '76561198040686647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1446, 'last_played': 1593753885}
review: Great story and voice acting especially for an indie game. Not 24 hours long, I was just idling a lot. But still a decent chunk of story time. If you like cyberpunk and old school point and click adventure, this is a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132035218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1593660337}
review:
I usually don't play games like this but on a lark I pulled the trigger on Technobabylon and two other similar games. I usually prefer more action/twitch/arcade style games, but what can I say? 

I loved every minute of it. The story was good, the characters were great, and the puzzles for the most part were logical, although on two or three occasions I definitely looked up solutions.

It felt like a really good season of a TV series. I'm glad I took a chance on it as a whole new genre has opened up to me. 

Even if this isn't your usual thing give it a try, you're missing out on a great game otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990353319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1593878950}
review:
Fantastic game with a fantastic story. Don't let the old-school graphics fool you. If you like graphic adventures and/or the cyberpunk style you will definitely enjoy this game.

For me, totally worth buying even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005231111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1593556862}
review: Great adventure game with good acting voices and fantastic plot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993808972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1593403002}
review: I loved this game. Really looking forward to revisiting Newton in the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000326220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1593323937}
review:
I came looking for a salve to the Cyberpunk 2077 delay. I found a gem of an adventure game, albeit a rough cut in some places.

PROS:
- Gritty, neon art style with excellent pixel work.
- Haunting techno soundtrack.
- Most of the cast is well voiced.
- Replay value via decision points in the story.

CONS:
- Puzzle logic flimsy in some places.
- Ran into one sequence break that forced me to reload a distant save.
- Can be unclear on what or where you can interact.
- Some animation bugs.

Recommend To:
- Fans of Curse of Monkey Island or similar games.
- Fans of Cyberpunk fiction looking to jack in for 8-10 hours.
- Older fans of narrative driven games who save often.

Also Check Out:
- Unavowed: Same dev team and game format, but overall more evolved in terms of narrative, characters and puzzle elements. Different game tone (Urban fiction), but highly recommend if you're here for more than just hearing phrases like "meatspace" and "netiquette."

author: {'steamid': '76561198207829972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1593312145}
review:
Awesome game but frustratingly difficult at times.  Art, story, characters, and voice acting were all excellent.  I am a 20+ year veteran of point-and-click games and this was definitely one of the hardest.  I was stuck a good half dozen times, but it was worth it.  

The worst puzzle was at the end of the game where I had no idea how to use a certain inventory item, because you don't access it a "normal" way.  The second hardest involved DNA sequencing, WRITE THINGS DOWN when you get to that point unless you feel like memorizing a bunch of scientific names (there is a clue for this section, but I didn't notice it until I read a guide after beating it).  There is no in-game clue notebook like in some games, and very few repeating dialogue options, so if you're going to walk away from the game it's best to write some things down to not forget.

Also, I had the speed cranked up for most of the game, but had to tone it down to beat a few areas.  My best advice is to not get too caught up in dialogue options and scrolling through computer text unless you're stuck, or you'll be listening/reading for HOURS.  You also have to get used to "jacking into the matrix" or whatever they call it pretty much anytime you're in a dead-end.

For under $4 on sale this was a great afternoon/evening of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993099828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1591218603}
review:
A pretty good story pretty well delivered. Maybe a bit too easy on the puzzles. In each section of the story there is a very limited set of screens to move between (usually 2-3) and use items in.

Pro-tip: do read the news terminal in your inventory every now and then throughout the game, there are a few bits of information which explain the setting in a very satisfying way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972753215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1643887238}
review: The world they created and the story are pretty amazing.  Puzzles are solid but some require a little more hunting that I was willing to do, so I did use a guide for some of it.  Definitely worth the journey and payoff at the end of about 8 hours of gameplay/story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969995293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1591825460}
review:
Although being terribly named, Technobabylon is not only one of the best modern point-and-click adventure games, but one of the very best of its entire genre.

[+] Great artworks and animations
[+] Very well-written story, which is unpredictable and captivating
[+] Great voice actors
[+] Good soundtrack
[+] Overall good and logical puzzles
[+] Great setting/lore and background story
[+] Different solution paths for some riddles
[+] Different endings
[+] The game addresses equality in a natural and non-preachy way
[+] Long playtime
[+] The game offers some freedom for optional exploration
[+] Optional audio commentary from the developers
[+] Fair price (~$15)

[-] Only English language supported (audio/subtitles)
[-] Most characters feel underdeveloped, making them less relatable and more detached from the player
[-] Although I appreciate the game's overall serious tone, a tiny dose of more humour in the right places would have been appreciated
[-] The game's title is poorly chosen

[u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u]
Technobabylon is a must-play for fans of point-and-click adventure games, especially if they also like the science fiction or cyberpunk genres.

What stands out the most is the great writing in this game. The story pulls the player in, as it's interesting and unpredictable. Furthermore, the game's fictional world and future is presented to the player in a way that is not overburdening or boring, as the game provides small pieces of information over the course of the entire game, so that the player slowly completes the whole picture. A lot of this information is actually optional and to be discovered by curious players by exhausting all dialog options or by reading the latest in-game news.

Most of the characters are interesting, but sadly the playable characters miss for the most part a deeper and personal dimension. As a result, the game misses the opportunity to make them more relatable and likable. I did not dislike the characters, but the game did not make me care enough about them that I was ever worried if they would die or not. This could maybe have been solved by highlighting the characters' personal lives and quirks in a less serious and slightly more humorous way, which would also have shaken up the overall serious tone of the game once in a while. Having said that, I do appreciate the game's serious approach to science fiction/cyberpunk and its story, and better have less humour than a lot of the bad kind.

The soundtrack is well-composed and an integral part of the game's cyberpunk atmosphere. It's not the kind of soundtrack that is focussing too heavily on specific themes for characters or locations, but rather prefers to stay in the background most of the time to enhance the current situation's mood in a subtle and non-distracting way. As a result, the tracks work very well while playing the game, but it's not the kind of soundtrack I come back to for listening outside of the game (with the exception of one track, that indeed stuck in my head for a while after I finishing the game).

The puzzles are fair, I was never completely stuck nor had to look up a solution, but sometimes it took me a moment to progress in some sitatuations. I would rate the difficulty as "medium" to "advanced" for seasoned point-and-click adventure players. I also liked that Technobabylon sometimes offered more than one way to solve a puzzle.

The game is targeted at an adult audience, as following the story requires paying close attention and there are some depicted acts of violence in the game. On that note, if the player’s character dies as a result of a poor decision during a puzzle situation, the game immediately resets the situation, so there are no annoying loading times.

What also deserves to be positively mentioned is that the game has a generally progressive undertone towards equality in terms of cultures, sexual orientation and gender identity. I specifically call it "undertone", as the game's statements here are not constantly made, nor are they highlighted in an unnatural way that sticks out and feels preachy or shoved into the player's face -- instead, the game just implements them into the game's world in a natural given way.

I'm a fan of the point-and-click adventure game genre and can wholeheartedly say that Technobabylon is one of the best games I ever played in this genre.

Playtime: 13-14 hours
Rating: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040573839', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1592204842}
review: Another quality adventure game from Wadjet Eye. Great story and beautiful art. All of the gameplay is logical so you don't spend too much time farting around before making progress. I recommend reading the news articles in your transmitter to get a better idea of the game's dystopian setting. There are 2 endings and they are quite different, so I'd also recommend keeping an extra save to replay the last level or looking up the other one on youtube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048781423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1592196645}
review:
Pros:

* Retro style graphics
* Voice acting
* Story
* Duration
* Everything else

Cons:

* There are not enough games like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043950102', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 2048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2048, 'last_played': 1644018588}
review:
An utterly fantastic cyberpunk adventure game! Hands down my favourite Wadjet Eye Game.

Great story full of unique, creative takes on cyberpunk and future technology. The art is great, the music is wonderful. The characters are all nice, they feel fleshed out and the writing is superb. The puzzles are perfectly balanced between logic and 'video game logic', not too hard, not too easy.  The only downsides: voice acting is of inconsistent quality (as with all Wadjet Eye Games) and at the end the story does rush a little. Even on a second playthrough however, it is very compelling and captivating (and the commentary track was a treat!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977233670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1649609653}
review: nice classic retro style sci-fi adventure with logic plot and quite easy gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198028090178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1558573652}
review: Super interesting concepts and unique gameplay. Not your typical boring, obtuse adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094316672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1591742962}
review:
This is easily one of the best games by Wadjet Eye. The environments are rich and the story is engaging; you can tell that a lot of thought has gone into world-building. The puzzles are mostly excellent, only occasionally erring on the side of being unintuitive (e.g., requiring you to find the one right thing to click on in order to pair it with the one item that will make it work). 

Among the other small bones I have to pick are: the consistent mispronunciation of the military term 'corpsman' as 'corpse-man' instead of 'core-man'; the slightly racist portrayal of Ran Shou-Man; and the tired use of a protagonist that is yet another middle-aged white loner cop with a tragic past, a luddite streak, and a disregard for authority. Finally, the story is slightly overcomplicated, and the narrative makes the (human) cops out to be good guys.

Still, overall this a fun, creative work of art that is worth your time if you like point-and-click adventures and don't mind a little difficulty. 9/10 would get nuked again!

[Technical note: To get the game to run on Windows 10 without crashing my computer, I had to switch to DirectDraw from Direct3D in the setup menu!]

author: {'steamid': '76561198302948776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1591648309}
review: Buena cosa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085577509', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1591506051}
review: It suffers from the issue that a few point and clicks do, namely that even when it is obvious what need to be done the tools are hard to identify and you have to pixel hunt, but the story is very good and most of the puzzles are simple enough. Also, there is a lot of opportunity for player choice in both the narrative and gameplay, so the game is replayable to a degree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088530539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1591079323}
review: A very good point and click graphic adventure

author: {'steamid': '76561198241581252', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1591386853}
review: Nice!

review: Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025625270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1590539799}
review:
Well, first of all, the game is good. But...

... but the devs obviously couldn't resist adding "progressive-feminist-gender_equality-..." bs to it. 
Can't say if that was intentional or not, though, meaning was it meant to just describe the state of the in-game futuristic world as-is or was it a real propaganda message of "progressive values" to our real world.
Kinda sad if it's the latter, but, oh, well, can't be helped, I suppose...

author: {'steamid': '76561198254331661', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1590940837}
review: Bardzo dobrze napisana pixelartowa przygodówka z ciekawymi zagadkami w cyberpunkowym świecie. Jedna z lepszych jakie grałem :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198163977244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1586304106}
review: Good game many fans of adventure quests would love, and set in one of my favourite settings of all: a cyberpunk reality. As usual, great art, decent voice acting, and puzzles that make sense. I only wish that the writers of Wadjeteye would stop reusing characters, and come up with new ones: we've seen these types throughout the years of their activity, and these are the same characters with the same personalities and same backstories (at times - even similar appearances) as we've met and played in Blackwell series, Unavowed, Primodia, Gemini Rue, and other games of the company which titles I unfortunately forgot; as well as the general direction of the story being strikingly similar to them. And it gets irritatingly repetitive, leaving his craving, a dire need for something new - not just a new wrapper. However, if you're not familiar with their previous instalments, you'll never notice this, and have a blast going through the story. Other than that, great game which I absolutely recommend to those of us who appreciate point-and-click adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025105546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1590263362}
review: Well written story with great characters that you actually care for through the course of the game, and all of that in delicious cyberpunk dressing. Two thums up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982240437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1590179046}
review:
The story was good and had good voice acting. Overall I enjoyed the experience.

While I got stuck and had to look up some things - mainly I knew what I had to do, but the way to do it was non-obvious, or I missed the pixels that marked what I needed to click. But, I get frustrated easily, I think that other more patient people might be able to solve most of the puzzles without resorting to looking up spoilers. I also think that perhaps dialog could have given more hints, which would have helped tremendously.

I've liked everything from wadjet eye. This was published by wadjet eye, but created by other devs as far as I can tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198981297285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1590012771}
review: Es un muy buen point & click, con una historia interesante. Muy difícil y críptico por momentos, hay algunos puzzles bastante contra-intuitivos que -de todas formas- no le quitan mérito a la aventura. Especialmente recomendado para los que disfrutan historias sci-fi y bastantes diálogos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994129822', 'num_games_owned': 2200, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1589931357}
review:
Fantastic adventure game. Everything is great about this one with the exception of the graphic resolution. But you probably soon forget about that as the story, characters and atmosphere are captivating. Hope the sequel is coming soon.

Oh and having a commentary mode is an added plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994105195', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1589661926}
review: James Dearden has created a classic 90's adventure game in 2015.  This is one of the best Sci-Fi point 'n click adventures I've ever played.  If you liked "Beneath a Steel Sky," this game surpasses it on all levels.  It's a great story with great puzzles and great production value, even with the SVGA graphics.  Thoroughly impressed with this game. I wish adventure games were more popular than they are.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983280675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1568030906}
review: If you're a fan of Neuromancer and Blade Runner and you also like adventures, this is your game. The Story serves up classical Cyberpunk clichés, but i liked it. Its proper written, the art- and soundwork is great. The riddles are good to solve, so no worries for beginners and more time for the storyline :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032651414', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1589566480}
review: Interesting story, nice puzzles, atmospheric graphics and setting - what else do you need for a good cyberpunk game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000052126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1588611750}
review:
TL, DR: Terrific game, buy and play it already!

In the early 2000s I'd played through all the classic point and click games and was feeling sad when I realised there would probably never be any more games of such calibre made.  Boy was I wrong! who would have thought there was more superb stuff on the way 15 years on from Wadjeteye games?

This game simply sucked me in. The atmosphere, story and characters are all great. I love the aesthetic, witch conforms to established common Cyberpunk/film noir/Blade Runner-standards, but keeps itself sufficiently original. 

The voide acting is top notch, and the characters are believable, being rough around the edges and each having their own problems and agendas. The game is fairly linear, with minimal going between places looking for clues, since usually you'll only have a few rooms/areas active at any time until you clear the current set of puzzles.

Speaking of puzzles, the ones in Technobabylon are logical, and well thought out. That also meant that there was minimal getting stuck on puzzles. There could have been some more challenging ones but this is a matter of taste, since as is you can really concentrate on watching the story unfold. it took me about 15 hours to complete the game, and I enjoyed every minute. 

The soundtrack is really good, setting up the mood nicely, but never drawing too much attention to itself. I stopped to listen a couple of times and really liked what I heard.

This was the third Wadjet Eye Game I finished, the others being Gemini Rue and Shardlight. I recommend both of those games highly as well, though Technobabylon might just be my favorite of the three.

If you enjoy classic Lucasarts-style point and click gaming with a gritty mature edge (the plot does resolve around catching a serial killer) you owe it to yourself to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019771286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1588455674}
review: It's an iteresting and lengthy (13 hours for me) point-and-click adventure game with non-linear narrative. It has some elements of meaningful choice towards the end and you alternate playing with three different characters in different scenes throughout the game. The puzzles are OK for most of the time, even though I found some of them kind of far-fetched and hard to get, and some pixel hunting is involved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009929599', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1588183238}
review: Other than the last couple twists, I had a blast with this game. Very nice cyberpunk world with interesting characters and mostly good writing. Nice mix of abjectly horrifying and extremely funny. Includes one of my favourite adventure game characters of all time, oh my yes. Give it a shot :).

author: {'steamid': '76561199010306395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1587484521}
review:
Another gem published by Wadjet Eye, but this time made possible by Technocrat Games.

Not much to say other than if you're familiar with Wadjet Eye's work and you like sci-fi p&c games, then you're in for a treat. I'd even recommend this to someone who's never played these kinds of games.

I will admit that from the 3 playable characters, I think that one of them has a storyline that is somewhat weaker than the other 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048668312', 'num_games_owned': 11250, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1587434442}
review:
[h1]Больше  моих обзоров здесь [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33843777//] Fenol Baron Approves Curator Page[/url] [/h1]

За исключением буквально двух-трёх очень небольших моментов, связанных с особой «любовью» Adventure Game Studio  к пиксельхантингу, эта игра совершенна во всех своих ипостасях. И как приключение, и как отдельно взятая история в мире победившего киберпанка. Три персонажа, за которых нам приходится играть (довольно обычная история для игр издателя Wadjet Eye Games), оказываются в середине какого-то заговора, в который вовлечен и местный уже-почти-Скайнет, и влиятельные круги города, и таинственный душегуб, потрошащий сознание, казалось бы, случайных жертв. Большинству местных вещей даётся нормальное научное обоснование, что позволяет игре не отрываться далеко от твердой научной фантастики, но при этом и пользоваться всеми козырями, которые даёт киберпанк. Получается очень любопытная смесь, которая одновременно и пробудит внутри игрока какие-то отдалённые нотки Бегущего по лезвию, например, оставаясь при этом уникальным продуктом. История проработана от первой до последней строки, ни на секунду не возникает ощущения какой-то расслабленности у сценариста, отступления от выбранной главной линии сюжета; персонажи, окружение, даже самые незначительные вещи, выписаны настолько тщательно и красиво, что возникает ощущение, будто ты читаешь хорошую книгу.

Что касается внутриигровой части, то тут, за исключением всё тех же нескольких моментов, о которых я писал в начале, всё ощущается невероятно. Да, нужно признать, три раза вас заставят искать иголку в стогу иголок, которые, благодаря ретро-графике, еще и выглядят очень своеобразно. Но таких мест мало, и они не успевают утомить. Головоломки в игре идеально вписываются в логику происходящего, постоянно кидая вызов игроку, но в тоже время оставаясь в границах доступного понимания. Забавно, что игра одновременно и постоянно умудряется держать игрока внутри глобального сюжета, и, благодаря умелой режиссуре, фокусироваться на мелких деталях, которые делают всё происходящее куда более человечным. Героев здесь чувствуешь, а потому и драму ощущаешь куда более тонко.

«Technobabylon» - это блестящая игра. Она изначально берёт правильное направление и идёт к финалу твердым шагом, ставя точку уверенно и жестко. Или это многоточие... Хотелось бы верить в сиквел, такая история явно заслуживает продолжения.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999510733', 'num_games_owned': 1523, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1587321952}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059145520', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1587167316}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052781400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1587122384}
review:
I wanted to like this game. It has everything i enjoy. The art style, the voice acting, point and click, sci-fi. It was all there. The problem for me was the game dragged and just couldn't hold my attention. Also getting stuck due to pixel hunting which made things take that much longer was not helpful to that aspect of making me want to keep going. To me the game needed some trimming on the story side of things as it felt like i was more bloated than it needed to be. It didn't add enough depth for the amount of added time. 

The puzzles also felt like they took longer than needed to advance the story. More often than not when i was stuck was because simply overlooking a pixel hotspot, because at this resolution combined with the pixel graphics it made things hard to see. I would get to the point of just slowly moving my mouse over the screen hoping something would light up.   The game is pretty solid, but those issues would make me look elsewhere.  

I'd only say give it a shot to those people that are serious adventure fans or big sci-fi geeks and if  those issues don't bother you.  I just prefer other wajet eye games and other adventures. This one could of been great, but it fell a bit short.  Shardlight for example i just loved, and kept me coming back night after night which this game was bundled with. (a wajet eye sci-fi bundle) This one just didn't have that "Just one more turn" feel to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005874269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1586611197}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974877837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1582994868}
review:
I suppose that, for what it is, "Technobabylon" isn't a bad game. It just isn't one I particularly enjoyed.

It doesn't help that "Technobabylon" - an Indie-developed old-school adventure-game - utilizes (no, boasts!) old-school graphics. The excuse used by developers is that their limited budgets don't allow them to create games with high-end graphics, but more often than not  indie games like this create high-res art that is then downscaled to "old-school" levels, which defeats the whole purpose. The pixelated graphics are more a marketing gimmick, banking on a player's nostalgia, than a budgetary necessity and this sort of manipulation irks me. It's not a good start for a game. More, I appreciated the classic games more when they /surpassed/ the limitations of their technology, not because of it. If I raved about the art in Monkey Island, it wasn't because it used 256 colors and a 320x200 resolution, but because it didn't look like it did. Moving backwards, purposefully limiting yourself for the sake of marketable nostalgia, does nothing to attract me to a game.

The gameplay doesn't fare much better. The game is very linear and limited, lacking in options and interactivity. Half the fun of classic Sierra and LucasArts games was using various items or set-pieces just to see the wacky hijincks (and, usually in Sierra games, unexpected deaths) that resulted. There's little such opportunity in "Technobabylon"; each room has only a handful of interactive points, too few items to manipulate and fewer characters to with which to interact. The end result is a very linear, almost "walking game" type experience, with little opportunity to explore or experiment.

I can't say the setting appeals that much to me either. I am only a casual fan of cyberpunk to begin with, and "Technobabylon" added little to the genre. True to the setting, the game is exceptionally pessimistic, even finishing on a downer ending. None of the characters were particularly attractive either, giving me little impetus to keep playing.

"Technobabylon" isn't a bad game. If you enjoy extremely streamlined point-n-click adventures with old-school graphics set in a cyberpunk universe, you'll probably like this game. Unfortunately, the above description is a trifecta of features that isn't something I really enjoy.

review: I'm not a point-and-click adventure game player most of the time, but after injuring my left arm, I couldn't do any FPS or anything with a control. Solid story and good music. I don't think this would convert someone over the point-and-click style, but it was certainly enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024138776', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 2330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2111, 'last_played': 1616799004}
review:
Niezwykle klimatyczna cyberpunkowa przygodówka ,,point and click'' z naprawdę świetnie przemyślaną fabułą i dobrze napisanymi postaciami.

Akcja gry toczy się w futurystycznym mieście Newton, w którym grasuje tak zwany Mindjacker, wykradający dane z umysłów swoich ofiar, czego skutkiem ubocznych jest ich brutalna śmierć. Wcielamy się w dwójkę detektywów badających sprawę tych zabójstw. Więcej zdradzać nie będę, gdyż naprawdę warto poznać całą historię samemu. Tempo gry jest niemal idealne - gra stopniowo dozuje nam kolejne elementy układanki. Cała intryga jest całkiem złożona, ale każda postać jest tutaj dobrze umotywowana oraz interesująca, a zarówno dialogi, jak i gra aktorska stoją na wysokim poziomie. Nie ma tu mowy o żadnych dziurach fabularnych.

Kolejną mocną stroną gry jest klimat, który wręcz wylewa się z ekranu. W czasie naszej przygody zwiedzimy przeróżne części miasta Newton - zarówno slumsy, laboratorium genetyczne, starą fabrykę jak i ekskluzywną restaurację. Gra porusza wiele ważnych kwestii związanych z rozwojem technologicznym, zarówno tych bardziej oklepanych, jak rolę maszyn w społeczeństwie, problemy etyczne inżynierii genetycznej, czy terroryzm, po te bardziej niszowe, jak jedzenie wyhodowanego ludzkiego mięsa czy choroby psychiczne. Wszystkie te tematy są poruszane w nienachalny sposób, podczas dialogów z postaciami pobocznymi oraz eksploracji lokacji. Daje to do myślenia, i pozwala uwierzyć w prawdziwość wykreowanego przez twórców świata. W połączeniu z ciekawymi lokacjami oraz genialną muzyką, daje to naprawdę klimatyczną produkcję.

Jako że jest to przygodówka ,,point and click'', przyjdzie nam rozwiązywać zagadki, odpowiednio łącząc ze sobą elementy otoczenia oraz posiadane przedmioty. Zagadki są nawet pomysłowe i umiarkowanie trudne - zdarzało mi się od czasu do czasu nie mieć pomysłu na rozwiązanie, ale zawsze okazywało się ono sensowne i nie było wcale przekombinowane. Wydaje mi się, że kilka pierwszych łamigłówek jest trochę trudniejszych niż te późniejsze, ale być może jest to kwestia wprawy. Jak dla mnie, pierwsza zagadka w grze jest zdecydowanie zbyt skomplikowana.

Gra posiada drobne problemy techniczne, takie jak niewielki limit liczby zapisanych stanów gry czy problemy z kursorem myszy. Bywają one trochę irytujące, ale da się je łatwo rozwiązać, patrz tutaj: https://steamcommunity.com/app/307580/discussions/0/620712999986875720/

Podsumowując, jest to zaskakująco udana produkcja. Po pierwszym rozdziale omal nie odbiłem się od tej gry, jednak bardzo cieszę się, że zaufałem pozytywnym opiniom i nie przestałem w nią grać.

O grze dowiedziałem się z tego materiału (3:29): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=62E56gQD5cU&feature=youtu.be&t=209

author: {'steamid': '76561197973095782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1608700836}
review: This was the third game I played from this studio after Primordia and Shardlight. I'd say it's the least strong of the three however it definitely still has it's place. The relationships between characters and the music are particular strong points. It also has a lot of non essential dialogue which I am a big fan of. I'd say this game is good, whilst the other two listed are amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970690004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1575136692}
review: Awesome. A fine balance between being difficult but not frustrating (except for a couple of bits, admittedly). Funny, creative, interesting, lots of lore and cool ideas to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080161294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1582717497}
review:
Good take on the cyberpunk genre. They got a lot of element spot on.

If you like it, I recommend you give "Primordia" a try, from the same publisher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060716650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1583448947}
review: I enjoyed the story and the puzzles even though I had to look up some solutions. The world is fun to explore and there are some open ended sections that can have multiple solutions. I really liked puzzles involving Trance, a sort of futuristic virtual reality that lets you hack things and affect meatspace in creative ways. They have a developer commentary mode too, and it's fun to listen to what went into the game's creation while you play. If you're a fan of cyberpunk or point and clicks you'll enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209692108', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1582548609}
review: 游戏性还是不错的，解谜的设置比较合理，还加入了一些动作和分支元素。设定和故事真的非常棒。湿件、Trance、克隆人肉、分裂重组的世界版图（又黑我Han）、生化超脑、三姐妹、AI的人格记忆技能分离、克隆自爆人型武器、类思维钢印...亮点真的蛮多的...最后的两个结局一黑一白，较白的那个让我想起了少佐，Distributed Central。另：Nina真是个有意思的character

author: {'steamid': '76561197986094735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1581909903}
review: Good job with the story line

author: {'steamid': '76561198000800484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1674291249}
review:
Wow what a great game! The story takes place in a fascinating possible future world where technology has advanced in ways that change society. 

I love the diverse characters, each with their own distinct personality and principles. The story had me engaged the whole way through. I found it the world very believable and the puzzles interesting. The story at times made me think about the morality of technology and what would be the right thing to do in the main characters shoes. I sometimes disagreed with the way some of the characters acted but found myself sympathising with them anyway and considering how they must feel.

I wonder if the branching storylines was a good idea. I feel that the story was weaker as a result. Personally, I would have preferred a linear story.

I'm really glad I bought it and heartily recommend Technobabylon to sci-fi fans, and all who appreciate a good, thought provoking story. Oh my yes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083454823', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1581771782}
review: Great point n click with very engrossing story.  I feel the puzzles are challenging but aren't too tough that you need to refer to guides for help.  If you've never played a point n click before Technobabylon is an ideal game to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053561874', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1581110788}
review:
Great game with good puzzles.
The story happens in the future. Somebody born today would be able to confirm if the world changed as much as the game predicted. I would have added 100 years more...
The five Blackwell games together have a better story than this one. But this is subjective and other players might like this story more.
In the beginning I was upset that the hot-bar slides out from the corner of the screen but I got used to it eventually.
The game has probably two endings but I am not curious to know the other one :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972382461', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1580664421}
review:
Another great gem by Wadjet Games.

+ Overall great writing and voice acting
+ Music is A+
+ Simple effective point and click puzzle system
+ Fun pixelated art style

author: {'steamid': '76561197971643454', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1580595013}
review:
Strong in story and classic Wadjet point-and-click interface makes this a worthwhile purchase.  I bought at $3.74 and had about 9 hours or so of gameplay.

Pros:
[*]Nice visual style.
[*]Great voice acting.
[*]Quality story that is told well at each phase.

Cons:
[*]I had what I thought was a bug issue and emailed it to admin@wadjeteyegames.com and never received a response.  I took 3 months off from playing and came back and looked at absolutely every object in every available room and unlocked the dialogue options needed to continue the game.  Pretty disappointing support experience from Wadjet.
[*]On occasion there are timed/urgent tasks to complete and the clunky controls can get in the way of completing them the first time.  This issue did not ruin the game nor really negatively impacted my enjoyment of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051501709', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1661899350}
review: Play the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197989328210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1580249018}
review: Cool story with interesting characters. For anyone loving point and click adventures, this is a must!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048374781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1580251861}
review:
Overall - 8 / 10

Pros:
+ Nice Overall Story and Narrative Pacing
+ Interesting Character Development
+ Enjoyable Dialogue and Voice Acting

Neutral:
/ Artwork presentation is fine for what it is, except for... (see Cons 3/4)
/ No replay value, but I did not mind

Cons:
- A few puzzles don't make much sense to me, but not unsolvable
- Choices don't matter as much as I liked
- Sometimes I can't tell what the object is supposed to be due to artwork style
- Text is sometimes difficult to read due to its pixel nature
- Slightly clunky control

Conclusions:
Though I listed more cons than pros, I actually really enjoyed the game throughout.
Completed in about 8 hours, not much reason to revisit the game. It is what it supposed to be, a story game, and it did well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998042773', 'num_games_owned': 978, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1575584448}
review:
I got the game from a bundle but it should be right for me - both setting of the world and point'n'click. I don't know but it just did not keep me interested. The characters were good from what I saw but the story seemed a bit generic.

Seeing the other reviews being mostly positive and not being able to exactly able to point out what was wrong (besides "I tried it in few sessions and always got bored") you can just ignore this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198970684398', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1579452176}
review:
[h1] Technobabylon [/h1]
This game has everything:

- Great atmosphere
- Deep story
- Authentic characters
- Nice retro graphics
- Really awesome voice acting
- Beautiful soundtrack
- Challenging gameplay with sometimes merely subtle hints
- Easy controls (just right and left clicking)

You play three different characters - I liked all of them very much.
I played the game twice a day while eating, and, I admit, I looked up some hints around the end, because I just couldn't wait.^^
Don't worry about the setting - the game is fun even for technical noobs, so just get started!

It worked well here on Arch Linux (manjaro) via Proton 4.11-12.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121681464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1555918101}
review: A standalone cyberpunk adventure from Wadjeteye that leads to some cool questions and a surprisingly emotional finale

author: {'steamid': '76561198025247656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1579447227}
review:
An awesome story, greatly realized via excellent writing, pixel art and voice acting.
I heartily recommend it!

I ran it on Linux through SteamPlay/Proton, and while that was not without quirks, the game is fully playable and really enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256283874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1578753810}
review:
Проходил эту игру в первый раз в 2016-ом, решил провести ревизию 4 года спустя.

Плюсы: 
- Мне очень нравится киберпанковый мир, созданный автором, все эти устройства, соединение техники и органики, этические вопросы, мрачное будущее и т.д. Всё это сделано здесь на пятёрочку.
- Разнообразие локаций и ситуаций. Тут и допрос служанки-андроида, и побег из камеры, и путешествие по виртуальным мирам, и разборки в зассаных заброшках. Короче, тут действительно много всего.

Минусы:
- Один общий минус почти для всех игр Wadjet eye - это загадки с "лунной" логикой. До определённого момента проблем у вас не будет, но настанет минута, когда вы перестанете понимать логику созданного автором мира. Даже правила, с которыми вас познакомили в начале игры - в процессе прохождения будут меняться. Я так и не смог понять, почему жижа (wetware), которая способна подключать героиню к различным "умным" устройствам в какой-то момент игры должна быть применена к живому человеку?! (парень в камере). То есть сначала героиня постоянно говорит вам, что эту жижу можно применить только на устройства, а потом внезапно её можно начать применять и на что-то другое. Другой пример: чтобы сбежать из той же камеры вам надо пообщаться с чуваком, зайдя в транс, он расскажет, что ему надо вколоть некое вещество и нарисует в воздухе молекулу этого вещества. Окей, откуда брать это вещество, если мы  в камере? А надо взять нарисованную в воздухе молекулу, вернуться в реальный мир и произвести с ней манипуляции. WTF?!
- Очень и очень легко пропустить что-то реально важное, но на что вы 100% не обратите внимание и будете блуждать по локациям в поисках решения. Пример: когда надо сбегать из зассанной заброшки, где вас окружили солдаты, надо одного из них поджарить лазером. Как это сделать, если при малейшем шорохе он даёт по вам очередь? А вот надо было на первом экране зайти в терминал, врубить все три тумблера, значение которых вам непонятно, соединить терминал с вашим устройством и потом уже как следует #бануть по солдату. И таких микроэлементов, которые стопорят прохождение в дальнейшем встретится очень много. 
- Интересно начавшаяся история к середине и концу скатывается в банальщину. Это тоже относится почти ко всем играм Wadjet Eye, их слабое место - это слабые сценарии. Автора хватает на то, чтобы заинтриговать вас, удержать ваше внимание, но развязка, как правило, донельзя банальна. 
- Не хватает быстрого перемещения по двойному щелчку, это подбешивает.
- Очень затянутые, словообильные и утомляющие диалоги, в которых на вас вываливают кучу информации обо всём, используя всякие термины, внутренние реалии, имена. Это плохо, это очень плохо. 

Поэтому не могу рекомендовать к покупке эту игру, если хотите глубокой истории и прохождения "на одном дыхании". Однако замечу, что в последнем проекте Unvowed автор ВНЕЗАПНО учёл все эти моменты и вырезал их на ##й. Всё, что здесь у меня значится в минусах - там отсутствует. Что косвенно подтверждает справедливость упрёков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001914453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1578775851}
review:
Very well-written and excuted adventure game. The atmosphere is second to none (it captures old-school pixel art perfectly), the puzzles are very well-thought out, but the plot is mediocre. Recommended for anyone wanting a well good cyberpunk adventure game. 

The cyberpunk atmosphere is great and every character is voice acted. There are some very cool mechanics that are reoccuring and are a novel addition to the game. Puzzles make sense, though occasionally you will find yourself randomly trying to combine items and clicking in search of possible answer. If not, the internet will make sure your not stranded like the old days. 

I had a hard time caring about the plot. It was 'cyberpunkish' but in the end I did not care one way or another. There are some 'progressive' elements that hit you pretty hard and outta nowhere [spoiler]  In five minutes you find out your partner is a transgender and a french maid robot was having a threesome with an interracial gay couple. Also religious people are treated as dangerous zealots [/spoiler] . But once you get past this odd section the game goes back to having you solve puzzles in search of a murderer. 

I enjoyed the game, but don't expect anything groundbreaking here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978351775', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1578773958}

There was only 1 part of the game i didn't care for related to what people were eating on a certain lvl, felt that game could have down without that. I hope for a sequel as both ending tend to  lean towards open ended

Thank You to all who helped make the game i hope You make a part#2

author: {'steamid': '76561198143824862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1578216245}
review: Point-and-click adventure game in a cyberpunk setting. What's not to love?

author: {'steamid': '76561197980881113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1509261686}
review: This game is on par with other classic Wadjet Eye games like Gemini Rue, the Blackwell Series, or Unavowed. The characters are great, the writing is sharp, the cyberpunk setting is more interesting than expected, and every scene is just brilliantly drawn. When you play it, you think, "Oh yeah, _this_ is why I enjoy adventure games!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197970476955', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1576902436}
review: Wadjet Eye adventure games have consistent quality, and you can pretty much pick any of them up and know you'll have a decent experience.  This one in particular has good writing, conflicted characters with their own motives and development, and a world -- though lightly sketched -- with interesting bladerunner-neuromancer qualities, and fully-voiced dialogue trees that are worth exhausting.  Puzzles are generally straight-forward (yay!), and I only had to get hints for a few where I just didn't see a hotspot, and some have variations, as in the two possible endings.
