author: {'steamid': '76561197997307966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1544810157}
review:
Great on its own terms!

Technobabylon is a classic-style point-and-click adventure game taking place in a standard Cyberpunk dystopian city of Newton. It takes time to build its world up without being hamfisted or burdensome, and has a few novel, in-your-face elements. For what it is, it's very pretty, sounds great, and had my interest the entire time.

Despite feeling standard in many ways and feeling thematically spread thin, This has to be one of the better adventure games I've played. There were only two sections where I got stuck and needed to consult a FAQ, but all of the other sections were set up reasonably well to be solved. 

Story wise, I have a major nitpick with once detail in the story, but while it was very distracting, it wasn't critical to how the story unfolded. It's hard to explain what exactly Technobaylon is about in total, but at the main character level it's about coming to terms. I think this was done well enough, but the amount of interrelation between everyone and everything feels  juuust a bit too much. This is small potatos. 

I would reccomend this game at its full price in support of the developer, but as I got about 16 hours out of it,  the size and scope of it warrants getting it for $10 and under.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115996598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1544399952}
review: An excellent scifi-themed point-and-click retro adventure that reminds me a bit of Beneath a Steel Sky. Great story, atmosphere, puzzles and music, and the difficulty level was just right. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085369007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1544356268}
review: Great story and great characters. I thought such adventure games no longer get made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082820352', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2080, 'last_played': 1544368607}
review:
[h1]Сюжет.[/h1]

Technobabylon поведает нам интересную детективную историю, которая будет удерживать внимание игрока на протяжении всего повествования, постепенно распутывая клубок загадок. История поделена на главы, в каждой из которых мы будем играть за того или иного персонажа, а иногда сразу за 2 или 3. Все действующие лица игры очень колоритны, между ними есть живое взаимодействие, а геймплей за каждого персонажа имеет отличия в определенных деталях.

[h1]Скучно не будет.[/h1]

Здесь присутствуют логичные загадки и головоломки, некоторые из которых можно решить очень просто, а над другими надо будет подумать. Technobabylon постоянно кидает игрока в разные ситуации: нужно выяснить кто из 4 подозреваемых сообщник террориста, провести допрос синтетика, уговорить террориста не взрывать бомбу или замочить гада на месте, убежать от отряда вооруженных бойцов и тд. А еще в игре есть 2 мини-игры: понг и камень-ножницы-бумага. 

Также есть возможность пройти игру с комментариями разработчиков. И у игры отличная продолжительность: 8-10 часов минимум.

[h1]Выбор за тобой.[/h1]

В этой игре 2 концовки. Выбор в конце игры влияет на получаемую концовку. А также у нас будет возможность делать выборы, которые влияют на разрешение тех или иных ситуаций, но не на глобальные события.

[h1]Ачивки.[/h1]

Абсолютно все ачивки в игре легкие.

[h1]Музыка и озвучка.[/h1]

Музыка в игре хорошая, а озвучка подходит для каждого персонажа и очень радует слух.

[h1]Маленькое неудобство.[/h1]

К неудобству могу отнести только то, что придется играть в окне 1280 x 800 или же в полном экране с большими черными полосками со всех 4-х сторон.

[h1]В тренде.[/h1]

Да в этой игре есть проповедник, который продает наркоту, чтобы избавить нуждающихся от местной интернет-зависимости! 

А есть и ресторан, где люди едят людей!

[b]Моя оценка[/b] этой игре [b]10[/b] я ненавижу Диспетчера из [b]10[/b] шикарных подколов от Макс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004132399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1483882766}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986997483', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 314, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1542019696}
review: This game has some wonderfully inventive puzzles that are very well integrated into the scifi world in which it takes place.  The overarching story is nothing we haven't seen before, however it takes until the end of the game to learn how each of the characters are integrated into the story, and so the mystery still works.  Some of the time you are put in control of a character who is forced to make an action that you might not want to do.  That can be particularly frustrating in this sort of game where you are putting your brain to use to solve problems for them.  I can think of several solutions which I don't find unethical, but I can't try those things.  In the worst of these cases, the game goes to great lengths to try and explain the character's motivation after the fact by providing some flashback scenes.  I still wasn't totally convinced.  Obviously this is very difficult to explain without giving spoilers.  I don't know.  The puzzles are great.  The story has some problems that maybe wouldn't be as bad had this been a novel or a film rather than a game that puts you in control.  Finally, I don't like the 'the end, or is it?' style finale.  There's a lot going on in these characters' lives at the end.  We don't really need a cliffhanger to feel invested in a possible sequel.  Actually, putting the cliffhanger in there limits the possibilities in a sequel, because these characters could have dealt with ANYTHING in a sequel now they have to deal with what amounts to loose ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023160916', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1595621963}
review:
"For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness; Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them. For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse: Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened. Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools, And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient; Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers, Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents, Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them"
-Romans 1:18

Come, Lord Jesus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086176378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1605129686}
review: Very good story. A rare good cyberpunk game in Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124406953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1540165709}
review: Really enjoyed the story. Puzzles are more like "monkey island" than "the witness" or "isoland" (a huge plus). I have a new baby and needed a great game with a good plot that i could play with one hand (baby in the other), stop at any moment and finish in reasonable time (18 hours). Puzzles were perfect, challenging but never needed a walkthrough.  Also no need to keep seperate notes or decipher codes like some other games (which i normally love but dont have the spare hand for). Really loved playing this and my sanity is grateful it exists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361963534', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1540235755}
review:
Well.. the game didn't grab me that much like Primordia or Gemini rue.
The puzzles were good generally, but the atmosphere is really bad in my opinion, too much dark and dirty world, also atmosphere and  story and the dialogues didn't match together and I felt the game was too superficial,  the story itself was weak comparing to top old wadjet eye games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052175840', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1539644254}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034470709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1539594595}
review:
Excellent story and characters. It uses the cyberpunk setting effectively and has well formed main characters with understandable motivations rather than relying on tropes of the genre to make the main characters interesting. 

Most of the puzzles work well, help to establish the setting and feel appropriate for each situation. I did get stuck a few times due to missing an item in the environment or overlooking something I could interact with, but that is most likely due to my inexperience with the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970687509', 'num_games_owned': 1191, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1539289298}

review: This game is fantastic, one of the best graphic adventures I've ever played. The dialogues are really well written, the story keeps you hooked from beginning to end, the game mechanics extremely simple but the puzzles challenging enough not to be boring. I'm recommending it to all my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972941429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1538379553}
review: Technobabylon is a well-designed adventure game that tells an engaging and well-acted story.  Great characters, largely solid puzzles and a thematically coherent soundtrack make for an easy recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037385891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 4560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4469, 'last_played': 1538366303}
review: A short but sweet game, that presents an interesting and compelling version of the future. The amount of hours logged is misleading - I had the game running some nights because I forgot to shut it off. If you like point n' click adventures, this should satisfy. The puzzles aren't terribly hard and dialogue and character commentary will usually point you in the right direction. I played with the developer commentary turned on, and aside from occasionally slightly spoiling how certain scenes would turn out, it added a lot of color and depth to my playthrough, and gave me a good appreciation from just how much work creating this  game took. I recommend this at any discount, because it's good to support the developers - I understand a sequel is in the works.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 21400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7634, 'last_played': 1537882342}
review:
Technobabylon is your typical Wadjet adventure game, which means not fantastic but very solid adventure gameplay. Bonus points for the caberpunk setting, which is way too rarely used. Dialogues are good and the atmosphere is great.

If you're into pixel art, adventures and cyberpunk, this will definitely be your thing. If you can't stand just one of those you're going to have a bad time. Personally, I did like it quite a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968068290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1537607925}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066496454', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1520200190}
review: Good story, nicely realised world, believable characters, simple pointnclick gameplay. I expected much more from this game after reading all reviews (I should stop overhyping myself), but in the end it holds up pretty well. If you like adventure genre or cyberpunk with some original ideas in terms of world building - you will enjoy this. Good, but not that great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028155031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1535937393}
review: Best adventure game I've played in years. A marvelous story with puzzles that are not "moon logic" if you pay attention to context clues, which makes this deserving of the praise the others have already heaped on this title on Steam already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993148381', 'num_games_owned': 4366, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1535862423}
review: [i]Technobablyon[/i] is the last of Wadjet Eye's games for me to play out of those that I currently own, and once again it didn't disappoint. With a 'cyberpunk' setting, it's very different from the [i]Blackwell[/i] series that I started out with, but no less enjoyable for that. I did find that a few of the puzzle solutions were a little less intuitive than they might have been due to this futuristic setting, but that wasn't a very common issue, and the setting has the benefit of bringing with it a dual-world mechanic - the 'cyberspace'-style 'trance' - which I always enjoy in games. Another enjoyable, though a little less memorable, plot rounds out another positive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987943569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1535978127}
review: The art and music are top notch. It's been decades since I played this style of game, but I really enjoyed this. It felt nostalgic, the story was quite good, and I loved the setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970363819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1535892665}
review: A very creative and modern Story packed in an old school point and click Adventure. I liked it alot

author: {'steamid': '76561198037669845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1535411887}
review: I absolutely love this game. One of the best stories I've enjoyed from a game this year, hands down. Totally worth checking out! The puzzles are fun and you could tell the developers put a lot of love into this one. My favorite part of it is how immersive and atmospheric the setting is, but after all I'm a sucker for cyberpunk. It's got a lot of thought-provoking interactions and really interesting concepts about what a neo-futuristic sci-fi world might look like for humanity, and it's not all simply generic tropes you see in sci-fi movies/tv these days. All around fantastic game, one of the better I've played this year. Amazing title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048623723', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1535118858}
review:
[h1]This could be a movie![/h1]

The most interesting aspect of Technobabylon is its story. It's not quite like anything else, which is [i]extremely[/i] hard to find these days since pretty much everything has already been done one way or another. The universe is quite complex, the text is good, the characters fairly well built and developed. Really good job.

Visually, although it's pixel-art (and I'm not a huge fan of it) you can see the amount of work they put into this game -- there are [i]lots[/i] of animations, many different characters, a rather large number of unique locations and several different GUI elements.

Puzzle-wise, Technobabylon is on the easy side. Only [i]one[/i] thing, at the end of the game, was hard to figure out... or, rather, to spot. Great idea on this one, though.

There are a good number of optional achievements to be done, and some of your choices will have an impact on the long-term story, or at least in the current scene's development. You won't always see it coming, so save more often than you usually would -- because you'll most likely have to reload a few minutes back more than once.

In short: ++ for the story/writting, + for the amount of work put into the game (specially considering it was essentially done by 2 or 3 guys) and... a - for the puzzles, since I'm a fan of getting stuck in these games and going to sleep trying to figure out what to do next. Technobabylon lasts only 8 hours or so, but it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303682348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1516652189}
review: This game is really intriguing. The characters are believable and the storyline is interesting. It's not the best point-and-click game I've played, but I liked it and played it through to the end. If you like cyberpunk futuristic AI-based stories, then this one is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047569822', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1534298841}
review:
Awesome sci-fi story in a traditional adventure game! But one modernized--no SCUMM. The concepts of the story are just cyberpunk, but the characters are great. 

The first level is much harder than most. So, do not give up if you find it is not your thing. But, adventure fans should not be turned off by the easier levels. It ebbs and flows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162243904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1534311954}
review: I have already played the game once and loved it. I am currently on my second playthrough and I still think it is one of the best adventure games of the last ten yrs, and def the best from wadjet eye games (and yes I have played all their games including gemini rue and the newly released unavowed.) Unavowed to me cant hold a candle to this great game, the world building here is amazing, love the voice actors, the music fits perfectly, the story is very well written, and most importantly this is the most well implemented use of puzzles in a wadjet eye game by far. 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025531773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1478763768}
review: This was a very enjoyable experience. Great story, good voice acting, interesting puzzles, good world building--- if you are a fan of the genre, I think you will enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117427910', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1534108434}
review:
Одна з найкращих ігор у своєму жанрі. Сюжет, атмосферність, повне голосове озвучення усіх реплік багатьох різних героїв історії, чудове загальне озвучення, непогані головоломки, 2 кінцівки, вибір у діалогах та їх наслідки(щоправда кінцівки вирішуються в останньому виборі). Навіть ігролад влаштований так, що є вірогідність програшу та смерті під час проходження. Ця гра не просто знайти предмет на зображенні і застосувати його на іншому, тут набагато цікавіше. Немає графіки, а локації від того не деталізовані, тому неймовірного вибору взаємодії немає. Але не на цьому побудована гра. Кіберпанк, логічна цікава історія та прекрасне озвучення - 3 кити якості цієї гри. Натомість дивне налаштування розширення гри, немає локалізації.

Висновок: погляньте на системні вимоги, гра такої високої якості 2015-го року може працювати на запеченій картоплині у фользі. Якщо який-небудь з перелічених теґів у крамниці цікавить - обов'язково слід спробувати.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000751945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1533980509}
review: tres bon jeu d'aventure à l'ancienne avec une histoire passionnante et tres bien écrite et des enigmes tres bien trouvées. Une traduction francaise existe sur le net et ca permet de mieux apprecier le jeu . bravo !

author: {'steamid': '76561197989717341', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1436130802}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970626769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1536089234}
review:
I played 9 hours of this game on someone else's laptop, checked the store page and saw it had Steam Cloud; great! 
Deleted the game thinking all was well.
Loaded it up on my desktop today, but no savefiles. There was no option to sync with the cloud at all.

[b]THIS GAME DOES NOT HAVE STEAM CLOUD.[/b]

Other than that the 9 hours was enjoyable and I highly recommend this cyberpunk point-and-click :3

Edit: I found out that by pressing Ctrl+t on the main menu a debug menu is brought up and you can select a chapter from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965037797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1532273142}
review:
A very well executed story you will remember! It is presented from different points of view, from unique and well constructed characters that even have their own gameplay mechanics and peculiarities. 

The transition among characters and worlds (tech) is smooth and well executed, the tempo is nice and the story reveals bit by bit, keeping you intrigued about how it will turn out.

Really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988317584', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1531687696}
review: Interesting premise bogged down by shoehorned in political agenda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189568201', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1531041667}
review: This is by far one of the best cyberpunk stories. I cannot explain the amount of excitement I felt as the story develops and also great puzzles and plot twists though they are a bit obvious for the keen sci-fi geeks. Anyone who loves good narratives, cyberpunk and adventure should not miss this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975686297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1530770013}
review: This is an amazing point n click cyberpunk adventure with top notch voice acting, chracters you actually CARE about , and just an amazing story. Throw in multiple endings and certain puzzles that are extremely crafty and you have an amazing game here. Seriously, I don't say this lightly. This is a 10/10 point n click game. Killer music, graphics, and atmosphere too. I hope there is a sequel one day. I love the lore / world of it.  Well done to everyone who worked on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132859179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1683819672}
review:
This is a great game, it brings back those feelings when I was a kid and played on my Amiga 1200.
It the atmosphere I great, the dialogue feels reel. and I bet that it would work without it too.
But I do not know how Ripley from Aliens did end up in this game though. (Well I think the girl, in the beginning, are quite similar to her.)https://store.steampowered.com/app/307580/Technobabylon/#

GFX: The palette is nice with it's dusty, greyish the world is f*** up feeling.
SND: Music is just great, just as dystopic as the rest of the game.
RP:    Well I guess I will play this once or twice.

So, GO GET IT if you're into points 'n click.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993432613', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1529757678}
review:
INTERLINKED. Into cells INTERLINKED. (that specific line just rings in my mind when playing this game lol)
DANG. this was probably one of the best cyberpunky-ish stories i've seen from a point and click to date. FANTASTIC storyline. granted, I only did a single playthrough, and honestly I don't think i'll ever play through it again, because I enjoyed the storyline so much that if it changes on my second playthrough i'd feel underwhelmed by the magic I felt the entire time I was playing this game. fun puzzles, fantastic game 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992082934', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1536188306}
review: A great cyberpunk adventure game with retro pixel art and good storyline and puzzles. I used a walkthrough VERY sparingly, which was good as I am a bit lazy with pixel huntery these days. This recalls the very best of the 90s, and especially Beneath a Steel Sky. Highly recommended for old time fans of that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045796166', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1530066517}
review:
Ben Chandler is an incredible pixel artist and this game is up to his talent. All the (many) voice talents in this game are great. The game pays homage to one of the best cyberpunk adventure games I’ve played: Beneath a Steel Sky. The story is very well written, wonderful use of the AGS. I recommend it to any sci-fi fan, as well as Primordia.

One of the strong points is the game’s pacing. Ten episodes that take about 30 minutes each is a perfect length for adventure games. The world is nicely built, and you can immerse in it reading the news in each chapter. The main character arc is surprising enough, and I appreciate it not being too dark. Disguised as a police sci-fi thriller, the game touches some interesting philosophical questions about memory, conciseness and technological addiction.

In a few words: A story worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1528981957}
review:
Good game, visually meh, not so special but atmosphere, setting, world and story are really good.

Game have some very point and click / adventure moments where you have to do crazy and absurd things to progress and sometimes there are so much dialogs and information in one place that I had problems to focus and I had to make some breaks :)

But other than that pretty solid game

author: {'steamid': '76561197963928308', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1527578015}
review: I don't usually write reviews but after completing this game it would be unjust if I did not tell everyone I can about what a great experience this game was.  I grew up playing point and click adventure games and this took me back to that same experience.  everything about this game was awesome.  Characters well developed and relateable, story/writing would rival maybe surpass that of a AAA game.  Puzzles were actually logical and made sense (mostly). The music/graphics/art style drew me in to a future world and I could not put this game down.  If you are interested in this game enough to be reading this review BUY IT and relish in the experience.  I have spent months searching and buying games I lose interest in quickly but this game delivered like games used to.  I wish I could play it again for the 1st time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995974055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1527452229}

author: {'steamid': '76561198100576798', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1527442227}
review: This game is a real little gem, for all p&c adventure and cyberpunk genre lovers. Good story, well-written characters (3 playable characters), challenging but logical puzzles. Beautifully designed world in a cyberpunk setting with a very detailed and vivid graphics, this game gives us insight of what our future may look like. Bonus points for outstanding soundtrack and replay value (different endings). I recommend this game, oh my yes! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198058133511', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1525789957}
review:
Très bonne surprise, pour moi qui ne suis pas amateur de point&click. Les solutions aux enigmes sont souvent logiques. 

Technobabylon c'est l'histoire d'un futur dirigé par une IA omniprésente où la population se connect au net via l'esprit, grâce à un produit, le wetware. Dans ce monde, un serial killer - le Mindjacker - tue ses victimes en volant des données dans leur cerveau via leur port réseau. Qui est-il ? Que cherche-t-il ?

Pour commencer, c'est du pixel-art splendide : les différents lieux vivent, les animations sont fluides, les décors fouillés, les expressions crédibles. On plonge facilement dans cet univers à la fois merveilleux et sordide. 
Mention spéciale pour le doublage intégral en VO ! Sérieux, tout est doublé, ça accroche encore plus. 
L'immersion est totale, et les dialogues et la mise en scène font passer du rire au frisson (attention, certains passages VRAIMENT glauques). 

Une bonne histoire ! J'essaierai plus de point&click !

author: {'steamid': '76561198031254619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1525782014}
review:
Technobabylon est un bon point and click Cyberpunk.
La compatibilité avec un écran 4K est problématique, mais des aides sont disponibles sur Internet pour contourner ce problème.
Le gameplay du jeu est assez fluide pour que je n'aie eu à chercher la soluce que 3 fois (et je ne suis pas très bon à ce genre de jeux, j'imagine que de meilleurs joueurs n'en auraient pas eu besoin).
L'histoire est très intéressante, certains moments sont prévisibles, mais la trame est vraiment accrocheuse.
Les graphismes sont un parti-pris qui me plaît, et le jeu tourne très bien.
La durée de vie est correcte, par contre je ne vois pas de grande rejouabilité.
Bref, un bon jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970613265', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1523798431}
review:
A genius game. 

I've generally enjoyed Wadjet Eye games' work but this is my absolute favourite.  It has no weakness for a point and click game; the writing is on point, the puzzles are smart, the story is gripping and the world is built really well.  The puzzles are small-ish in scope but I think that is a good thing in realistic adventure games because it makes sense people are using 'what they've got to hand', while 'carrying an empty baked beans tin to a different city to saw a frayed rope to get the cat toy you need' always takes me out of the experience.  I almost wish they had done more with the interfacing with different software type puzzle that features as it is really nice gameplay and story integration; it is a cyberpunk world, so hacking virtual and phyiscal systems at the same time is very characterisitic and really helps get me in the 'sky is the colour of television' zone.  Did I mention the story and characters?  Top flight!  I am sympathetic for the characters' plights, I understand (all but one and she is pretty key) of their motivations and some of them are deeply flawed or/and likeable in the best way.  Max and Latha are the best.  Lots of fun to be had with synthetics, too.  The story and world pull lots of classic mystery/cyberpunk tropes out of retirement for one last job, but puts just enough of a new spin on them to make them really exciting as they play out and relevant again.

The icing on the cake is that thew current and inclusive in its sensibilities as well, which I regard as a huge plus.  

This really is the best adventure game I have played in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979090247', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1522728549}
review:
Best adventure game I played in years. Finished "Kathy Rain" a couple days ago which was already very good, but Technobabylon seems to be on a whole different level. This is pretty much a perfect point&click adventure. I just can't find anything wrong with it. At least nothing that actually matters, other than one nitpick: the mouse acceleration issue. But it's 100% solvable through an *.cfg file tweak.

The puzzles are just right, and everything makes sense. They're all environmental. No artificial "chess puzzles" slapped on top. It's all in-game. There's no "moon logic" anywhere to be found. The difficulty is also just right. I didn't get stuck even once, but I did have to think a bit to figure out solutions.

The plot is engaging and the story is constantly progressing. At no point did the plot lose momentum and got you in a "what the hell am I doing here" situation. You always feel like you're on a mission with a clear goal.

Graphics are very well made. Sound, music, voice acting are also very good.

Took me 14 hours to finish. I got so sucked into it, I actually played it in two sitting over a weekend! I don't tend to play a game for 7 hours at a time, but this just wouldn't let me go. It has different endings too (at least two I know of.)

Yeah, it's REALLY good. 10/10, must-buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071760361', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1522785189}
review:
Parádní adventura! Skvělá atmosféra, voice acting, hudba i příběh. Hádanky patří taky mezi ty lepší, měl jsem snad jen jeden či dva záseky, vše dávalo při troše nadhledu celkem logický smysl. 
Trochu mě mrzí ta grafika, která je díky svojí stylizaci pořád překousnutelná, ale kdyby šlo třeba o ruční kresbu, byla by bývala fakt o úroveň či dvě výš. Hra opravdu vtáhne, temný cyberpunk s pořádnou konspirací, nelze nevzpomenout na DeusEx, což je snad ta největší poklona co lze v rámci žánru dát! 

[spoiler] A konec? Muhehehe, moc dobrý! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006769369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1522682573}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069269643', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2010, 'last_played': 1522541614}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015442636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1523230269}
review:
Jugué a las primeras iteraciones por partes, gratuitas, de este juego, y esta version final con buenos graficos, voces y jugabilidad actualizada  es una gozada. 

El espiritu del juego indie de aventura grafica en estado puro, con gran ambientación, gran historia y gran humor, así como partes hilarantes a la parte que bien programadas. 

Tecnobabylon junto a Gemini Rue es de lo mejorcito salido de los foros de Adventure Game Studio y desde luego merecen el precio!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057773263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1521322404}
review: Had a lot of fun playing this game. The cyberpunk theme is well done.  The writing is captivating.  The puzzles are just right - not too easy and not rediculously hard/nonsensical.  You get to play as multiple characters throughout the game.  It feels like a cyberpunk novel - there are some concepts in the game that make you think, like advanced AI, wetware, genetic engineering.  I played Primordia before this which is another excellent title by Wadjet Eye.  I will definitely be checking out some of their other games in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031994154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1654431360}
review:
Technobabylon is a great adventuregame no matter how you look at it. Personally I dont have much love for 'cyberpunk' storylines, they rely too much on hookum such as wetware (Which basically does whatever the plot needs it to do at any given time), but I do love well written stories, Chandlers delightful graphics and Wadjeteyes' masterful direction and somewhat quirky but very charming production.

Technobabylon has everything needed to make a perfect adventuregame, if you are even remotely interested in the genre you owe it to yourself to buy a copy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137743148', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1585, 'last_played': 1520982170}
review:
la verdad que me he divertido con este juego, quizás sea un poco lioso de seguir la trama de la historia ya que no transcurre linealmente y además tomas el mando de diferentes protagonistas durante el juego.

los acertijos no son muy complicados y te puedes pasar el juego en 15-18  horas, eso sí recomiendo jugarlo de seguido porque si no se hace pesado retomarlo por lo que he comentado antes.

si te gustan las historias de ciencia ficción, lo disfrutaras más.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066418984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1519144949}
review: A very nice Point and Click adventure game. It kinda remember me to the old Lucas games. Sadly it lacks of funny jokes. But maybe that doesn't fit well in a dark Cyberpunk game. Well dark is perhaps the wrong term here. The Story is actually good. It is not too complex and it doesn't lack of background story of the protagonist. They put a lot of effort into the character design. It was always funny to listen to the commentary team. The only part that I disliked are the puzzles. They aren't challenging and boring now and then. It only happend once or twice that the puzzles were difficult, but only because the solution was ridiculous. For people who are cyberpunk fans and who like to play oldschool Point&Click adventure games, this is a well made one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071499880', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1502547132}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971304216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1519220974}
review:
Ein schönes Adventure im Gewandt der alten Zeiten.
Auch wenn man des Englischen mächtig ist, so wäre eine deutsche Synchro wünschenswert, weil vielleicht, manchmal, die eine oder andere Vokabel doch fehlt und man, um wirklich alles zu verstehen, googlen muss.

Aber nicht nur für Vokabeln ist Google notwendig, leider auch für den einen oder anderen Denkanstoss - aber die hielten sich in Grenzen, sodass 90% alleine bewältigt werden konnten. :)

Ansonsten gibt es nicht zu meckern - eine schön erzählte Geschichte mit Emotion und Humor, Spannung und Richtungswechseln. Auch wenn ich die Story nicht am Stück, sondern über Monate hinweg, immer Mal wieder, gepsielt habe, so kann man immerhin sagen, dass man das Spiel beendet hat.

Ich empfehle es also gern mit 'nem Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021614959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1548696452}
review:
[h1] Rate 8/10	 [/h1]

Defiitely a good adventure game and interactive narrative experience. It depicts a near future (it's set in 2087) not so far from what the world could really look like. Megacities, extreme individualism, loose of indentity, internet addiction, decay of moral barriers, powerful AIs, synths, neural connections, conspiracies, etc. etc.There is some Philip K. Dick and some Ghost in the Shell, but the game focuses more on the struggles of the characters than on the philosofical problems. The setting is really well made, and the characters too, i immediately sticked to them. Good puzzles, diversified and with various ways to solve them. Difficulty is perfectly balanced imo, only once i had to use a walktrought but only because i didn't pay too much attention to the environement...nothing that a (not so) sharp eye couldn't notice. As i said, puzzles are neither too easy neither too difficult, sometimes you feel you're stuck but with a couple of minutes of reasoning and a couple of tries you will succeed, there is nothing abstruse like old adventure games (yes monkey island, yes grim fandango, i'm looking at you) and the the possibility of messing around with electronic devices adds some interesting and funny mechanics. 
The story is well paced with space for funny moments and comments by the characters (btw, there are 3 main usable characters). 
I've heard of people finishing it in 7 hours, i explored avery line of dialogue possibile in one playtrought and tried to interact with everything possible and it took me around 13 hours (maybe i'm just stoopid?). 
In the end, i totally reccomend this game if you're into sci-fi, cyberpunk and point-and-click adventures. Develpoers really deserve it, if you would buy a book novel for the same price then buy this, it's the same but it's interactive! (also check Gemini rue from the same developers, i made a review for it too!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011601464', 'num_games_owned': 1015, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1517876573}

author: {'steamid': '76561198250544676', 'num_games_owned': 3671, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1517869669}
review:
This is a point and click in a cyberpunk setting. I'd love to give some thrilling account of the plot to draw you in, but to be honest - despite being reasonably written, it doesn't cover any new ground. And whilst I'd recommend the game, I can't be bothered to muster up the energy bigging up something that is pretty standard by now.

Murder mystery? check! 
Artificial Intelligences? Check! 
Robots? Check! 
Twists? Check! 
Turns? Check! 
Mind blowing new stuff?...uh, no.

Other than a few nifty additions, these are things I've seen / read soooooo many times before. Having said that, It's engaging, well done and for the most part has good voice acting. It also is moderately amusing in places, though the "kooky" banter sometimes gets a bit wearisome and deflates the drama. I'd say 10% of it is cringeworthy, which isn't bad considering its not a super short experience. 

Where the game truly stands out, is as a...game. Shocking, I know....But this has logical puzzles, that for the most part are sensible and not overly convoluted. I only had to look up two solutions, and one of those was simply missing an object that wasn't quite visible enough. 

Most are satisfying to solve, and don't just rely on clicking everything before doing something stupid. Like: how do I open this bottle of coke? oh I'll use this bottle opener..nope!  Okay - maybe if I add this alarm clock to this blow up sex doll, then smear it with jelly...? Yeah - they turned into a lazer gun, and now I can blast the lid off. Cool..so, uh, what's the bottle opener for? Thats to throw at the guard in the next room, and render them unconscious...oookay then.

I'm sure we've all played this type of game that had puzzles that made as much sense as that. Well, there's none of that here, and in that regard - it's great. One final note: the artistic design is great, but the graphics are somewhat naff for a three year old game and should have been much better. 

They're blocky, and fuzzy, which is a pity. Though thats great news for people with low resolution monitors, and cpu's / gpu's that can't handle 20 year old looking sprites...Seriously, it actually says as much in the options screen, where it has a plethora of aliasing choices to cover up that this still only renders  at something like 640 x 380 resolution...and they all make it look even uglier.

Technically this game is a joke. 

To summarise: plays great, has a reasonable story, has decent voice acting and music, looks poor. Thumbs up if you like cyberpunk point and clicks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970586640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1504371809}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972100492', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1517520466}
review:
Technobabylon is retro cyberpunk adventure and probably one of the best adventure games I played since Beneath a Steel Sky and Primordia. Its a solid and very enjoyable point & click adventure with has a story there is really gripping with some good moral choice and some philosophy about both morality and values.

Pros:
- Retro adventure game
- Two protagonist and sidekick
- Great story and plot
- Perfect Art
- Fair puzzle solving

Cons:
- Lack of HD option 
- Minor technical issue and bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050844759', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1517254597}
review:
Great game, took me approx. 7 hours to complete.
It's your somewhat typical 90s style point & click adventure game, with some very nice and interesting features, that makes the puzzles a bit out of the ordinary.

The game isn't super long, took me a little over 7hrs to complete, needing only to google 1 thing in the beginning, as a mechanic had me confused.

Puzzles aren't as hard as say, Maniac Mansion or DoTT, but on the other hand they all make sense.. So there's no "use pants w. fish to create panted fish, and use it on beehive to make bee-panted fish", or stuff like that.

8/10, because it wasn't longer/harder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118853077', 'num_games_owned': 987, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1507492665}
review:
Review originally posted [url=https://www.backlog-assassins.net/posts/27gwe3b]here[/url].

9/10

Wadjet Eye has a special place in my heart. It’s a niche developer/publisher that serves one market and serves it very well - traditional pixel point-n-clicks made in different permutations of Adventure Game Studio. They are always polished, feature many of the same voice actors, and all come with delightful developer commentary tracks that net you an achievement for listening to them all the way through. My usual M.O. for this is to play the game through once, get all the other achievements, and then shelve it for some later date to get the developer’s commentary one. For Technobabylon, that time is now.

It’s one of my two favorite Wadjet Eye games and probably one of my favorite cyberpunk narratives period (yes, better than Dex). Cyberpunk isn’t just an aesthetic - it’s a social commentary, set of themes to explore, and way to look at the world on a macro (universal) and micro (individual person) scale. This game is great about doing all of it - wrestling with themes of megacorps and genetic engineering as well as themes of how far do you go for family and how much privacy should each person get.

Also: women!!! There are so many women in this game who are important. Two of the three player characters and (most) of the Big Bads of the game are intelligent, nuanced women who move and shake the plot. It’s great and awesome and see you guys it’s not that hard you just literally have to put them in there.

I strongly recommend this for people anywhere remotely interested in cyberpunk and/or point and click adventure games.

review:
Technobabylon has a very good story and clever puzzle design.

While personally I would have enjoyed its dark plot conveyed with a bit less of comedy elements (that I have observed mainly in the virtual reality scenes) the game is an excellent example of good sci-fi narrative, focused on corruption, crime and the decadency of society.

I recommend Technobabylon to every science fiction fan.

review:
Ehrlich?..Mein erster Eindruck war : Boah,die Grafik geht mal gaaaar nich !

Man kann es mit echten Klassikern von LucasArts auf eine Stufe stellen wie ich finde
und sowas sage ich nicht leichtfertig, als angehender Pirat,ARRrrrrrrrrrrr^^.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026362756', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1514586527}
review:
This game right here is one of the absolute best point and click adventures I have ever played.  Wadjet Eye Games (WEG) picked a winner in choosing to publish developer Technocrat's gem of a creation.  I loved the story, the voice acting, the puzzles, everything was flawless.  You will ultimately control three different people in the game, Dr. Regis, his faithful sidekick Dr. Lao, and Latha Sesame.  The story starts off and I got the idea this was going to be some kind of cyberpunk, crime mystery type game.  I was totally wrong.  There are so many different elements in this story and what makes it so completely awesome is the fact that almost everything is connected.  I cannot say more than that because this story is something that you should experience on your own.  

It took about 13 hours for one playthrough.  However, I also saved in different sections and knocked out multiple achievements, so it will probably not take quite as long for one playthrough.  However, I will be playing through this again.  The story was beautiful enough that it has replayability.  Whether you find this game at full price or on sale, just pick it up.  If you are a fan of WEG, or point and click adventures...YOU MUST PLAY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984305500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1514277803}
review: yup, it's good. I have a problem with some of these games becasue the puzzles can have bizarre logic. I keep a game guide open for when I get stuck for an excessive amount of time. If you play it with a guide it's a great experience that plays out like a high quality young adult novel that let's you control the pacng and explore the world in as much or as little detail as you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032987905', 'num_games_owned': 4099, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1513906768}
review:
A solid point & click, with a good story. (Cyberpunk / Future of the Humanity)

You control different characters (2 "cops" & a character addicted to a virtual reality), usually only one at a time. But in some parts it involves up to three of them.

With the character addicted to a virtual reality, i found it was a pretty good idea to use both the real world & the virtual world during the gameplay.

I found the difficulty well balanced : not too hard, not to easy either : count 20-25 hours for the first playthrough. (well in my case, you may take less /  more time to finish the game.). Note : game finished without any help.

Voice acting is pretty good . Music feats very well :  one only small regret  there's no Deluxe Edition on Steam  (like on GOG for example).

I liked a lot some funny situations.  (especially with the french maid :P, well i won't spoil the game)

There are differents endings. Many choices are mostly morals & ethics.

Negative point ; Only avaible in english.

You can turn on / off devs commentary, personnaly i found those annoying.... i would have prefered a separate video.

There's an option in the setup to get a better rendering (since the game was created for using a low resolution : anyway the game scales properly for your screen resolution), but it needs more processing so watch out if your computer isn't powerfull enough.

Another small review, again sorry if english isn't perfect (no translator used).

Enjoy the game, if you buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100510841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1514194849}
review:
Piccola perla che ogni appassionato di avventure grafiche vecchia scuola dovrebbe giocare.
GAMEPLAY: Classico punta e clicca con un comando per osservare ed uno per interagire. Enigmi sempre ben contestualizzati, mai banali ma nemmeno troppo difficili. L'ambientazione cyberpunk ha permesso agli sviluppatori di creare fasi di gameplay ben riuscite che danno freschezza al tipo di gioco, come ad esempio le fasi giocate nel trancenet, una piattaforma internet dove il personaggio entra virtualmente. Menù e opzioni ridotte al minimo sindacale.
STORIA: Sicuramente un punto forte del gioco, la narrazione si sviluppa tra indagini poliziesche, intrecci di più personaggi e un contesto cyberpunk molto ben rappresentato. Le tematiche trattate sono fortemente riservate ad un pubblico adulto e non mancano risvolti interessanti. La caratterizzazione dei personaggi è costruita bene ed è anch'essa pilastro di questo gioco. Longevità che si attesta su buoni livelli, una decina di ore, anche qualcosa in più se si spulcia per bene il gioco con la sua enorme mole di dialoghi.
GRAFICA: Pixel art ispirata, bella per gli appassionati di questo stile e del genere cyberpunk. Tecnicamente però non raggiunge produzioni moderne, sempre in pixel art, come ad esempio Thimbleweed Park. Interfaccia in-game non delle più intuitive.
AUDIO: Colonna sonora adeguata al genere, fa il suo lavoro senza però rimanere impressa. Doppiaggio in inglese ottimamente recitato che fa la parte da leone e sopperisce a molte delle mancanze grafiche/tecniche. Gioco purtroppo non localizzato in italiano.
VOTO: 8

author: {'steamid': '76561198274172156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1527471849}
review: I loved it! I loved the cyberpunk setting, the thought put into the world, the synth salesman that was totally an homage to the Carry On guy, all the random phone numbers you can dial and connect to random dialogue...oh, and the plot was also pretty good! Haha, but it's the little things that make this world really fun to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011548001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1513690384}
review:
유전공학이 발달해서 사람의 뼈가 폭탄이 되도록 만들 수 있는 세계에서
가상공간을 넘나들며 진행하는 어드벤쳐 게임

처음엔 잠깐 지루했으나 조금만 참고 진행하니
흥미진진한 전개로 엔딩까지 꽤 재밌게 플레이 했음.

퍼즐은 좀 어려운 느낌이라 공략을 봐야 했고,
AI나 가상세계에 연결되는 것들은 SF의 흔한 소재들이라 식상하게 느끼는 사람들도 있을법함.

그래도 흥미로운 세계관과 스토리로 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997144733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1513646166}
review:
I had started out playing without any expectation beforehand. I just knew it was a cyberpunk-ish adventure game and decided to give it a shot. I believe it was worth it, as it turned out to be a nice experience with a pretty decent fiction and a well narrated story behind it.

In a personal way, it has reminded me about how good 2D adventure games still can be. Overall, this was a nice "getaway" that kept me from playing any storyless/multiplayer 3D game for sometime, which kind of feels pointless to go back to, after spending my nights playing this well-thought-out game.

Oh my, yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016989249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 2515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2515, 'last_played': 1513777316}
review:
This is one of the best adventure games I have ever played, and I have played quite a lot. From the very beginning, the game delivers a strong flavour of highly inspired work and continues to amaze further on.
Pros :
- Breathtakingly detailed and well thought-out world
- Soild and captivating storyline
- Shiny and flawless dialogue writing
- Marvelous voice acting
- The difficulty of puzzles is just right
Cons :
- The game ends eventually
10/10, the solid recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992123547', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1644045755}
review:
Hello everybody, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for Technobabylon by Technocrat Games and Wadjet Eye Games.

Technobabylon is a very entertaining cyberpunk themed adventure game that follows 3 unique characters. The first character you’re introduced to is named Latha Sesame and happens to be a Trance-addict and winds up just narrowly escaping with her life at the start of the game. The second and third character you’re introduced to are highly trained CEL agents named Charlie Regis and Max Lao. Both characters are partners and they spend most of the game investigating crime scenes and helping each other out.

The game takes place in a fictional and highly advanced city named Newton. The city is a bastion of technology but it’s also home to some rather lax laws. There’s even a restaurant that cooks people (Albeit cloned people but still). The city is dark and you’ll get to travel to quite a few locations over the course of the game.

Newton is also controlled by the world’s most advanced AI ever conceived named Central. CEL agents report to Central and everyone’s movements are tracked by the AI. There’s no true way to escape its gaze and some of the criminal underworld doesn’t like that and they come up with a scheme to take control of the city.

The game’s story has a lot of twists and turns and all of its characters were very well written and acted. The game covers some pretty dark material so it might not be the best game to let children play. It also features some impressive pixel art graphics and its backdrops are colorful and pretty to look at. Also, it’s soundtrack is superb throughout too. Be sure to check out my playthrough of the entire game below to see if it’s something that you’d enjoy.

If you’re a fan of adventure games, or even cyberpunk themed games, then I highly recommend picking this game up, it’s great.

If you're interested in checking out the full review or viewing my final score, you can find the full review here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/adventure/technobabylon-review

Thanks for taking the time to read the review folks, happy gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964345647', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1478663729}
review:
Pixel Art: 4/5
Immersion: 4/5 (Great voice acting)
Game Play: 3/5
Controls: N/A
Value: 3/5
Difficulty: 2/5
--------------
Overall 3.5

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31208751/]Please follow my Pixel Art Curation for other great games...[/url]


Dark and gritty cyberpunk dystopia adventure with excellent pixel art design!

Although I have not been a fan of Wadjet Eye Games themselves, I do appreciate many that they discover and publish, this being one of the better.

There are lots of great settings and characters throughout and the story keeps you engaged along the way.  It is also a great use of multiple character and timeline story telling.

I am a sucker of the genre, even when it is done half way decent and this one excels!


ACHIEVEMENTS:  Pretty straight forward, might need a little assistance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036101902', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1512129214}
review:
Simply phenomenal story, loaded with humour and some pretty grimdark themes. No fridge logic, although there are some parts where a little prod wouldn't hurt, but overall the puzzles are satisfying and you do feel clever for solving some of them.

Overall, very highly recommended. Cann't  wait for whatever Technocrat Games decided to put out next. Instant buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020740602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1512100084}
review:
A great point and click game. The polished old school graphics are my favorite for point and clicks. The puzzles and dialougue are well made. The overall story is great as well. And I like the technology and the idea of trancing.
Anyone who enjoys a point and click mystery adventure will love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960292462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1511619947}
review:
Technobabylon is an adventure game in the style of - you guessed - beneath a steel sky.
The story and game world are intriguing and there are some plot twists that might come unexpected.
Some choices you make will lead to a few differences in the game world so you can kinda play it your style or assume a roleplay about the characters - will you stay to your morals or give in to temptations, will you help or exploit? It's a nice touch but not that cruicial to the storys development until the ending.
The art style brings up memories from the old days of adventure games and is overall fitting and pleasant to the eye.
The puzzles are not that hard and not too simple.

If you take your time it is a good entertainment for a few evenings. Overall playtime for me was 9-10 hours which is okay for the price. I can definitly recommend this little adventure game gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037974560', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1549870209}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007052209', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1505595388}
review: Um dos jogos mais Cyberpunk que já joguei!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982964370', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1511026018}
review:
Wadjet Eye Games once again bring us another quality adventure game.  On display here is quality storytelling and a slew of  excellent puzzles in a fantastical setting.  Definitely pick this game up if you're a fan of cyberpunk games or adventure games.

If you enjoyed this, definitely also check out 1994's classic adventure game 'Beneath a Steel Sky', free on GoG.  I would be extremely surprised if it was not a direct inspiration to Technobabylon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995935948', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1617899155}
review: A slightly more serious tone than other offerings from Wadjet Eye Games. Interesting story line and characters. Not obvious what you are meant to be doing sometimes. For example, you play as different characters throughout the game but only at the end can you switch between three of them during the final chapter. I used a walkthrough several times during my play through and I am not ashamed to admit it! If you liked any other adventure games from this studio you will probably enjoy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056624823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1510069514}
review: Great game and that from a guy that isn't into retro or point'n click at all, what i liked most is that it's adult, the few adventures i played were really childish. It's well thought of as though it's loaded with a lot of different scifi themes the plot works. It's not too hard also, i managed to play through without guides, i'd say it's just right regarding difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116422485', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1515699825}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012423340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1505511243}
review:
In conclusion:

Technobabylon combines the perfect variety of puzzles, with an acceptable aesthetic, and a story that isn't just a simple tale, but an entire world of which the player can only experience a single city. Each detail of every character is not a random aberration, but sourced from some event somewhere in the world, where even the tangential feels substantiated by the broad background painted painstakingly by the author, and drawing the player in.

[url=http://awkwardmixture.blogspot.com/2017/10/technobabylon-cyberpunk-episodic-puzzle.html]Technobabylon: Cyberpunk, Episodic, Puzzle Solving Adventure[/url]

[url=http://awkwardmixture.blogspot.com/2017/10/technobabylon-world-unto-itself.html]Technobabylon: A World Unto Itself[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970368124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1509473851}
review:
I just finished this game and can only recommend it to all point-and-click adventure fans out there. I am personally a huge fan of cyberpunk stories and this one has a detective touch to it. The story is well written and unfolds at the perfect pace and never ceases to be interesting. I couldn't stop playing the game because I wanted to know how the story carries on. The characters are likeable, well written and every character is fully voice acted in this game and the voice acting is great! The puzzles itself are always fair and understandable. I didn't get frustrated a single time about any of the puzzles. 

Prepare for memorable moments with: Cheffie, the mindjacking bot from Greater Han (he is the real HOSTNAME) and a lot of wetware.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960355326', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1481906488}
review:
One of the best adventures of the last years, and probably my favourite game by Wadjet Eye. This game has an amazing plot, with captivating characters. The puzzle design also is top notch, with logic and fun enigmas, well integrated in the world and different than the usual "piece of paper under the door to get the key"

4.5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198070688832', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1507544532}
review:
Fun game with some minor point & click issues but overall the characters, world and story pull you in by being fully fleshed out and enjoyable/memorable. 

Set some time aside to play it, especially if your into the cyberpunk genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049172944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1508512518}
review: Me ha gustado. Se trata de una aventura gráfica point and click, bastante sencilla, entretenida y no excesivamente larga, de buen argumento y ritmo. Eso sí, se requiere un nivel "apañado" de inglés, ya que no está traducido (ni obviamente doblado) al español.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128285760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1558726338}
review:
If you like great cyperpunk stories and great point and click adventure games then definitely play this game! Great dialog and characters that you care, good voice acting,  an intriguing story, a really cool world to explore and some really well thought and logical puzzles that do not fall into the usual trap of frustrating you with random nonsensical solutions. Everything here makes sense and finding out the solutions of the puzzles is really rewarding. Bonus points for making some of the puzzles and scenes having a different solution and outcome. 
And even if you are not a fan of these types of games still, give it a try with the free demo and you may end up enjoying this more than you expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029041220', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1508711321}
review: I literally stayed up past bed time on a Sunday night to finish this game. #awesomesauce Highly recommended if you like point and click, sci-fi, Cyberpunk games with great storytelling, gorgeous pixel art and an atmospheric soundtrack to boot. Plus it totally bulldozes that thought experiment online about  whether you would save 1000 embryos vs. a 5 yr old kid - watch what the protagonist goes through in this and realise how it is as cruel as the wife vs mother question. That aside... makes me want to get a copy of Gemini Rue on Steam and replay it. Also... would totally be in for a sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973241560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1502650445}
review:
Fabulous game! Technocrat and Wadjet Eye make for a great team and the added commentary track that runs throughout the game is something I really like that Wadjet do. 

The game never gets boring, I like the cyberpunk sci-fi noire art style and thoroughly enjoyed the story.

I hope they turn this in to a series like Blackwell, it just seems like the endless possibilities of "The Trance" is something that could be explored a lot further! 

Recommended.

review: One of my favorite games. The cyberpunk/futuristic setting is awesome. The story, writing, and voice acting are all great. The point and click part of this game is great as well. If you enjoy good scifi adventures you will like this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198027484609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1506724930}
review:
The game is on the challenging side for a point and click, which for some might be wonderful, but for me left me frustrated. I think the lack of explanation of the game features made for a frustrating start that continued into a reasonable story in an unknown world.

Didn't love it, and given the "on rails single solution" nature of the puzzles, it doesn't seem worth $15 to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146600270', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1606854493}
review:
This is one of the best quest games that I have ever played.

I came to this game after finishing the excellent Blackwell, which is made by the same publisher. However, Technobabylon takes it a couple of levels up with more complex puzzles, plot and gameplay.

This game will leave you with some phylosophical thoughts, as it shows simultaneously how cool the future can be, as well as how messed up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977286789', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1454099053}
review: Auf jeden Fall sein Geld wert. Das Spiel ist recht umfangreich, abwechslungsreich und hat sympathische Charaktere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962984082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1506322466}
review:
I am late to the party in 2017 but I am glad I played this game.

This point and click adventure oozes a rich atmosphere that combines cyberpunk and noir. Many puzzles allows you to solve differently and let you make decisions that will impact the ending. The story is grim but with doses of humor here and there. it grabbed me from the start and intrigues me until the very end. Puzzles are mostly logical and didn't require serious pixel hunting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999173492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1506224099}
review:
Highly recommend this game - the characters and story are well thought out and interesting and there's a solid 6-8 hours gameplay here at least. The story moved at a good pace and kept me wanting to play through to the end. The world is well built and interesting to learn about as the game goes on.

The puzzles in the game are mostly fairly easy (compared to many adventure games) although there were one or two that needed a bit of trial and error - never felt that they were too crazy though compared to some of the ones i've ran into in other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970995037', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1506049341}
review:
Wadjet Eye does it again! A great sci-fi/cyberpunk adventure with multiple endings that will keep you wanting to play until you finish it. The multifaceted story ties itself together nicely, and all of the writing is top notch.

Check out my full playthrough on YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzL75gxhnhSX_ZP2abak67kXwzp5mVi-d

author: {'steamid': '76561197992892379', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1505524274}
review:
Solid AGS-based adventure game with a gripping story and interesting characters. It’s sci-fi, but the game doesn’t take itself too seriously. Most of the futuristic things you encounter are based on something that exists today, only taken a few notches further. The setting comes across as a satire of the modern world. So there’s a lot of gags and comedy characters, but it feels somewhat generic.

The puzzles are pretty decent, if a little silly at times. They’re not hard by adventure game standards. I think there were only one or two that got me really stuck. Many puzzles have multiple solutions, which is always nice.

Compared to other AGS games I’ve played, I’d say it’s not quite as good as Gemini Rue or Primordia, but better than The Samaritan Paradox and Shardlight.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970609941', 'num_games_owned': 1775, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1704921740}
review:
Usually I'm not that much into point&click adventure games, but I got hooked on this one. One reason is that the puzzles aren't that hard - for which I am grateful. But the much bigger reason is the just awesome background story, and how it enfolds during the game. The sci-fi ideas touch a lot of interesting fields like geopolitics, human ethics, VR and so on. The characters you play and interact with are likeable and have profund things to say.
All in all I'm very happy I got to play Technobabylon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053614327', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1659029617}
