review: Dont normally play point and clicks but i like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1504378443}
review:
Lo recomiendo, pero por los pelos. Me gustó mucho la ambientación y la historia en sí. La parte jugable tiene algunos momentos demasiado "de aventura gráfica" con puzzles forzados y en algunas ocasiones hay puzzles de tiempo, que requieren de habilidad.

 En uno de los más flagrantes ejemplos, tuve que bajar la velocidad de andar de los personajes porque si no el puzzle iba demasiado rápido para que diera tiempo.

Además, para que me funcionara el juego, tuve que ponerlo en modo DirectDraw, porque en DirectX me salía pantallazo negro. A ver si para el siguiente juego que hagan cambian el motor, porque ya le pesan demasiado los años.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002009022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1506148690}
review:
When does this game get good? Slow as hell build up. I started and quit it about half a dozen times. Finally decided to let go of it.

Note on modern adventure games: the Telltale style and walking simulator games have surpassed random object-MacGyvering (use this blob on that thing, or on myself, but not on that other thing! no no!) as a game mechanic. If something is just gonna be a linear story, then get the heck on with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069637345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1503489140}
review: Played through this game in a few days and it was very enjoyable. As a person who has played most of the top rated point and click adventure games this felt to me most akin to a Beneath a Steel Sky theme visually but the advanced AI and Bio Hacking themes were excellent. Areas where you hack in to AI, other people or reprogram android were well throught out and really fun. The story was well thought out and enjoyable, all in all a great fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119684293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1503202863}
review:
Nos encontramos ante una aventura de corte clásico "point n click". Es un policial ambientado en un mundo ciberpunk en el que tendremos que investigar una serie de asesinatos perpetuados por un asesino conocido como “Mind Jaker” (Roba mentes) y para ello iremos alternando entre Latha una desempleada quien malgasta sus días en el ciberespacio al que llaman “Trance”, Regis un poli de la vieja escuela y a Max su joven compañera quien si bien utiliza “Trance” respeta los métodos de la vieja escuela.

Es recomendable jugar a esta aventura en “Español” al menos que se tenga un muy buen nivel de ingles ya que la historia es algo complicada y hay mucha terminología técnica. Si bien no hay una traducción oficial se puede encontrar sin mucha dificultad (explico mas abajo).

El aspecto gráfico nos hace recordar a las aventuras clásicas de la época dorada. La ambientación esta muy bien lograda, con carteles de neón parpadeantes, pantallas brillantes, grandes edificios, terminales que debemos hackear, personas con implantes cibernéticos, etc. 
De hecho creo que la ambientación es uno de los puntos fuertes de esta aventura, hasta tal punto que a mi forma de ver han sacrificado profundidad en los personajes principales para dar mas “vida” al entorno o personajes secundarios así como también para centrarse en cuestiones técnicas de la historia.

El aspecto sonoro es muy bueno, con música agradable de fondo y con voces muy bien actuadas (en ingles) de absolutamente todos los diálogos.

La jugabilidad es mas que correcta, los puzzles son bastante simples o mejor dicho “lógicos”, salvo una par de cosas algo absurdas al final del juego y solo una “puerta” que a mi ojos era invisible que me hizo recordar como odiaba cuando era mas joven quedar trabado en una aventura por cuestiones de diseño visual mas que por la complejidad de la aventura.

Como contra, que la verdad es bastante subjetivo, podría decir:
- Falta de carisma en los personajes, digamos como que no llegas a encariñarte si lo comparamos con otras aventuras, incluso de la misma desarrolladora, pero por otro lado han enriquecido la ambientación y personajes secundarios.
- La historia un poco desconcertante al principio, mas concretamente en el prologo, pero luego se hace bastante fácil de entender. Da la misma sensación cuando lees esos libros de ciencia ficción que te bombardean con tecnicismos en los primeros capítulos. 
Por otro lado podemos decir nos encontramos con una historia compleja que toca temas que van desde la informática, clonación, inteligencia artificial, ciberespacio, manipulación genética, etc.
- Puede que tengas que ver algún video o guía para resolver algo muy puntual (en mi caso para ver una puerta). A favor tiene que en varias ocasiones tienes distintas formas para resolver una misma cosa y que tiene viarios finales diferentes.
- El logro de rejugarlo con los comentarios de los desarrolladores es molesto, pero por otro lado es menos invasivo que en otras entregas de la misma desarrolladora.... parece que se están dando cuenta.

En resumen, si eres un amante del genero es una aventura debes probar, sobre todo si puedes pillarla en descuento.

Nota:
Hay una traducción que pueden encontrarla perfectamente en Google (Guías Pat & asperet ) para disfrutar del juego en un completo español (las voces seguirán en ingles). 
Deben registrarse en su foro y en la parte de “Traducciones Guías Pat & asperet “, descargar el archivo y descomprimirlo en la carpeta de instalación del juego (C:\Steam\steamapps\common\Technobabylon)

Es recomendable al jugar activar la opción de "Mantener diálogo" en el menú de configuración del juego ya que la historia es complicada y hay mucha terminología técnica, ademas que en algunos momentos los diálogos desaparecen casi de forma instantánea. No se si es por la traducción, pero si les pasa, tan solo darle una vez al espaciador y desaparece el problema.

Puedo dar fe después de haber haberlo pasado 2 veces de que funciona de principio a fin y que no hay absolutamente ningún problema, bug, o nada parecido salvo el mencionado anteriormente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021953887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1625960581}
review:
I am really enjoying this game!
Old school low resolution graphics cannot hide the gem behind them:

- Pinpoint accurate humor on many dialoges, with funny references/hints to the Computer Gamming culture (Nigerian-frowd and spam mails bearing viruses in your inbox, roleplaying 'in-character' MMO culture sarcasm etc)  

- I engaged most of the dialoges for three-four repeated times, just to enjoy again the voice acting and the character personalities, "oh my, yes!"

- Interesting shi-phi aura and world setting

- Mature game, not fearing to be characterised 18+ (includes: homosexual maried couples, sex-robots, ingeniously presentation of a sex-changed character etc)

If there was a "Technobabylon 2" out there, I would already be on my way for a SteamWalletRecharge card.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123055853', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1502835730}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053266514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1502626679}
review: Großartige sci-fi/Cyberpunk-Geschichte mit viel Liebe zum Detail, optisch wie akustisch, die einem oft, ohne es zu merken, die Wahl der Mittel überlässt. Hat mich auf Anhieb gepackt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076873743', 'num_games_owned': 5236, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1502337348}
review: I don't play many point and click games, but this is the best one I've played by far.  It has a great storyline/voice acting and I enjoy games with a space punk type of atmosphere to it.   My only real complaint is that the steam overlay would not work with this game, and I had to keep shutting the game down to check if my achievements were registering as well as following a guide when I got stuck on certain puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041685476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1502218703}
review:
Definitely a satisfying point´n click/adventure game!
Well, by satisfying i mean GREAT!

Pros:
- Great story, told/played from different perspectives
- Interesting characters, mostly relatable or at least entertaining
- Okay/not too hard puzzles/tasks - most of them are somewhat intuitive/logical
- Great atmosphere, music and setting (including own slang)
- A lot of references to our actual contemporary society and how it may develop in this not too far future (AIs, surveillance/inner security, internet addiction, GMOs, warfare, nutrition, pollution...)
- Nice artwork, oldschool graphics
- Good voice acting
- References to other post-apocalyptic and Cyberpunk games/universes (like Shadowrun, Fallout etc, also reminiscent of a certain Portal character)
- Often times real funny and macabre/dark humor and cynicism
- Confronts the player with interesting choices, including questions of ethics (or "philosophy" in general)
- At least two slightly different endings dependent on your choices

Cons:
- Setting up the  graphics is not necessarily intuitive, may even start with black screen (but the web helps!)
- Minor sound glitches, though it sometimes adds to the atmosphere in the "Trance"( i.e. matrix,cyberspace or whatever you call it in other franchises)
- The graphics (especially in a small window) sometimes lead to overlooking objects (so sometimes it´s better to check the web after being stuck for too long)

All in all absolutely recommendable, especially on sale. The game also has some "real time" elemets, but not too hard and not too many, so it can be played conveniently on travels, on the laptop in bed etc. The play time is also not too short (on- and offline time together i played a little more than 20 h i guess. So you may see only half the time recorded on Steam here)

I was already in love with Wadjet Eye Games after the Blackwell saga, and I don't think this game will let any fan down.

Fans of Point'n Click and/or Cyberpunk games MUST play this!
Non fans of either should ponder about it if its store page appeals to them even a single bit.

All in all, this game is awesome! Oh my, yes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128788858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1500615160}
review:
A true chapter in an otherwise unpublished Essentials of Cyberpunk Culture: Video Games.

Playing this will invoke memories from such franchises as the Matrix, Blade Runner, and Shadowrun.
While technically a point-and-click puzzle game, if you have any interest in the aforementioned culture, you'll quickly find yourself sucked into this resource-light, lore-heavy game.
With a little ingenuity, players will find this to be a challenge but not overwhelming by any means.

Because it is a suspenseful mystery that you must solve, I won't give too much away.

Early on, we meet some key players in the story. A Trance-addict who's unemployed and living in assigned housing and used to spending most of her time in Technobabylon's version of the Matrix. Two detectives whose personalities compliment each other well - an old-fashioned male and a jack-of-all-trades female, old and young respectively. These two quickly find themselves investigating a murder commited by a suspect who's known only as the Mindjacker.

Admittedly, this is where I saved and took my first break, so I don't know which direction my story will go from here, only that I want to pick this up again very soon and inject myself back into the gritty cyber noir that is Technobabylon.

Cyberpunks or those interested in the culture will find that it reads much like a book that you don't much care to put down. A real page-turner, as it were.

Enjoy, chummers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967112497', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1500353306}
review: Exceptional. One of the finer examples of this type of adventure game. Clever story, operation, and execution. Great voice acting, excellent music, and overall a perfect and very enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995319267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1307, 'last_played': 1499826083}
review: After completing Primorida, which is awesome in its own right, I bought this, Shardlight, and Gemini Rue having faith that they would be just as amazing. Having yet to get to Shardlight and GR, and I can say that after completing Technobabylon that I am not only a fan of this publisher and developer, but have total faith and high expectations from any game they make. TB itself far exceeded my expectations. I was thoroughly hooked throughou the entire story, and not once did I lose interest. The dialogue was great, the pacing was perfect, the voice actors fit each character they voiced, and the puzzles were engaging and challenging enough to make you think about what the hell to do next and how to do it. Of course the artwork and locations also were wonderfully done and each environment felt like it fit naturally in the world. This is a great game that I highly recommend, and I would encourage the purchase of the titles I mentioned above as well if you want to experience more from this style/genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206432521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1499707943}
review: This was a nice adventure in good traditions of Bladerunner. Strong writing. Adequate interesting characters. Believable gamesetting. There are multiple ways to resolve certain situations. However, that doesn't seem to affect the story line. Definitely a good game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034210176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1499297624}
review:
TL;DR - I was blown away by the storyline, character development and atmosphere of this game. This truly is a masterpiece that any lover of science fiction or adventure games needs to experience.

I haven't written a review in quite awhile but felt that this game deserved one. I'm an old gamer (in my mid-30s) and I've played a lot of games in my lifetime. Over the years, I've moved away from the Adventure genre but I started my decades long addiction when LucasArts was in its heyday so I've experienced more than my fair share of these type of games. While this is not the typical style of game I get into these days, I had picked up a copy a while back after reading some stellar reviews. Despite the strong recommendations online, I was honestly very surprised with how quickly I became hooked on this game after I finally got around to loading it up. 

Technobabylon is hands down one of the best storylines I've come across in a video game (a scifi plot as grandiose as any William Gibson or Neil Stephenson novel) and as a storytelling device, the adventure style of gameplay is masterfully implemented to deliver a truly compelling narrative. The graphics are by no means cutting edge but do have a sort of retro-style charm that reminds me strongly of the 90s game "The Dig". The puzzles are at times challenging but also masterfully intuitive. Never was i forced to consult a walkthrough but a few times I did have to walk away to clear my brain so I could reassess the task at hand. Perhaps even more telling is how amazingly the game pulls you into its world. Technobabylon incorporates a number of advanced sci-fi concepts which are very much incorporated into the puzzles but it delivers these concepts naturally so at no point did I feel like the game broke the 4th wall in order to explain some info necessary to move forward. Lastly worth noting were the multiple "choose your own adventure" elements which allowed for divergent paths within storyline. These elements were nothing extraordinary but it did lend the feeling that you were tailoring your own experience based on the subtle choices you made; just another example of the little subtleties that took this game from good to great.

In summary, this game is one of those gems that grabs a hold of you and doesn't let you go until you have completed it at which point your drive to find out what happens is replaced by a sadness that the story has come to an end. It is quite rare that I experience this feeling with a video game.. as it is more common with a good book that you just can't put down. If you like science fiction storylines, adventure games or just good stories in general, do yourself a favor and pick up this game. 10/10

Pros:
+ One of the best storylines I've come across in 25+ years of gaming
+ Playable characters are compelling and offer different playing styles which maintains the game tempo
+ Interface and Inventory interaction are a joy to use (very well implemented)
+ Puzzles are challenging but logically intuitive
+ Scifi concepts are naturally delivered in a way that never breaks the immersion
+ Voice and music audio are very well done
+ Choose your own adventure elements give you a feeling of control without overdoing it to a point where you feel like you are missing a part of the storyline
+ Graphics give the game a retro feel that lovers of the old LucasArts games will appreciate
+ Multiple Endings

Cons:
- Graphics could be fairly classified as outdated and will turn off some gamers
- Upon completion, will create a vacuum in your life which you will need to fill with more sci-fi storylines

author: {'steamid': '76561198105445916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1499395990}
review:
Going into Technobabylon, I didn't expect much as I'm not a huge point-and-click adventure game fan. However, Technobabylon is a real treat and is worth experiencing for fans of any game genre. I would even go as far to say that Technobabylon surpasses Telltale's best games in terms of ingenuity.

The game features a rich story in a dystopian future that may feel convoluted in some areas, though any intelligent individual will appreciate the way the plot is carried out. Without spoiling too much, it deals with murder mysteries and a serial killer who can literally steal the minds of his victims - hence his name, the Mindjacker.

It's full of well-developed characters, intriguing plot twists, and original concepts. The gameplay deals with dialogue-heavy conversations and some challenging puzzles that are incredibly well-designed. In Technobabylon, any items you receive to solve a puzzle make sense in the way they're used. It really plays with your intellect and keeps you sharp the whole way through.

There's also quite a bit of content here. The game took me more than ten hours. Add to that some charming graphics combined with a fantastic soundtrack, and you have one of the best adventure games ever created. Period.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065274822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1486147693}
review:
The best written graphic adventure I've played. Nails the future atmosphere, makes every character interesting and is full of intriguing twists and tough choices. As usual in graphic adventures, some puzzles are unintuitive and require a bit of pixel-hunting. Dialogue options have a limited impact and the ending is decided pretty much in the last five minutes.

A note on LGBT representation (minor spoilers): the game sports several LGBT characters pivotal to the story. While they're both multi-dimensional and diverse, they tend to die very quickly in accordance to the established tropes. A shame considering the otherwise good representation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017269614', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1499066267}
review:
Antes de tudo: Como artisticamente belo é este jogo.

Technobabylon é um jogo de Adventure/Point and Click
Basicamente ele tem uma narrativa forte e cheia de puzzles para se resolver e avançar na sua história.
Segue na linha de jogos como Full Throttle, Day of Tentacle, e coisas assim que pessoas velhas como eu jogavam nos anos 90.

Enredo: 8/10
Dificuldade: 8/10 (Esta nota não é sobre o quão díficil o jogo é, e sim o tão "justo" é sua dificuldade. .Quebrei a cabeça algumas vezes mas não precisei recorrer aos walkthroughs. Eu sou meio burrinho, então achei que o jogo teve uma dificuldade satisfatória.
Arte: 9/10
Duração: por volta de umas 9-12 horas na primeira jogatina.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061904672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1499589863}
review: If you like a game that makes you THINK when it comes to problem solving, then this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989027274', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1498745400}
review:
Technobabylon ist ein Cyberpunk Point & Click Adventure von Technocrat Games und wurde von Wadjet Eye gepublished. Soweit ich es beurteilen kann, ist es das erste "umfangreiche" Spiel des Entwicklers, welches mich dann auch noch derart gepackt und umgehauen hat, aufgrund der genialen Geschichte, der super ausgearbeiten Charaktere, der durchaus originellen Rätsel und nicht zuletzt des Cyperpunk Settings. Beim ersten Wurf ein Volltreffer - Respekt, Technocrat, Respekt! Was macht ihr als nächstes? :)

Die Geschichte spielt in der Stadt Newton im Jahre 2087. Die Stadt wird Schauplatz mehrerer Verbrechen eines so genannten "Mindjacker", der wie der Name schon fast verät, den Verstand und dessen verbunden Erinnerungen seiner Opfer extrahieren und speichern kann.

Der Gesetzesapparat der Stadt wird durch eine adaptive und ständig lernende künstliche Intelligenz namens "Central" gesteuert und überwacht. Central setzt, infolge der Ereignisse, zwei der Protagonisten, die Ermittler Charlie Regis und Max Lao auf den Fall an und beauftragt sie den Verbrecher dingfest zu machen. Welches Motiv der Mindjacker hat bleibt zunächst unklar, es stellt sich allerdings ziemlich schnell heraus, dass auch der dritte spielbare Charakter, die von der Realität in die virtuelle Welt flüchtende Jugendliche Latha Sesame, eine größer Rolle in dem Ganzen spielt.

Fazit: Wenn ihr einen bis ins Detail ausgetüftelten Cyberpunk Krimi sucht, der intelligent, spannend und auch humorvoll ist, dann könnt ihr hier bedenkenlos zugreifen. Einige echt coole Plottwists und Szenarien, die auch ethische Fragen aufwerfen, erwarten euch zusätzlich.

Minimale, technische Schwachpunkte, wie eine etwas zu geringe Auflösung und die sehr rudimentären grafischen Einstellungsmöglichkeiten, hat das Spiel leider ebenfalls, mit denen man aber leben kann - hey, es ist auch ein Adventure Spiel eines Indie Entwicklers und kein Triple-A-Shooter ;). Ich hab es letzendlich im Fenstermodus gezockt, das fand ich persönlich angenehmer. Dieses Manko kann bei mir persönlich nicht über das exzellente Spielerlebnis hinwegtäuschen. Super!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977878581', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1442520094}
review: Epic

author: {'steamid': '76561198025647144', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1499288325}
review:
Si vous avez déjà fait quelques jeux édités par Wadget Eye Games, vous serez en terrain connu : Technobabylon est encore un point & click de très bonne facture, avec une patte artistique "à l'ancienne mais moderne" de grande qualité, des doubleurs inspirés, une histoire bien ficelée et des personnages sacrement attachants. J'ai trouvé les énigmes un poil plus compliquées que d'habitude, mais elles restent toujours accessibles, et cerise sur le gâteau, il y a souvent plusieurs façons d'avancer - un luxe rare dans les point & cllick.

Le plus compliqué est peut-être de rentrer dans l'univers cyberpunk pur jus de ce titre : pas d'explication sur la trance, le wetware, grey goo & co., tous les protagonistes connaissent ça par coeur et personne ne vous fera un cours magistral. C'est mieux pour l'immersion, mais ça peut être déroutant au début, surtout qu'il faudra jouer avec tout ça pour résoudre les premières énigmes de ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001871839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1498674696}
review: OH MY YES!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007364080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1537720522}
review:
Technobabylon is a superbly made game by Wadjet - the story is engaging with plenty of plot twists; the cast of characters are superb; and the puzzles are nicely thought out, with the Trance elements a really good addition to puzzle-solving - it's quite similar to what Beneath a Steel Sky used. And the game's setting and locations are nicely detailed.

Overall, I found this enjoyable from start to finish. This is a must-have if you liked and enjoyed Wadjet's other titles, or any point-and-click adventures in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017054316', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1498537788}
review: Excellent adventure game! Great story, art and voice acting. Puzzles are just the right difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269023590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4262, 'last_played': 1497226498}
review: I sank quite a few hours into this so it's with some regret that I can't really give it a positive review. The game does some things really well and early on it looked quite promising. A strong plot with some clever puzzles combined with good voice acting had me hooked. Gradually the plot thins out though and the poor quality of the graphics starts to grate. The last part of the story just has one main puzzle to solve and then it's game over. A bit of a disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1498116675}
review:
There are so many competing visions of the future in media that it makes the fully-realized ones stand out all the more. After all, it's easy to envision a blasted wasteland or an ocean of shimmering glass towers but not so easy to envision how to get there. Technobabylon has no problem clearing both of these hurdles, establishing a thoroughly wired world of networked decadence built on the ashes of the old order. But what makes this title truly remarkable is how that is the very least of its narrative accomplishments.

Set in the advanced, AI-directed city of Newton, Technobabylon follows the stories of Latha Sesame, a Trance-addicted (think super VR internet) young girl from the slums and Charlie Regis, an investigator for the previously-mentioned AI's management bureau. Their tales dig deep from the introductory scenes of poverty and squalor on Latha's side and cold authority on Charlie's. Both are brought together in a very clever way as the plots involving them expand to encompass Charlie's tragic past and hand in what the city has become, eventually touching on the underlying conflict between the rigid governance of the present and the chaos that preceded it.

I know I'm talking about the plot in terribly vague terms but for a game that's around six hours long, there is an incredible amount of narrative twists and turns crammed in there. From humble beginnings trying to puzzle a way out of a locked room and investigating a murder scene, you'll be taken on a whirlwind tour through the wars of the old world, the AI dominance of the city, heartbreaking personal tragedy, blackmail plots, conspiratorial uprisings, and terrorist attacks. There's so much going on here that you're sure to get sucked into the story by something, and once you do it all starts to fit together in a masterful puzzle that may have more relevance to our present society than we'd like to admit. The dystopian themes are strong here and surface everywhere you look, from the gruesome extents that gene engineering reaches to the differences in food machines throughout the game.

What really sells the narrative here though are the characters that you share it with. Technobabylon features some of the best writing and voice acting to be found on the indie end of the spectrum, forming connections between you and people having to deal with organic computers in their brains and explosives in their bones. The natural, flowing dialogue keeps the game grounded even when the plot takes off, and I don't think the game would have worked half as well if not for the excellent deliveries of the entire cast. Charlie and his partner Lao in particular have a wonderful interplay that speaks volumes about their personalities and relationship from even the smallest conversations. And it deserves recognition that similar attention is paid to every character in the game, no matter how minor.

As an adventure game, Technobabylon limits your movements more than most but makes up for it with the aforementioned dialogue and equally clever puzzles. Interaction is simply left-click for use or pick up and right-click for examine, and there are never more than five or six items to juggle at a time. Figuring out how they work together is the challenge, especially with the introduction of some surprisingly deep side mechanics. Latha, for example, can enter the Trance which is a VR network interface. Using organic computing material she can connect to everything from vending machines to door locks and interact with them in cyberspace as you would any other character. Charlie also gets some neat gadgets like a future cellphone that can manage data and network connections, and a gadget called an AI splitter that I won't describe but is used in one of the most clever puzzles I have ever seen.

Still, each chapter is comprised of only a few scenes and usually revolves around a single central goal. It's not a bad way to handle the gameplay in light of the complex story it supports but it should be noted if you're more a fan of wide-open adventures. This one has also made me appreciate LucasArts-style deathless adventures all the more because in the few scenes where death is a possibility, it's not handled all that well. There's one scene where almost everyone playing is going to die at least once, because literally the most conspicuous object in the room is a crate and it will get you killed instantly if you try to interact with it at all. The art style honestly doesn't help this or the matter of finding items, as the chunky pixel style isn't a great match for the slick, detailed world around you. Still, these end up being minor gripes when viewed against the towering success of the story and puzzles. Technobabylon was a pleasant surprise, one that grew more and more impressive the further I delved into its secrets.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996762280', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1497186238}
review:
The dystopian world envisioned in this game contains things that I'm sure will happen in real life in the future, which is both scary and... no, it's just scary. The point-and-click part is pretty OK, meaning the objects are rarely hard to find. The game is pretty light in moon logic ("twisted logic that seems tailor-made to frustrates you" - urbandictionary.com) and I only got stuck really badly a few times. Even if it looks dated, this is a modern game with good artwork, story, and some interesting characters.

Rating: I for one welcome our new AI overlord!
*Editors' Pick* x1
http://pixelloot.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198127219999', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1484205524}
review: Lovely game, excellent writing. One the finest, cleanest cyberpunk adventures I've ever encountered. Thematically strong with full characters and ideas. If you like point-and-click adventures, get it. If you like cyberpunk, get it. If you like emotional, complex, smart stories, get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015022645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1496894514}
review:
c'est l'un des meilleurs jeux édité par Wadjeteyegames. il a tout ce qu'il faut. Des énigmes complexes mais pas trop. Une histoire passionnante. Des personnages attachants et réalistes, y compris par leurs faiblesses.
Les graphismes sont, comme toujours, assez old-school mais très bien faits. On en redemande.

It is one of the best games published by Wadjeteyegames. It simply has everything. Complex riddles but not too much. A fascinating story. Charming and realistic characters, including their weaknesses.
The graphics are, as usual, pretty old-school but very well made. We ask for more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009686082', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1496704286}
{'steamid': '76561198057871277', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1480170584}
review:
Lors de mon 1er contact avec ce jeu, j'ai été totalement rebuté par le système de Wetware qui fait que je n'avais même pas réussi à sortir de la première salle du jeu. J'ai quand même persévéré sur les conseils d'un mec de canardpc, et je le remercie parce que ce jeu ne m'a quasi plus laché jusqu'à sa conclusion.
Un fois compris le principe du wetware et de la trance, tout va beaucoup mieux. D'ailleurs, et c'est une bonne habitude des éditions Wadjet Eyes, les énigmes sont logiques et pas basées sur des associations d'objets hasardeuses (coucou Monkey Island).
J'ai apprécié changer de personnage et donc de perspective régulièrement, chaque perso ayant ses propres capacités. Je n'ai pas trouvé l'histoire spécialement complexe, je l'ai même trouvé remarquablement claire au vu du nombre d'intervenants et de forces en présence. Le jeu nous laisse souvent choisir notre propre solution, ce qui est assez rare dans ce type de jeu pour être signalé. Du tout bon, donc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031212687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1579668161}
review:
Holy crap, this is amazing!

Great art: Clearly understood images, colorful characterization, punchy backgrounds, and beautiful equipment design, with carefully thought out details.  If you like Ghost in the Shell for its background art, you're gonna love Technobabylon.

Even better writing: rich characters, plausible motivations, interesting plot.  And ROCK SOLID world building, with great updates to cyberpunk classic dystopianism (yeah, climate change has replaced overpopulation), detailed and well-motivated ideas about A.I., and serious thought as to technology driving social changes, rather than just being tacked-on magic.

This is what cyberpunk should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037878336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1531831731}

review: A tight, great cyberpunk story. A bit on the short side, but the price tag evens it out. I would call this a solid buy for someone looking for a good story or just anyone who is a fan of sci fi!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091468252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1586649826}
review:
Lucas Arts, Reborn!

If you are a fan of the late, great Lucas Arts games, then you will enjoy this game thoroughly.  It captures the look and feel of games like The DIG, while adding a futuristic, "1984" feel.  The puzzles are logical, the characters are interesting, and the game feels complete.

This game is not for everyone, but those of us who love the "point and click" genre have found a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020012941', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1496113366}
review:
This story is quite compelling!  And unlike most point-click adventures, you take control of different characters in different areas of the story, instead of just sticking to one protagonist.  They're not even necessarily on the same side (though you're not taking control of antagonists, either).

The setting in the future is more than just window dressing.  Wetware, synthetics, VR internet, and the AI that serves as the police force's boss, all of these things affect the game's story development and even your gameplay.  You will directly utilize things like wetware and VR internet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983139899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1514646491}
review: I really dug this game. Had some issues with speed control in settings not really adjusting speed of game, but the story was great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994145820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1494435473}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 2313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2313, 'last_played': 1494435305}
review:
Blade Runner 2D Adventure :-)

Ein bemerkenswert gutes Point & Click Adventure.
Es sieht aus und spielt sich wie ein 25 Jahre altes Retro-Adventure.
Dabei ist der Spielfluss jedoch längst nicht so stocksteif, sondern spielt sich sehr flüssig, da man die Items sehr leicht findet und auch einfach benutzen und kombinieren kann.
Besonders gut ist die Einteilung in mehrere Kapitel, wodurch sich die Laufwege meistens auf einzelne Bildschirme begrenzen und man auch nicht zu viel Items dabei hat.
Die Rätsel sind zumeist sehr logisch aufgebaut und für normale Spieler durchaus zu schaffen.
Es gibt eine großartige Hintergrundgeschichte, die bis zum Schluss spannend bleibt, und sich eindeutig an ein erwachsenes Publikum richtet.
Leider gibt es nur englische Sprachausgabe und Texte, zumindest kann man es so einstellen, dass man die Texte weiterklicken muss und sich in Ruhe alles durchlesen kann, um es zu verstehen.
Freunde der Steam Abzeichen werden sicherlich dutzende Spielstände anlegen, um alle Errungenschaften in einem Rutsch zu meistern. Dann entfällt ein erneuter Durchlauf.
Die Spielzeit ist entsprechend der Story großzügig bemessen.
Abstürze hatte ich keine, ich habe jedoch das Tool Borderless Gaming benutzt, damit ich ohne Probleme bei Vollbildansicht auf den Windows-Desktop wechseln konnte.

Alles in allem ist das Spiel sein Geld absolut Wert und gehört in jede Spielesammlung.

Wertung: 8 / 10 Punkte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036459616', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1491966707}
review:
Growing up, was a big fan of point & click games such as:  Full Throttle, The Dig, King's Quest, Police Quest, Legend of Kyrandia, etc.  I got this in a Humble Bundle at some point and time (probably a LONG time ago) and just recently ran across it on Steam, only to realize that I already had it.  Decided to give it a whirl.  Very enjoyable game.  Took my back to the days of really good point & click adventure games.

The story is pretty good, the voice acting, while not amazing... it still pretty good (some characters really shine more than others) and it does a good job of putting you into the feel of the game.  It wasn't overly difficulty.  I managed to finish the game (played it mostly offline) with only having to get hints 2 times (one times was because I completely missed an interactive object in a scene.  Felt stupid.  Hahaha)

If you want to go back in time and enjoy a good adventure game from back in the days of when they were good, then this one is worth checking out.  I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108762252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1494220312}
review: Great game, some good plot, awesome voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027835453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1494005187}
review: Cool little game. Interesting cyberpunk story, definitely not cliched and disturbing at times. Puzzles are not very hard and they are rather logical. Artstyle is very nicely executed and will no doubt please every pixel art fan :). A feature I missed most was the ability to highlight objects you could interact with as I dont like wading my cursor through every pixel until I see writing appear. Other than it is a decent point n click and I can recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981004234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1493900193}
review:
Another gem from the Wadjey Eye Games studios. 

Set in the future you start playing as an unemployed character who just wants to be in "the Trance" (what the 'net has become). Sadly she's booted out as someone locks her in her apartment. So you work to break out.

Following this opening you're introduced to the other main characters of the game: Regis and Lao who work for CEL which is the game's version of the police. You're tasked with investigating a building where a murder might take place in a little while, as predicted by the central AI of the city.

The controls are intuitive with left-click being action and right-click being "look at". You do have an inventory, accessed from the bottom right of the screen, though you never end up carrying too many items. I will say for me that MOST of the puzzles in this game were fairly logical, with the game providing enough context and ideas for you to work out solutions for yourself. It also helped that, on a few occasions, I couldn't leave the scene I was in without solving all the problems so that narrows down where the solutions must be. 

The main puzzled I struggled with involved me having to leave the building i was in to talk to a man who had appeared outside with no indication. The character was not there when I went in the building. Once I had done that, the rest of the puzzles dropped into place.

I enjoyed exploring the world these characters exist in and seeing this particular interpretation of the future. It's not an interpretation I would care to live in however.  Although I would like to explore "the trance". 

A solid addition to the point-and-click adventure game genre. More please!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034269068', 'num_games_owned': 2929, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1493898898}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025049565', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1480146418}
review:
Amateur des grands classiques du point''n'click des années 90,  j'ai un peu trainer avant de me lancer dans ce Technobabylon de peur que la difficulté généralement inhérente au genre me rebute.


L'histoire prend place dans un futur plus ou moins proche où la vie des gens est assisté par ordinateur, que ce soit pour se nourrir, se déplacer, où l'internet d'aujourd'hui a été remplacé par un monde virtuel plus vrai que nature. Une sorte d'évolution hardcore des bases établies au début du XXIéme siècle. Vous êtes un agent du CELL, la police locale et vous devrez enquêter sur une série de meurtres qui semblent avoir un lien eux de par le faite que les victimes se font tuer par une sorte de piratage de leur implant cérébrale que tout être humain qui se respecte possède.

Je n'ai pas envi d'aller plus loin dans l'explication de l'histoire pour ne pas vous spoiler. Niveau gameplay, on reste dans le classique : Dialogues, ramassage d'objets, combinaisons d'objets avec en plus la possibilité d'aller dans la "Trance", la réalité virtuelle remplaçant internet dont je parlais plus haut. Les énigmes sont généralements juste mais pas facile, mais certaines s'avereront retords tout en évitant l'écueuil de l'illogisme.

La réalisation visuelle rétro est de bon goût et l'OST du jeu colle parfaitement avec le jeu. Du tout bon.

+
Histoire
Ambiance
OST

-
Certaines énigmes un peu vénére

author: {'steamid': '76561198316843281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1468798137}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992429689', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1493188243}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961577092', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1493137571}
review:
Fantastic game. If you like adventure games with a well-told story and interesting characters set in a cyberpunk dystopian world then this is the game for you. It is a slow burner though. In the beginning, you will be mostly wondering what it is all about while you are slowly introduced to all the characters and the setting itself - but soon it all comes together and what a tale it is. I enjoyed it.

The puzzles aren't too intense, had to look up two things while playing. At first, I just failed to understand how the terminal I was using in-game was supposed to work, but as soon as I looked it up it made sense. Another problem was at the end and required a "timing" -element. Was not ready for that but that problem also made sense in retrospect.

Otherwise, the graphic is retro but full of color and detail. The voice acting is superb throughout the game. Characters talk and act believably.

I recommend it highly if you like point & click adventure games and want a good story that lasts for quite a while. It took me around 12 hours to complete the game.

review: A very enjoyable point-and-click adventure, with great (classic) visuals and fantastic voice acting. It's no ground breaking work of philosophy, but it does raise some basic questions regarding morality and greater good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970402249', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1492291879}
review: Enfin un jeu d'aventure intelligent, dur mais pas trop (donc gratifiant), sans incohérence ni trop nombreux allers retours. Certes il faut aimer le style graphique, ainsi que les scenarios de SF presque post apocalyptique, mais cela reste abordable ! Ça se boucle en une dizaine d'heures, la musique est sympa mais sans plus mais les doublages sont bons ! L'humour est tt de même là parfois et les personnages sont vraiment bien campés. Vraiment à acheter et à essayer ! Par contre attention : bonne maitrise de l'anglais requise !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1491205666}
review:
Point / Click Adventure.
Gutes Sci/Fi Setting.
Ernste geschichte, aber ein paar lustige Dialoge.
Keine Hotspot Anzeige, was für mich später zu einem echten Problem wurde.
Bin am Anfang (Bis Ende Kapitel 3, wo ich keinerlei Hinweise hatte was zu tun ist und man nur ein bestimmtes Objekt aufheben muss (das man wegen fehlendem Hotspotting leicht übersieht) um dann der Charakter total unglaubwürdige Dinge tut) gut durchgekommen und fand es recht gut.
In Kapitel 4 fand ich die Rätsel dann schon sehr abstrus, konstruiert und schwierig und habe dann aufgehört.
Gute Geschichte / Schwierige Rätsel für die man eigentlich keierlei Lösungshinweise bekommt.
Nicht schlecht, aber es gibt einfach so viele angenehmere Vertreter da draussen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998255697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1490651386}
review:
This is a great point&click made in the style of old Sierra games.
Top quality voice tallents and story make this a must have for all point&click fans out there. It took me about 12 hours to finish the game but I had to peek in some walkthroughs as I don't have a ton of time for gaming.
There was no "moon logic" in this one as much I can tell but I used some walkthroughs to speed up the game.
If not for some setup problems at start I would give this one 10/10.
I would suggest not to ALT-Tab during gameplay as it speeds up dialogues to light speed. Otherwise all was fine and stable.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197997131087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1514075227}
review: Cyberpunk games are rare, good Cyberpunk games are VERY rare. Technobabylon is a rare gem with interesting puzzles, great old school graphics, and a fun plot. If you're a fan of old school adventure games or Cyberpunk in general, purchase this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198145139395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1562505886}
review:
About one-third of the way through, I'm finding this to be an excellent point-n-click adventure game with a compelling story and atmosphere. The puzzles are well thought out (so far) and the developers have done an excellent job avoiding outlandish combinations, a major weakness of many games in this genre.

The story, game design, art, voice acting, dialogue are all top notch and easily exceeded my expectations. And the whole is more than the sum of its parts. Surprisingly, Technobabylon kind of seems to have flown under the radar. It deserves more attention and love from discerning gamers of the unhurried variety.

Highly recommended, a 9.5/ 10 for me in this genre and style. After completing, will edit this review to revise and add to these impressions.

Update after completing Technobabylon:
-----------------------------------------------------
The game is as good, solid and well thought out as in my initial impression above. If not more. Game design is particularly good, there is coherency and no dead ends. The puzzles are excellent and satisfying- I never had to consult a guide. The writing is first class and thought provoking, with many science and technology themes explored.

On an ending note, Technobabylon gives many opportunities to interact with characters, and they should be seized to appreciate the story that much more. As before, a splendid 9.5/ 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991292044', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1490371038}
review: Technobabylon gets it right where many AAA games fail. Mystery story that will suck you in like a black hole, only to spit you back out to reality, tired but satisfied. Suprisingly relatable and believeable characters, decent puzzles that are neither too easy, but also not too hard (if you can use your brain, that is) make the story-flow smooth and enjoyable, all in lovable oldschool graphics. Despite plethora of other options - few games deliver like Technobabylon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055089474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1490332608}
review:
Absolutely amazing adventure game.

The best part of this game was easily the characters. A wide variety of characters with distinct personalities, and each with actually pretty good voice acting! To top it off, this game does something many others fail to do. This game actually had diversity in its characters. Characters ranging in age, sexuality, gender and nationality, and all of them well written. You even get to play as two characters that ARE NOT an old white guy (and hey I loved Dr Regis despite that).

The story was really gripping and interesting, the gameplay was simple but it worked better than many other adventure games, and the all the visuals were wonderful. The music wasn't too great but it wasn't annoying at anypoint.

The only real issues I had with the game was some simple bugs, that were more an issue of the AGS engine than anything else. Characters clipping through walls during animations, elevators getting stuck, that sort of thing.

The puzzles were, up until one bit in the very last section, sensible and fun. At no other point did I hate a puzzle for making no sense or give in to looking it up. 

Highly reccomend this game to anyone who likes cyberpunk or adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044395861', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1603868282}
review: Die erste Stunde wirkt durchaus vielversprechend, doch dann wird das Spiel zunehmend langatmig und die Geschichte einfach nur langweilig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127981358', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1489776362}
review:
I was skeptical to begin with but this turned out to be one of the best adventure games I've played, I would definitely recommend it. 

+The puzzles are logical and don't involve the usual inventory spamming so endemic in this type of game. The signaling is great and if you get stuck you can usually get a decent nudge in the right direction by talking to everyone. 

+The game is broken up into ten chapters and each chapter takes place in a relatively small area with a limited inventory so things never become overwhelming. 

+The voice acting and dialog are great, though they start out a little shaky (this may be to do with the fact that chapters 1-3 were made years before the rest of the game was finished). As the game progresses you'll encounter loads of memorable and well fleshed out characters oh my yes. 

+The world building is excellent and though there is quite a lot of technobabble in the dialog (it's right there in the title) it's incorporated well enough into the story and puzzle that it doesn't feel gratuitous. 

-My only major criticism is that the last chapter is LITTERED with bugs. I didn't encounter anything that prevented my progress but I stopped trusting the game at that point and when I got stuck I presumed it was because of a bug not a puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971860317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1615427071}
review:
If you're a fan of old school point-and-click adventure games, this game will not disappoint you. The writing is so good I barely have to add the phrase "for a game" to it.

The use-item logic puzzles are quite good, too. I rarely used the walkthrough to get past difficult parts. Most could be figured out by just reasoning through it. Invariably, there will be a time (or two) where you look up a problem only to find out it was an element in the environment that you didn't recognize. These moments are rare.

The story presents you with authentic moral choices which actually matter insofar as you care about what's happening because the characters are very well drawn. If you are confused about someone's motivations, then it's because the writers meant it, not due to poor design.

The game isn't long, but that's a feature, not a bug. I didn't feel like this game was wasting my time and will definitely play another by these developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028183212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1489534366}
review:
Una de las mejores aventuras gráficas a las que he jugado, con un mundo y unos personajes que me encantó ir descubriendo. Me he quedado con ganas de más, pero no porque el juego sea corto, tiene una buena duración para su género y dos finales bastante diferentes, ninguno claramente mejor que el otro.

Se trata de una historia Cyberpunk ambientada en una ciudad-estado del futuro, y vamos controlando a tres personajes: dos detectives y una joven adicta a la red. La relación que los une entre sí y a una serie de crímenes se va desvelando al avanzar la historia. El juego trata bajo una óptica de ciencia-ficción temas como la bioingeniería y sus posibles usos, tanto constructivos como destructivos, la conexión directa entre cerebros humanos, máquinas y la red, o el desarrollo de la inteligencia artificial.

Los personajes son complejos, interesantes, y a veces encantadores o incluso graciosos, a pesar de la siniestra trama en la que se ven envueltos. Además entre ellos hay representación de distintos orígenes étnicos y sexualidades, y uno de los personajes principales es, entre muchas otras cosas, una mujer trans, sin que este rasgo la defina. Estas cosas no tienen un peso especial en la trama, simplemente están ahí.

Los puzles son satisfactorios, que es de lo mejor que se puede decir, tanto por su diseño y su, por lo general, equilibrada relación dificultad/lógica, como por el entorno argumental en el que se desarrollan. Hay casos en que tienes distintas opciones para resolver un mismo problema, y a veces lo que elijas repercute en diálogos o detalles secundarios de capítulos posteriores, pero en nada demasiado importante hasta el área del final, en la que una acción decide entre los dos desenlaces.

Sé que para alguna gente será un problema la cuestión del idioma, porque es un género que usa bastante texto y solo está en inglés. Pero si eso no te molesta, y te gustan las aventuras gráficas, a mí esta me parece una pasada.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996885864', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2005, 'last_played': 1489553446}
review:
I've enjoyed other Wadget Eye games, but I was surprised by how much I liked this game--the story was intriguingly complex and involving; the world was interesting and well-realized, and the characters had strong motivations and made interesting choices.

The gameplay was mostly fine, marred a little by slow sections at times, but mostly by hunt-the-pixel puzzles.  Seriously, it's 2017; hunting for objects on a screen without a way to highlight them should be universally understood to be bad game design at this point.  Once I actually knew where I could click, the puzzles were usually fairly straightforward and reasonably satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046114529', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1577310300}
review:
Kurz: Technobabylon ist ein Sci-Fi Thriller Adventure im Pixellook.

Spielzeit:
  ca. 10-13 Stunden

Man bekommt geboten:
  * schön "detailierter" Pixelstyle
  * solide Rätsel
  * Rätsel sind selten unfair, bieten öfter auch mehrere Lösungswege
  * guter Soundtrack
  * spannende Geschichte
  * alle Dialoge mit Sprache
  * Rücksetzpunkte äußerst fair gewählt
  
Negativ fällt auf:
  * das Spiel gibt es nur in Englisch (für diejenigen die lieber in dt. spielen also nix)
  * Der Pixellook verträgt sich nicht unbedingt mit den Menü / Inventar
  * Computerdialoge wie Email oder Frachtverwaltungs-system sind sperrig
  * keine Hotspot-Anzeige
  * 1 bestimmtes Item ([spoiler]Wet-ware[/spoiler]) ist sehr, sehr wichtig und dessen Einsatz nicht unbedingt intuitiv. Am besten immer alles damit kombinieren damit man nix übersieht.

  
[b]Zum Gameplay/Story:[/b]  

Nach einer kurzen Einstiegssequenz, fängt die Geschichte, welche im Jahr 2087 spielt, relativ harmlos mit einer "Internet"abhängigen an. Jene sieht sich, wegen einem "Internet"ausfall, genötigt ihre Arbeitslosenunterkunft zu verlassen um woanders Online zu gehen. Problem ist nur das sie eingesperrt ist und sich durch das Türschloß hacken muss.

Im ersten Kapitel kriegt man schon einige schräge, aber vorstellbare Zukunftsvisionen vermittelt, ohne ein kitschiges Verschiebepuzzle als Hackingersatz vorgesetzt zu bekommen. Stattdessen muß man sich der wenigen Hilfsmittel bedienen, genau aufpassen wie man Geräte im Raum, lokale Netzwerkverbindung und elektronisches Türschloß in richtiger Reihe kombiniert, um damit in die Freiheit zu gelangen. Kurzum ich sass 40 Minuten an diesem ersten Rätsel. :)

Gleich darauf, Szenenwechsel Kapitel 2. Man schlüpft hier in die Rolle eines Polizisten, der mit seiner Partnerin ein noch nicht stattgefundenes Verbrechen verhindern soll. Der Zentralrechner der Stadt orderte ihren Einsatz und wie es so kommt, ein Vorfall findet statt welches gleich den Spieler die Ermittlungen starten lässt. Dieser Part ist eine sehr schöne Anlehnung an Geschichten wie Minority Report oder Blade Runner und bringt zugleich sehr schön geschriebene und überzeugende Dialoge zw. den Polizisten.

Internetjunkie und Polizeiermittlung. Am Anfang scheinen die 2 Szenen total unabhängig, doch sind damit erstmal die drei Hauptcharaktäre eingeführt. Die leicht verschachtelte Erzählweise bringt Kapitel für Kapitel mehr Verständnis für die Vorgänge in der Zukunftsmetropole. 

Themen wie Gentechnik, Sozialstaat, Internet of Things, Verschmelzung von Mensch und Technik, und vieles mehr ist zu finden. Dabei werden die Themen oft wie selbstverständlich behandelt und nur äußerst selten dem Spieler direkt vor Augen gehalten. Das ist sehr angenehm, da die eigentliche Geschichte ein Thriller ist der sich um die Ermittlungen in einer Mordserie dreht. Man bekommt nie das Gefühl das der Autor versucht irgendwelche Sci-Fi Visionen vorzustellen oder zu bewerben.
Wer sich ein wenig im Setting Cyberpunk / Sci-Fi / Technikentwicklungen auskennt bekommt bekannte Kost appetitlich serviert und wird von der eigentlichen Geschichte nur wenig abgelenkt.

Insgesammt bietet das Spiel 10 Kapitel in denen so einige unvermittelte Storywendungen auftauchen, welche einen schönen welterschütternden Höhepunkt und Finale liefert. Man bekommt sogar ein alternatives Ende sodass rechtzeitiges Abspeichern oder erneutes Durchspielen - mit Entwicklerkommentaren(!) - sehr zu empfehlen ist. 
Anders als bei vielen anderen Spielen, welche eins ihrer alternativen Ende bevorzugen, sind Technobabylons Enden beide gut geschrieben und jeweils befriedigende, wenn auch leicht beklemmende Abschlüsse der Story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315283130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1488172889}
review:
非常好的冒险点击类游戏。2067年，一群精英科学家组成了一个团队，目的是开发出一个前所未有的强大AI。其不同之处在于这个AI使用了生物工程技术，有类似神经系统的结构，而这一技术得以研发，依靠了当时团队里的查理和维克莎夫妇提供的自己的试管胚胎。不过一次严重的事故，却让这个团队的成员损失了一半....20年后的2087年，被成功研发的名叫“中央”的AI正井井有条的管理着纽顿市，纽顿市新一代的市民通过基因工程改造，可以随时进入虚拟空间trance（类似于现在的互联网），与其他人交互，与“中央”衔接，获取讯息，‘中央’也可以反过来获取市民的讯息，做好规划。
    这时的查理已经是一名警探，有“中央”的指导解决案件已经不需要人类动脑思考。因为拒绝接入‘中央’，查理身边被安排了一名年轻的劳警官，也因此被笑话是老古董，可是没有人知道查理在20年前参与了‘中央’的研发。平静的纽顿市最近接连发生谋杀案件，凶手的目标是攫取受害者脑内存储的信息，直觉告诉查理有人想对‘中央’做文章。然而查理并不知道的是，当年他和维克莎的试管胚胎，有一个被孕育产下。这个和‘中央’有着相同基因表型的女孩，查理并不知晓的女儿，会成为解决这次事件的关键吗？
    游戏的剧情不错，谜题难度适中。但是如果英语不好的话，对剧情的理解，谜题的难度都会大大提升。

author: {'steamid': '76561198132872056', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 1955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1563175909}
review:
In addition to making an intelligent commentary on the intersections between technology and humanity, Technobabylon is a true feast for the point-and-click enthusiast. It is brought to life by an irresistible cast of characters, presents players with a series of rich, ethical dilemmas, and dips into the sci-fi palette with just the right amount of twists and turns. Whether its vision of the future is an accurate one remains to be seen, but time will tell, and Central will be watching. If you are partial to old-school mystery adventure titles, this is a must-play.

PROS

+ Wonderfully immersive narrative
+ Retro-style point-and-click gameplay
+ Superb voice-actingCharged atmosphere
+ Broaches controversial topics

CONS

+ Some puzzles are too difficult to solve

Full review here: https://web.archive.org/web/20170705033454/http://indiegamemag.com:80/technobabylon-review-visions-of-the-future-through-an-ancient-lens/

author: {'steamid': '76561198120267191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1486735265}
review:
Cuando compré Technobabylon de alguna manera esperaba o que fuera una historia acerca de un hacker / cyberactivista al estilo Shadowrun o una historia futurista policial al estilo Bladerunner, y he de decir que tiene un poco de ambas. 

El juego cuenta con una excelente ambientación cyberpunk, me parece que se lo han currado bastante bien en el departamente de gráfico, audio y voces. El juego cuenta con puzzles que no son a mi parecer sin sentido o que son de hacer click a lo loco por toda la pantalla hasta que sucede algo, aunque al ser un pixel art si es cierto que hay algunas partes donde tienes que fijarte bien para ver el objeto con el que necesitas interactuar.

La historia está muy bien, tiene personajes que te enganchan para saber su relación y su pasado, y los giros de la historia te mantienen entretenido y queriendo saber como acaba.


*** SPOILER DEL FINAL***
Al final de la historia me ha recordado un poco a Deus Ex, hay varias maneras de conseguir tu objetivo y de alguna manera los finales felices no siempre son tales, y aunque creas que hayas "ganado" siempre hay otras tramas y poderes superiores a ti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214392393', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1493224256}
review:
"Technobabylon" is the third game from Wadjet Eye Games that I've played for my channel, and so far, I haven't been disappointed by any of them.  The game features three main protagonists, though you can only control one of two (at least that's been the case so far, I haven't finished the game yet) whose stories intertwine very interestingly.  I can't wait to see how the rest of the game plays out!

I've linked episode 1 of my Let's Play of the game, but there is a free demo which also starts at the beginning of the game.

https://youtu.be/07BKKOJXJ0Q

author: {'steamid': '76561198139007144', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 396, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1486413320}
review:
Eines der größten Ziele, die ein Videospiel haben kann ist, dass man am Ende des Spiels mit offenem Mund den Abspann genießt. Technobabylon hat dieses Ziel durchaus erreicht.

Die Dialoge sind wunderbar geschrieben und die Welt ist sehr atmosphärisch (Der Pixel-Look stört überhaupt nicht).

Man muss sich jedoch im Klaren sein, dass man gute Englisch Kenntnisse haben sollte.

Hiermit zählt dieses Spiel zu einem der coolsten und (gegen Ende) bewegendsten Spielen, die ich je gespielt (oder sollte ich besser schreiben „erlebt“?) habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062623579', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1477793216}
review:
Incredibly underrated gem. One of the best (possibly the best actually) point-and-click I've ever played.
Story starts out kinda confusing but it doesn't take too long to start getting good. 88% of the voice acting is really great (Only a couple actors I thought were a bit sub-par) And the pixel art, oh my goodness the artwork in this game is incredible. One of the best looking cyberpunk worlds I've ever seen, absolutely loved it. Also the soundtrack is just *perfect* for setting the mood in any scene/area of the game, it compliments it flawlessly.
I'd very well say this may be one of my favorite games of all time. It really is THAT good.
Definitely the kinda game that should be played at a slower pace though, take your time to talk to everyone, read everything, and just get invested/immersed in it. Cause if ya do it makes the whole thing a whole lot more enjoyable (And the story a lot more understandable)
Also I almost forgot to mention how great *most* of the puzzles are (only 2 or 3 I thought had some weird solutions) But the amount of items you can interact with in an area is usually limited to only things you NEED to interact with, so that helps a lot with solving puzzles, but also almost every puzzle actually makes sense, which isn't something that can be said for a LOT of point-and-click games.

Overall, this game's great go buy it. :P
5/5 - Flawed, but everything else is just so dang good I don't even mind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043431991', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1486206351}
review:
One more masterpiece from Wadjet Eye Games ? Yes.

Wadjet Eye Games is most likely the best Point&Click AGs studio in activity ; They have understood what makes the core of great adventure games.

Technobabylon's atmosphere and mysterious story echoes Beneath A Steel Sky and Primordia, yet it manages to be unique and incredibly immersive...

Get in the Trance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994506042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1485486768}
review:
Now, right off the bat; credit where credit is due: there is a lot of work that was put into this. This was clearly someone's passion project. Either that or someone's first stab at making something so cohesive and interesting. It was a valiant effort on the creator's part. And I want to stress my appreciation for the talent and effort put into this. Even if I can't really sink my teeth into it personally. From the art to the lore to the voice talent, you can tell that people really labored over this; that much is evident. However, there are some parts missing here. There are some ingredients missing from the soup,

Technobabylon is a story about a futuristic world that couldn't care less. Cloned babies, overbearing artificial intelligence, zero privacy, escapism, nuclear war, and the ever present looming threat of scarcity masked as abundance. Everything is here and accounted for. What I can give Technobabylon credit for is how it presents its setting. It doesn't bother to bombard you. It gives you clues about this world you're experiencing. And aside from a set of very specific situations, it isn't required that you care at all about this setting. The characters themselves clearly don't. That's a little more believable in my opinion. If we all lived in the dystopia, I'd doubt that anyone would care after so long. That's natural for these characters, and this is shown in game. Kudos.

Now, I'm going to have to take those kudos right back, because for these steps forward, Technobabylon makes some very curious design choices. I know it's the future in all, but this game has a bizarre fixation on fitting in some heavyweight rhetoric in the wrong places. What do I mean? Well, early in the game we learn that one of the major characters underwent a sex change. Wowee. And this is just mentioned in passing. Never comes up. Never adds much to the character other than a moment of, "uhh.. ok?" If anything this soured my vision of one of the characters right off the bat. Why would I care about a character's gender? Or past gender? Especially if this point was treated with none of the tact and meaning that a subject like this usually requires.

Later in the game we're introduced to a homosexual couple who have a synthetic housemaid who's strongly implied to be assisting them in the bedroom. Did I say strongly implied? I mean outright stated. Now, that's fantastic and all, but this is just dropped and left to sit there. The most we know about them is they like Paris. That's about it... Again, no investment. No meaning whatsoever. Strike two. The last straw came late in the game when I witnessed the fastest devolution of what could've been mildly entertaining dialogue into what was essentially akin to "mind your pronouns." Apparently the distinction between gynoid and android is very important? Also, points for me reacting almost exactly like the villain did.

Contrast this with the only straight relationship in the game: Regis and his wife. This relationship isn't impactful because its straight, its impactful because it plays a significant role in these character's motivations. It plays into the plot a lot more. It actually contributes. In fact, this point would've remained entirely unchanged if it were a homosexual relationship anyway. I feel like the game tried to make it a point to include these things but ended up making them completely insubstantial as a result.

As far as the rest of the game goes, I can say everything blends together more or less. It does the setting well, like I said, but failure to utilize this and make something meaningful just leads to more disappointment. The characters are serviceable. So is the plot. It really comes down to how predictable you like your point and click games. I could guess the big twist about two hours before I actually completed the game. And while I'm throwing stones, the last area and the ending are so horribly contrived that it ruins anything the game was trying to set up. Some special thread of voodoo magic is tying these character's fates together. It's up to Regis Philbin and two other people to save the world I guess.

For what it's worth, this is an alright experience. I wouldn't recommend it for a few reasons. The later half of the game suffers from lack of direction, and it all trails into the worst parts of the game. Puzzles fall into two categories: immediately obvious and impossible. Out of the entire cast, Regis was the only one I was vaguely interested in. The entire rest of the cast was more or less forgettable or boring. And the big top off is the ending. For the asking price, this is an alright game to put some hours into. But honestly, I just don't regard it as exceptional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022387235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1478511536}
review:
I love point & click games and I love cyberpunk. Those are two excellent reasons to love this game. But I have more to say about it.

Point & click + cyberpunk is a rather common combination, these days. For example, see Read Only Memories, Void & Meddler, Gemini Rue... All these games are good, but Technobabylon is definitely the best I've ever played.

All characters are very interesting, full of surprises.

The scenario is clever, unexpected, easily believable, easily understandable, and full of interesting moral dilemmas.

There are two great endings. It's very hard to say which one is the best.

Musics and graphics are both beautiful. Voice actors are great.

As in most cyberpunk games, there is a queer side, but it is not too invasive, unlike in many others (see Read Only Memories and Void & Meddler, for example, that can be annoying here). This aspect of the game is balanced correctly.

When you'll finish this game, your first thought will be: "when do they create a second episode? I want more!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198086774158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1485187608}
review:
Wadjet Eye Games發行的遊戲優點不外乎: 雋永的劇情、retro畫風、風趣的人設和配音
這邊不細談這些老調

我想特別推薦的原因是
Technobabylon不只是說了一個好故事而已
他為整個故事設計了一個充滿層次的背景
對未來世界的想像有許多特別的巧思，又不過份hardcore
而特別吸引我的地方是一些細節的刻劃

稍微舉幾個例子

例如
裡面的媒體集團叫作Chishiki，毫無疑問這是知識的日文發音
身為此世界最大的媒體巨獸，當然幹盡了引導與過濾輿論的勾當
於是就有了另外一個和他們對抗的地下駭客組織叫Jahiliyya
這個詞在阿拉伯文中表示蒙昧無知的意思
因為控制輿論的自稱「知識」，追求自由的就自稱「無知」以為反諷

再例如
這個時代基因科技非常發達，各種疾病都已經絕種
然後就出現了一群反社會的「疾病主義」年輕人
他們在腦部網路安裝各種疾病軟體讓自己出現各種病徵
理念是「這個社會無法剝奪我生病的自由」或是「疾病形塑社會文化就像黑死病形塑歐洲」之類的
有膽安裝痲瘋病或帕金森症的人還會瞧不起只敢安裝感冒的小孬孬
2087年的中二果然特別87

author: {'steamid': '76561198013247070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1654695702}
