author: {'steamid': '76561198033370450', 'num_games_owned': 1998, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1481290504}
review:
Si buscas una aventura gráfica cuya historia te enganche, que te traiga un ambiente cyberpunk - blade runner muy cuidado y depurado, que te haga revivir la nostalgia de las aventuras clásicas ... Technobabylon sin duda es una gran opción. Desde el primer momento te das cuenta que estás ante un producto que respeta esa filosofía y te incita a tratar de ir resolviendo sus puzzles.
Interfaz muy depurada, simplista rayando lo minimalista pero para qué más, huye de los tópicos fáciles como las colecciones de elementos, los interminables menús con opciones y más opciones... mirar, usar, combinar. Y ya está, no necesitas más... aunque no por ello es un juego sencillo, sus puzzles te atascarán más de una vez pero su dificultad está bastante bien balanceada para no desesperarte, al menos en lo que llevo jugado.
El gran CONTRA que tiene el juego, es que al menos en su edición inicial sólo está en inglés. Seguramente con un par de búsquedas en google se localice un parche para su traducción
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=803802425

author: {'steamid': '76561198050326171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1479595486}
review:
Technobabylon est un jeu indé point and click futuriste avec des graphismes en pixel-art qui raconte l'histoire de différents personnages qui vont être amenés à se croiser et qui vont devoir coopérer afin de sauver la ville de Newton dans les années 2080.

On pourrait résumer ainsi ce qu'est Technobabylon mais on passerait alors à côté de cette perle vidéoludique méconnue d'une grande majorité de gamers ! Je dois avouer que j'ai été bluffé par ce jeu indépendant qui est tout bonnement magnifique ! :D

Tout d'abord, l'histoire du jeu est très soignée et le background des personnages permet une immersion en tout points dans l'univers de Technobabylon ! Vous incarnez successivement Latha, une enfant des rues devenue accro à la réalité virtuelle que l'on peut qualifier de "Thrall" c'est-à-dire qui passe toute sa vie connectée (elle ne se déconnecte que pour s'alimenter ou lorsque le réseau, le "Trance" est en panne), le Dr Regis qui est un agent du CEL (une police criminelle de pointe si vous préférez) ainsi que Max Lao, hackeuse de génie / ancienne criminelle repentie, désormais elle est la partenaire du Dr Régis.

Il faut noter que le jeu est en anglais, il faut donc maîtriser la langue de Shakespeare si vous désirez vivre pleinement l'expérience humaine et philosophique que vous propose Technobabylon ! ;-)

Les graphismes ainsi que la direction artistique sont très soignées et nous font vite oublier que nous avons affaire à du pixel-art, les dialogues favorisent également le sentiment d'immersion que j'évoquais tout à l'heure avec un scénario riche en rebondissements !

Point très important : le gameplay ; celui-ci est très fourni et suffisamment varié pour que l'on ne s'ennuie pas !
Vous pourrez ainsi mener une investigation sur une scène de crime toute fraîche qui s'enchaîne avec une course poursuite parsemée d'obstacles qui sont autant de puzzles à résoudre ! Vous pourrez aussi participer à une sorte de cluedo grandeur nature bref je n'en dis pas plus par peur de vous spoiler ! :-)
Cependant, je dois reconnaître que parfois certains passages sont plus ardus que d'autres et nécessitent soit un sens de l'observation très développé soit l'utilisation d'un guide pour se débloquer d'un petit casse-tête où l'on reste plusieurs minutes bloqué alors qu'une simple succession de quelques actions suffit à avancer dans le chapitre !
Encore une fois, je ne trouve pas que c'est un problème puisque les puzzles restent très cohérents et logiques contrairement à d'autres jeux point and click et qu'un excellent guide existe à ce sujet qui vous permettra d'avancer sans craintes de vous faire spoiler ! :D

Enfin, le rapport qualité prix est excellent étant donné que le jeu est souvent en soldes et qu'il possède cartes à échanger et succès steam !

Je le recommande donc vivement à tous !
Technobabylon propose une expérience riche et unique qui fait réfléchir et c'est suffisamment rare pour le souligner ici !

author: {'steamid': '76561197961102962', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1479588072}
review: since i'm into cyberpunk i really wanted to like this game, but i couldn't. you're thrown into the story without much explanation, you jump between characters also without any explanation. to really understand story i would need to play through the game and read everything once more, but i didn't have patience. puzzles were hard for me (probably thousands and thousands of hours of mindlessly shooting in online games have taken toll on my intelligence), so i ended up using guide most of the time. however, atmoshpere is really nice cyberpunkish, as well as soundtrack, and every single line of text is voice acted. it took me 9 hours to finish the game, the rest was farming achievements, which are not hard to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994652859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1480159118}
review: Brilliant game, a true piece of art! This is one of the best point & click adventures I've ever played. The story is wonderfully dystopian and creative, and I enjoyed my playthrough a lot more than reading the cyberpunk classic "Neuromancer". I also love the artwork and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110439385', 'num_games_owned': 1400, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1479508015}
review:
Wadjeteye nuevamente me sorprende con una aventura grafica excelente, graficos pixel-art perfectos, excelente jugabilidad y muchos puzzles para resolver ya sea en la vida real o la online.

Sinopsis: Sos 3 personajes, sos Charlie Regis y tenes que atrapar a un MindJacker (robador de memorias), y revelar una conspiracion. Sos Max Lao, compañera de Charlie y experta en hackeo, tenes que ayudar a Charlie a atrapar al MindJacker. Sos Latha Mandala, y aparentemente solo serías una adicta al "Trance" (estar online a lo Matrix) pero como dije, solo aparantemente. El desarrollo llevara a que los 3 personajes se crucen de maneras inesperadas.

Robo de Mentes, Asesinatos, Terrorismo y mucho más :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198328321017', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1479090216}
review: Great pnc, good storyline, trance was a great feature. Will be purchasing other titles from these guys for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109708285', 'num_games_owned': 1860, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1478843728}
review:
My two Technobabylons:
I really like this software house, I really do. I like the art style and the stories they create. The game itself is interesting, with some witty jokes and good old gore in some scenes. The puzzles are not very difficult, but not so obvious either. Let's say that they are not just there to slow down your play. 
There are technically two endings, but one is much better than the other. Unfortunately, it is also the least common to choose. You need to remember to save often during the last act to be sure to catch both of them. 
What else? The real prize! I think this game could go for any price between $1 and $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972722903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1479418716}
review: If you enjoyed Gemini Rue, Primordia and love old point-and-click adventures, this is certainly the game for you. MAke sure not to miss this little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019950673', 'num_games_owned': 1588, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1479415559}
review: A very good futuristic sci-fi. Story is great, character and scenario art good and voice quality that WadjetEye already got us used to it. Puzzles are not difficult. Story is linear with two endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098363961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1479406644}

author: {'steamid': '76561198193383845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1479320272}
review: Great story, one of the best cyberpunk art I've ever seen, immersive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990448462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1479357750}
review:
Cyberpunk went on the decline when it became a series of tropes and not a speculative framework. Too much of it became dressed-up from the 1980s, when the internet itself was beyond the awareness or comprehension of most people.

Technobabylon doesn't do that. It *gets* cyberpunk and develops it with an understanding of existing technology, developments on the cusp of existence, and the way states and capital shape how that technology affects our lives. Rather than trying to spin virtual reality as some barely imagined new concept like William Gibson never existed, Technobabylon looks at biotech, AI development, and automation to flesh out a world that feels incredibly plausible and compelling.

Puzzle systems are never insanely "out there," but there are fun applications of some mechanics. The AI Splitter that lets you dismantle and rebuild AI minds with different pieces of each other really stands out as one of the more fun ones. And a few obnoxious pixel-hunts notwithstanding, puzzles in Technobabylon feel largely fair and coherent.

On the whole this is one of the best titles Wadjet Eye has published to date. Absoltely worth a go for cyberpunk fans and adventure gamers alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072936040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1515361364}
review:
Que jogo incrível!

Eu cresci jogando jogos em flash do tipo Point and Click e escape e pude ver os jogos ficando cada vez mais complexos e com histórias mais e mais profundas. Technobabylon te leva a um cenário cyberpunk incrível e possível. Esse é aquele jogo que você vai se conectar emocionalmente com os personagens, passar a pensar, sentir e tomar decisões como eles tomariam. A arte do jogo é linda e impressionante, com gráficos pixelizados, porém com retratos incrivelmente detalhados e carismáticos. Mas de tudo, o que mais me cativou foram as dublagens. O trabalho de dublagem do jogo é uma obra-prima e as vozes e atuações dos dubladores não sairão da minha cabeça tão cedo.
Comprei o jogo em uma promoção, porém se soubesse que era tão bom, não pensaria duas vezes em pagar o preço completo (27,99 no momento dessa review)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040660008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1479093759}
review: It's a great game that has a compeling story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972607142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1479070680}
review: A solid classic adventure game set in an interesting future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025846509', 'num_games_owned': 1419, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1479064014}
review:
It's well made game with quite intresting plot. I was sucked into its world, just like when I played Primordia or Gemini Rue, but I think those two had more intresting settings and slightly better written stories. However, I would recommend this game to any fan of point&click games, especially those published by Wadjet Eye.

Main pros:
- Good voice acting
- Quite intresting story with well-developed threads that make sense
- Well thought out and engaging puzzles (some with multiple solutions)
- Fun with case solving

Main cons:
- Clumsy introduction
- One pixel hunt moment
- Annoying one of the main characters (and not only annoying in entire game)
- Choices I made during the game were not important at the end

author: {'steamid': '76561197960713906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1479036488}
review: Nicely done! Everything is great: story, setting, voice acting, music and puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971524889', 'num_games_owned': 2425, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1442082373}
review: One of the best adventure games I played. A must have for cyberpunk fans. Don't be fooled by low res graphics, this game is top notch in most regards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176529887', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1478977805}
review: I really don't want to spoil anything for anyone, so I will just say that thought he ending of the story is a little dissapointing and predictable, the progression is very nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995475309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1480970031}
review: After playing and enjoying my first adventure game series(Blackwell) from the same publisher I bought Technobabylon. It had great characters, a twisting story arc and an really interesting sci-fi setting. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198043777940', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1478959956}
review: Good story

author: {'steamid': '76561198037157002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1478952677}
review:
Technobabylon is awesome! Great cyberpunk vibe, good artstyle and character portaits (walking around can be a bit gross though), and it's best trait, in my opinion, it's faithful to the genre. It reminds of the point-and-click adventures of the 90s that really define the genre.

I got this game in a Humble Bundle, but I would gladly pay full price.

If you're into point-and-click games, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125266784', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1478917665}
review: For anyone who loves these sort of point-and-click RPGs, this will certainly be a very enjoyable experience. Although the price tag is high, the quality of the game comes up to meet it. This [i]quality[/i] is shown throughout the game as amazing artwork, voice acting, and musical pieces. These aspects work only to improve the delightfully dark storyline which is explained throughout your time playing this. I reccommend that people play Technobabylon and hope that they appreciate the developer's work as much as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960499853', 'num_games_owned': 1512, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1478908591}
review:
Una sencilla aventura gráfica de corte futurista cyberpunk distópica.

Está dividida en capítulos pequeños autocontenidos, de forma que el nº de objetos disponibles para completar los puzzles suele ser bastante limitado, y las pantallas a recorrer no suelen ascender a más de 3 o 4.

La historia es correcta, no siempre manejamos al mismo personaje por lo que se cuenta a trozos, inconexos al principio y se van atando cabos. Hay algún giro de guión que otro, aunque se ven venir.

Hay algunas partes que requieren de pixel hunting, en general me he quedado atascado más veces por faltarme un objeto o elemento de interacción que por no saber qué hacer (lo cual no quita que también haya habido de las otras). La dificultad es un poco inconsistente entre capítulos, habiendo algunos muy sencillos y otros más complejos.

En resumen, una aventura gráfica correcta en todos los sentidos, sin mucho más que destacar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010133097', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1581778843}
review:
Entertaining point and click adventure game. Nice atmosphere, some great ideas for future technologies and cultural/societal problems/progressions

It has good dialogues, though sometimes a bit misleading as there is no real freedom of choice in the game. In the end it always leads to 2 different endings, where 1 of those is slightly variable with the choice of 1 characters being alive or dead, just a minor variable. 

The puzzle part of the game was good, but not all too good, sometimes very unintuitive and obviously "scripted". Of course that is my personal opinion, if you view it from a game design perspective, then they are what they have to be, I guess. Still pretty funny at times. 

The best part of the game were the the voice-overs and all the great quirky details The character design is pretty good as well. So, all in all I'd recommend this game for "the view", not so much for the "game part" of it, it is still worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006204901', 'num_games_owned': 1828, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1478454851}
review:
Ein wirklich hervorragend umgesetztes Click & Point Adventure im Pixel-Stil. Die Geschichte hat bis zum Schluss keinen Hänger, bleibt immer spannend und die Rätsel sind logisch aufgebaut und bis auf ein paar Ausnahmen nachvollziehbar.

Für mich persönlich ein Highlight und das beste Spiel seiner Art seit Langem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988175292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1479826122}
review:
Technobabylon is one of the most thought provoking games in videogame history.

Intelligent, possible and well thought out story. Complex and diverse characters with great character development. Every character that you talk to has depth. Amazing music and atmosphere. It feels like everything is thought of, even up until the credits. 
The puzzles can sometimes be challenging, but I managed to get through it with enough persistence.

I'm a little bit sad now that it's over.. It's been one hell of a ride! ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198033812163', 'num_games_owned': 1994, 'num_reviews': 405, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1478807212}
review:
Finished this point and click in 14 and half hours, no use of walkthoughs or other help as I refuse to use them. Pretty good story this one and quite enjoyable. For a pnc genre game this was very long.
Well worth the price paid from keysite £3.

My Score 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037177555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1478670627}
review: Good game for the most part although there were some sections where it was unclear of what you had to do. As such I did find myself looking at a guide when I got stumped. I would recommend this game as all around it is a good adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287569152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1475494018}
review:
I don't see why there are so many bad reviews lately. I loved this game! It had a great story, kept me up til all hours of the night wanting to progress further and further and had stunning artwork!

10/10 Guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056980805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1437317296}
review: I played this game a while ago and I still think about it. The setting, the atmosphere and the world was just well thought out and well orchestrated. I wish there were more in this universe or atleast a similar game out there somewhere. Just great, if you love point and clicks and love good stories this is one to not miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998206702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1478642271}
review:
Technobabylon is a traditional point and click set in a sci-fi setting. It plays like a detective story where you are trying to find out clues as to what exactly is going on and you discover the plot of the story piece by piece.

The puzzles are not too hard and most can be figured out by some trial and error. However as with every point and click there might be one that gets you, luckily there seem to be quite a few walkthroughs available on the internet for when you get stuck. 

A big plus for this particular point and click is that almost all the text is voiceacted and there are a bunch of bonus voice acted lines you would not even expect. So props to the developer for that.

I personally enjoyed the story quite a bit and would recommend this game as one of the better point and clicks ive played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035451762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1478797188}
review:
Technobabylon is a throw back to the classic point and click adventure games of the mid 1990s. If you were a fan of the classics like the original Monkey Island or Sam & Max then this game will be for you. In blocky 16 bit graphics the cyberpunk world comes to life with a great story, interesting characters and cool scenes.

The game wisely keeps you locked in 'chapter' areas meaning you dont need to scratch your head picking up a random object in one scene only to use it 10 scenes later, all objects are useable pretty much in the same area you find them.

Dialogue is tight and well written, voice narration is solid and story in general is interesting and engaging.

However, one MAJOR gripe I have with this game, and it REALLY bothered me on too many occasions was how unclear interactable objects were!! The times I got stuck and had to google how to move forward ALWAYS resulted in me having just missed a chest of drawers or a cupboard and had nothing to do with actually getting stuck on a puzzle. It ended up with me on each new scene running the mouse up and down the screen ensuring I had 'scanned' everywhere in fear of missing an interactable object. Some sort of 'highlighting' system is sorely missed.

All in all a solid point & click adventure set in a cool cyper punk world.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970628797', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1478551909}
review:
This adventure is really cool. There are all the elements of a science fiction lover. I only found a few bugs, but do not intercede with the adventure.
The puzzle levels are medium to high. Sometimes you get stuck in a crap. But it is a good story to live with this adventure. Go ahead laugh.

Good music in different environments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025848743', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1478545934}
review:
Sehr gutes Adventure. Durchgespielt in 13,5 Stunden mit gelegentlicher Lösungshilfe.

+ So mit die beste Story, die ich in einem Adventure je gespielt habe.
+ Einteilung in Kapitel mit überschaubaren Rätseln und Gegenständen. Linearer Lösungsweg.
+ Rätsel dadurch fair.
+ Stimmungsvolle 8-Bit Retrografik schafft Bladerunner-Atmosphäre.

- Dialoge insgesamt zu lang.
- Zum Schluss etwas verwirrend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045815451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1478528053}
review:
I picked this game up on Humble Bundle with some others because it looks interesting and I enjoy deduction style games.
But I was very surprised that this game was worth MORE than every penny I paid. I was worried that this game might actually be selling itself too short! So I checked the store page and saw $15. Trust me, this game is WORTH $15. I am about 7 chapters into the game and I love it. 

Buy this game if you enjoy the following:

-Sci-fi action drama stories
-Deductive shows/games/movies
-Wonderfully well done 16bit style art.
-A challenge

This game will have you stuck sometimes for a while which I found surprising. A lot of point and click puzzle games are very straight forward or use some cheap tactics to try and throw you off. This game is very genuine. You have to think and I found myself having to take breaks instead of binging on a game because I found myself stuck on a chapter that I just couldn't piece together. 

This game does not hide interactable items and objects from you. You won't find yourself saying "wow really, they hid this super important thing here where no one can see it?". This game gives you everything you need right infront of you. All you have to do is figure out what to do. It's less of a Where's Waldo type of point and click and more of a real deductive mystery.

There will be times where you get frustrated and can't figure things out because the puzzles are tough, but like Dark Souls, when you figure it out the feeling of satisfaction is absolutely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047989019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1478467330}
review: Very very good game. Puzzles are simple and the story is deep, great gem on the store.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976485785', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1480312626}
review:
I don't even like this type of game, but I find myself wanting to come back and play this time and again. Playing through 1 or 2 rooms per day is a good pace and it stays interesting. This is honestly the first adventure game of the type that grabbed me. Recommended.

[Updated for Steam Achievement] Yep, this is still fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967657888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1478488901}
review:
Good, if farily predictable story. Solid character work and at times excellent music, make up a largely enjoyble adventure. 
I just wish Wadjet would move away from Adventure Game Studio. For all the effort the developers put into their art, it ultimately still looks poor when compared to a twnety year old game like Broken Sword.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038406070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1478483452}
review:
Terrible game,
not linear at all, some interactions doesn't make any sense.

Nice plot, but i needed a guide to finish it in some reasonable time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964391982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1478476921}
review: Amazing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034829669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1615859354}
review:
With the high amount of positive reviews, I wanted to point out some of the flaws of this game that made it hard for me to truly enjoy it. It is not bad, and the pixelated graphics give nice retro feel to the whole experience, while telling a futuristic cyberpunk story. Some of the characters were nice to follow. Some puzzles could be solved in a few ways, unlocking different achievements. Overall I kept playing this game, which is enough of a reason to say it can be enjoyable.

There always will be a 'but' at some point that changes the whole statement, right?

Well, as I said, some characters are interesting to follow. However, the story switches between three main ones, with short flashbacks where we follow side ones. The voiceover on some of them is bad, and one of the main characters sounds so awfully unnatural I was at some point considering quitting the otherwise interesting plot.

The switching between MCs points of view is probably intended to show variety of classic cyberpunk landscapes. Expensive apartments, rundown basements, abandoned factories, sprinkly-clean laboratories, neon skyscrapers etc etc., all the while mentioning stuff that cyberpunk is most known for. Global corporations, cloning, gen. engineering, all-powerful AI, androids, cyborgs, virtual reality, loss of identity, background brutal warfare etc. Nothing of that sounds particularly new. There are some new, sometimes amusing ideas, but they are wasted with overwhelming majority of the usual.

The animation. oh boy. Pixelated graphics have their appeal, which i personally enjoy, yet they are so badly animated for some characters, you'd think this game is not really retro, but 20 years old. Maybe that's the idea. I wouldn't mind, but while all character's close-up portraits are nice, as are most sceneries and animations, some fail horribly. Two of the MCs look like they were made with MS Paint. Graphics range from eye-catching to blocky gibberish pixelgore.


Okay, I am proud of you if you managed to read it up to this point. So I'll just make my opinion short: don't buy this game for full price, it's not worth if you're into indie retro ones. But if your friend shares it to you, or you buy it in a bundle, play it, it's actually enjoyable, even if a bit too plain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024214328', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1478468727}
review: La scena indie ha provato a rinverdire il genere delle avventure grafiche per anni, ma i giochi che possano davvero dirsi riusciti sono pochini: Technobabylon è uno dei migliori che io abbia giocato in questo decennio. Gli enigmi sono sensati e di difficoltà ragionevole. La sceneggiatura prevede una narrazione non lineare che riesce a tenere alto l'interesse fino alla fine. L'ambientazione cyberpunk è gestita bene, molta roba già vista e scippata di qua e di là ma con un'attenzione particolare alle questioni etico-morali (questo futuro è oggettivamente l'incubo di Adinolfi). La grafica anni 90 funziona benissimo così come le animazioni. Due finali entrambi ben scritti. Che altro volete? L'ho pagato un misero dollaro grazie all'humble bundle e mi sembra davvero di avere commesso un furto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051897031', 'num_games_owned': 957, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1478350934}
review: Really good adventure game. The cyber future set up with wetware and bio computers is pretty sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038946698', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1478443251}
review:
Nie spodziewałem się, że pixelartowy indyk może w tym roku stanąć na podium razem z Wiedźminem, ale tak się stało. Patrząc na listę ukończonych przez mnie gier, muszę powiedzieć, że obok Dzikiego Gonu jest to najlepsza gra w jaką grałem w 2016 i udało się jej pobić kilka tytułów klasy AAA.

Złożyło się na to kilka czynników. Jest to gra ze zdecydowanie najlepszym scenariuszem (tak, lepszym niż Wiedźmin), który jest wprost fenomenalny. Writing dorównuje najlepszym powieściom sci-fi, a setting to esencja cyberpunku z zakręconymi, szokującymi, ale i w całkiem realnymi pomysłami - jeśli ekstrapolujemy obecny stan nauki i wyobrazimy sobie co mogłoby być za ponad dwieście lat. Nie chcę niczego spoilować, najlepiej samemu zagrać. Świat przedstawiony jest spójny i interesujący, przez całą grę dowiadujemy się czegoś nowego i poznajemy kolejne smaczki. Miłym dodatkiem są newsy, które zmieniają się podczas gry.

Zagadki są logiczne, nie ma łączenia małpy z batyskafem, wszystko ma sens i działa tak jak się tego spodziewamy. Zaciąłem się trzy razy na chwilę, ale nigdy na tyle, żeby sięgnąć po solucję. Gameplayowo jest to również jedna z lepszych przygodówek w jakie grałem. Zdecydowanie najwyższa półka. Co ciekawe, gra posiada po kilka rozwiązań do niektórych zagadek, przez co zawiera pewną dozę nieliniowości - rzecz raczej niespotykana w przygodówkach point & click.

Na uwagę zasługuje świetne udźwiękowienie - zarówno muzyka jak i odgłosy - ale przede wszystkim - rewelacyjny voice acting, w niczym nie ustępujący największym produkcjom, a niektóre wręcz przebijający o kilka długości. W całej grze nie ma ani jednego niepasującego głosu, czy aktora czytającego z kartki. Takich bajerów się nie spodziewałem po grze stworzonej w Adventure Game Studio.

Grafika, mimo wszechobecnej pikselozy i niskiej rozdzielczości, jest ładna.

Gromkie brawa dla panów z Technocrat i Wadjet Eye Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992521548', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1478436468}
review: Recieved this in what could have been as low as a $1 tier on Humble Bundle, but I feel like thats a criminal price for something this good. One of the best futuristic/cyberpunk settings seen in game and very thought provoking and mature looks into our possible future. If you're interested in topics especially as AI and what role it plays with humans in future society (that we're already moving towards now) as well as things like food fabrication, basic income. cloning and genetic engineering then it's a no brainer to pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018476373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1478426638}
review: I found this to be an enjoyable story/world with nice puzzles and interesting characters. That said, I grabbed this in a bundle and utilised a good walkthrough, so at full price sans guide I probably wouldn't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025529387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1478352025}
review:
This game tries to do way more than it's capable of and ends up a bit of a mess. There are too many characters and the plot is too complicated for its length, the unique game mechanics are under-utilised, and I often found myself with no clear idea of what to do. Also, it's pretty buggy. At several points I resorted to a walkthrough only to be told to do exactly what I was already doing, and my only option being to just try it again and again until the game decided to work.

I like what they were going for, but not what they've actually achieved.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998566599', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1478142664}
review:
I picked this up on the Humble Gems Bundle, and it indeed a hidden gem that I am glad to have picked up.

I haven't played a point-and-click adventure game in quite a while, but this was a good foray back into that territory.  The setting and writing was very enjoyable, the art excellent, and the music immersive.  But the main point of this kind of adventure is exploring the story, which requires a good story to be a good game.  Technobabylon doesn't disappoint me here.

As someone interested in the virtual, metaverses, etc, I was on board immediately with the concept that the Trance provided, and other sci-fi concepts (such as gengineering) had enough grounding in modern science to give a bit of a "This could be the future" edge.  But it's not all dark, gritty, and brooding.  There is a LOT of dialog to explore, and there were quite a few moments I laughed out loud, mostly due to AI personalities (Turret + Cheffie = absolutely hilarious)

The puzzles were largely simple for me to figure out, and the only places I got stuck and had to look online for help were when I was missing something entirely -- it's not so bad you could call it pixel-hunting, but you still need to be thorough if you find yourself getting stuck.  Death is handled in a forgiving manner, simply rewinding back to a state just before you died if you did something foolish.

I ended up playing through this twice -- the second time with commentary and to pick up 100% achievements -- and I bought a copy for my sister and recommended it to a friend.  I'd recommend it for anyone who enjoys point-and-click adventure types, cyberpunk settings, and have a taste for automeals served by an AI so cheerful it should be criminal.

Overall play time for both runs was ~20 hours for me. Given my second run was much faster, I'd say you're probably looking at a 10 to 15 hour experience. That may not seem like much, but it was a very enjoyable time, and I've put more hours into games and got less out of them in the past, so I'd say it was worth it.

Also, I want that "nom nom nom" sound, and I don't know why.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030590300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1478201354}
review:
[b] What a drag of a game to get through a great story. [/b]

I got this game from the Humble Gem Bundle and was intrigued by the Cyberpunk setting.

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
[list]
    [*] Great story
    [*] Interesting characters
    [*] Certain sense of humour
[/list]

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
[list]
    [*] Annoying mouse acceleration in fullscreen mode that can't be disabled
    [*] the character models looked weird and blurred no matter which settings I tried
    [*] The puzzles are a horror to get through. I ended up going through the last three chapters completely by a walkthrough, only being motivated by the desire to see the story end.
[/list]

The setting and story are fantastic, but wow, what a mess to get through it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992459465', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1477875227}
review: I got this game as part of the Humble Gem Bundle and I have to say it's a gem indeed. A classic point and click adventure of the old days with an interesting cyberpunk story to it. If it would have been released twenty years ago it would be counted amongst Monkey Island, Indiana Jones and other classics today. The game is (in contrast to the older titles) fully voice acted. The art is acceptable although a bit too pixel heavy for my taste. Took me about 11 hours to finish the game. You can squeeze probably more out it, if you go for all achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033317759', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1477852040}
review:
I feel like my previous review didn't do this masterpiece any justice so Im gonna write a new one.

My all time favorite genre is Cyberpunk, and there aren't that many Cyberpunk games out there. I have played most of them and some of them stuck in my mind, others disappeared quickly. Technobabylon is one of those games who have stuck in my mind.
The setting of the game is perfect, a dystopian large city controlled by some big force, and lots of high tech (hence the perfect quote "High Tech, Low Life"). The characters are very likeable and interesting, and the story is great as well. If you have played Gemini Rue, which is also sort of Cyberpunk, I can say that this game delivers on a much larger scale.

It took me around 9 hours to finish the game, and I took my time interacting with everything and getting stuck on difficult puzzles. I had to use walkthroughs for some of the puzzles, but it's nothing too extreme. The soundtrack is in my opinion of the best aspects of the game, pin-pointing the dystopian setting.

I give this game a 10/10, since I liked every aspect of it, and because it totally nails my vision of a perfect Cyberpunk future

author: {'steamid': '76561198127985314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1477788368}
review:
I have been wating for a game like this for a long time.

For those of us who grew up playing the great point-and-clicks from years ago, Technobabylon is an incredible tribute to those old games.

Compelling story, beautiful music and artwork, excellent voice-acting, just enough challenge to make it fun, and overall just an incredible game.

I enjoyed every moment of playing it, and all I can say is this game is worth far more than they are charging. Easily a $30 game in my books.

For those of you who have played and loved old 90's point-and-clicks, I promise that you will not be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17517, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1477763307}
review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Technobabylon
[b]Developer:[/b]  Technocrat Games
[b]Publisher:[/b]  Wadjet Eye Games
[b]Genre:[/b]  2D adventure

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
While I’m no self proclaimed fan of pixel graphics in modern video games, there was something that drew me towards Technobablylon. Perhaps it was the fusion between cyberpunk and neo-noir genres and the similarities I could observe between this game and one of my favorite movies of all time, Blade Runner. Technobabylon has an intriguing plot of its own, which I won’t spoil but I can assure it that it is quite original and this time, you’re actually getting your money’s worth. There were a few instances which required that you return to a previously “swept” area and use the newly acquired itmes in your inventory. I’m not a fan of backtracking in general but at least there weren’t many such situations. The point & click interface runs smoothly but it took some tinkering with the game’s graphical settings before I was satisfied with the result and the dialogue font is a bit pixeated for my taste but it wasn’t that much of a strain. On the other hand, the  soundtrack truly stands out and the many commentaries (on each scene and on some interactions) from the developer and publisher, reveled just how important this project has been to them. I respect that. All in all, you’re in for a decently lengthy adventure, should you choose to give Technobabylon a try. It really has few flaws and I hope we may see a sequel to it one day.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Excellent storyline.
+ Beautiful art style and tech-noir setting.
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements.
+ In-game commentaries from the dev team.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Some puzzles involve backtracking to a previous scene.

[b]Rating 8/10[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews]Imperial Reviews[/url] and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Cubbes]Cubbes[/url].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993381156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1467087849}
review:
Хороший, олдскульный поинт-энд-клик квест. Дух киберпанка передан  блестяще, но к сожалению ближе к развязке сюжет начинает плыть: если вы знакомы «Нейромантом» Гибсона, то во второй половине игры вас начинает преследовать чувство, что вы  это уже где-то видели. В итоге, вместо заимствований у Гибсона, игра начинает  бесстыдно копировать целые куски и сюжетные повороты из книги, что не является преступлением, но на оригинальность не тянет. 

При этом, игра умудряется сохранить индивидуальность во многом благодаря атмосфере и персонажам. Герои получились сложными и интересными. Один из них на протяжении большей части игры не вызывал у меня ничего кроме отвращения и раздражения, пока я не понял, что наркоман в ломке и не может быть обаятельным и интересным. Другой оказался... не совсем тем, чем казался (ох, без спойлеров не просто) и это привело... к интересной динамике в отношениях между главными героями. 

Графика, как это и свойственно проектам от Wadjet Eye выполнена крупным пикселем и выглядит здорово, хотя текст читается с трудом. С художественной точки зрения дизайн выдержан бесподобно- высокие, холодные небоскребы, яркие неоновые вывески, вечная ночь, все на месте. 

Загадки тоже принадлежат к старой школе и не отличаются логичностью и простотой. В этом, пожалуй, заключается одна из главных проблем игры: головоломки не работают на сюжет и не продвигают историю, а скорее служат препятствием, лишь преодолев которое, удаётся вернуться к повествованию. 

В целом, Техновавилон- отличная игра, красивый и умный киберпанковский квест с интересными персонажами и увлекательной, хотя и немного шаблонной историей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021868179', 'num_games_owned': 1721, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1477705344}
review:
tl;dr Ein tolles Point & Click Adventure mit packender Story in einem Cyberpunksetting. Es gibt ein paar kleinere Mängel, die aber den Spielspaß nicht trüben.

Con:
- Keine Hotspotanzeige
- Technisch etwas zickig, Steamoverlay und Alt+Tab machen gern mal Probleme
- Keine deutschen Texte

Pro:
- Mir gefallen die Sprecher
- Story interessant von Anfang bis Ende mit mindestens zwei möglichen Enden
- An manchen Stellen alternative Lösungswege
- Interessante Rätsel, die aber nicht allzu schwierig sind

Fazit:
Ich hatte sieben schöne Stunden mit dem Spiel. Da ich zu Ungeduld neige, klicke ich die Dialoge ganz gern mal durch, weil ich schneller lese, als die Charaktere reden. Wenn man das komplett auf sich wirken lässt, wird das Spiel nochmal ein Weilchen länger dauern.
Außerdem muss ich dazu sagen, dass ich ab und zu mal in einen Walkthrough geguckt habe, weil ich aufm Schlauch stehe und ich dann oft nicht das Bedürfnis habe wahllos Dinge zu kombinieren und ohne die Hotspotanzeige alles pixelweise abzusuchen. Das hat meinem Spaß aber keinen Abbruch getan.
Nach der Blackwellreihe ein weiteres Point & Click, das ich sehr gerne gespielt habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098613335', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1477710761}
review: The game is really amazing. But unfortunately I'm unable to play it. The solutions to pretty much every problem in this game are just insanely out there. Me being the average moron I'm unable to complete a single stage without a guide. The same thing happened to me with The Legend of Zelda: A Link to The Past. The game's great, but if you're looking to actually enjoy yourself it's really hard when you need a guide to play it. I'd be very impressed if someone managed to compelete this entire game without a guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034583125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1477663828}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023671892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1477617500}
review:
I'm not much for point and clicks-- I only got this off a humble bundle. But I stuck through to the end and finished it it  two sessions. It turns out I really liked it.

The main pros: 
• The story is great. An immense amount of thought went into background details about the universe. I feel like I know things about the place that these characters live.
• The voice acting is well done.
• The characters are likeable, but flawed. They're human-like.
• Most of the puzzles are intuitive and well-considered. They often offer multiple approaches.
• The sci-fi science is believable-- and chilling.

The main cons:
• The game often tries to put the characters in urgent situations that would demand immediate action, then asks you to solve a multi-room puzzle that involves backtracking across the map. Pacing is entierly thrown out the window.
• The art style of the characters is dramatically different from the enviornments. And a lot rougher. The result is a disconnect between the actors and the scene.
• A fair few of the puzzles rely on obscure 'find the hidden object' solutions. Not all of them-- but more than enough to distinctly annoy you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057168110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1477474706}
review:
First thoughts after an hour of play:

It's really fun. I'm really bad at point and clicks but even I had fun with the puzzle even though I had to look up a walkthrough for one part. But the thing that strikes me most is the humour and how it uses the most of this cyberpunk setting with overly emotional robots that seem human at one point but in a second make you remember that they are controlled by a company. Well really everything is owned by a country, and that's why right now it feels so dystopian. And I hope it keeps with this ambience and setting; because while these types of game has been done millions of time before, this feels different as it has real details in the world - details that you notice and recognise. Updates and full review down the track.

Bought with the Humble Gems Bundle

author: {'steamid': '76561198042406453', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 752, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1476022367}
review:
[quote]For more puzzle game reviews, news and everything puzzle-related, follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25928931-Puzzle-Lovers/]Puzzle Lovers[/url] and check out our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/puzzlelovers]Steam group[/url].[/quote]

I had a few smaller issues, like unskippable logos, steam popups blocking the tooltips, the fact that you can die which is completely unnecessary in a game like this and only wastes time (at least you don't lose any progress), but these aren't anything major and the game ended up being one of my favorite adventures in recent years.

great story and characters, good voice acting, I loved the trance and hacking and all the different personalities you can play around with (I don't mean the multiple playable characters, though that was nice too). if you're into sci-fi and point & click adventures, this should be a blast. there's also a demo if you're unsure, though it's not on steam for some reason, look for it on the publisher's (wadjet eye) website.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967241706', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1435764312}
review:
What a cyberpunk gem. 

Technobabylon is gorgeous, each scene packed with detail and ambiance, not to mention a beautiful soundtrack. 

If you're a fan of Blade Runner or Neuromamcer, do yourself a favor and buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008537074', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1475431504}
review:
Exelent story, characters and setting that drew me in almost right away and didn't let go.

I feel this game can stand with the greats of the genre.
It is has well designed puzzles that are well balanced; giving you access to just the right amount of items and areas at a time, so it's not as overwhelming and frustrating as other games can be.
Only on vary rare occasions did I feel completely lost (mostly caused by some world elemts being to hard to spot) but I felt it offered a good level of challenge throughout.

And big points also go to the voice acting and music they help you get in the right state of mind and really immerse you in the setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992215086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1604086474}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026989091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1472680090}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999743900', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1527200938}
review:
Enjoy point and click games? Love sci-fi? You should get Technobabylon then. A solid story, good characters, excellent voice acting and a well imagined future world to play in. Some nice little touches too, as well as a few bits that made me laugh.

If you're still reading this, you should've added it to your wishlist by now. Go on, it's worth it.

Am looking forward to playing through a second time and doing things a bit differently.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987542287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1433090952}
review: Such a cool point and click.  I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042721313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1472083954}
review:
Another great adventure game from Wadjet Eye Games. If you like Gemini Rue and Primordia you will like this one. The only complaint I have about the game is that the beginning can be frustrating because they just throw you into the game without any knowledge on how some of your items work. This almost turned me off from the game and I was about to uninstall, but after looking up how to get past the first area the game starts flowing and the story gets better. This game did feel more dialogue heavy than their other games, so be prepared to sit through a lot of dialogue in this one.

Pros:
-Great voice acting
-Interesting sci-fi story
-Good music
-Puzzle difficulty seems balanced

Cons:
- The fact that I had to look up how to get past the first area is an indicator of poor design. You should be easing players into your world and it's mechanics.
- Text boxes in Wadjet games immediately vanish after pop-up after you shift-tab into the Steam overlay. They should really fix this issue as it affects every single Wadjet game that I've played and it's super annoying. Please make sure your future games work well with Steam overlay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052236689', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1472317969}
review: A cool oldschool adventure, where oldschool doesn't mean obsolete but rather classical mechanics that are played out well. The setting is really interesting of a may-be future, and in contrast to many interesting scify settings that then screw up the ending, this game does it really well. All in all, thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068844254', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1472301741}
review:
Pese al aspecto cutre y tosco de gráficos pixelados, un juego excelentemente escrito, con diferentes opciones para resolver puzzles, personajes bien construídos, buen doblaje, muy buena ambientación y sobre todo algo difícil de conseguir en juegos de este tipo: la sensación de inmersión y la coherencia del mundo en que transcurre la historia.

 Una historia de investigación e intriga ambientada en un futuro donde una IA controla toda la vigilancia, mantenimiento y seguridad de una ciudad independiente al estilo ciudad-estado. Con pocos recursos y buenos textos descriptivos, Technobabylon hace posible imaginar a la perfección cómo funciona el día a día y cómo es la realidad del mundo, tanbto en la ciudad de Newton como fuera. Un cruce de influencias entre Ghost in the Shell y Neuromante, encajado en una investigación criminal.

 El juego trae comentarios de los desarrolladores de forma opcional, finales alternativos y un producto muy bien acabado de buena duración y buen ritmo. Un juego de los que ponen a los creadores (Technocrate) en el punto de mira de cara a lo siguiente que saquen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068968803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1441024848}
review:
There is a load of things to enjoy about this little point'n'click gem of an adventure game.
Great retro graphics, musical score and sounds, cyberpunkish feel throughout as well as interesing (and some completely mad) characters and an excellent story. It isn't an easy one either.
Once I started I could not finish playing. I got sucked into this huge dark world and I miss it now. I miss the Trance...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971041931', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1468538656}
review:
I would recommend this game due to its fantastic story, however, there at times when characters either don't know something that has been revealed to them in prior dialog OR they suddenly know something that has yet to come up. This bugged me a lot.


I did not like some of the puzzles either, as they were less about brainstorming and more about randomly using certain items on things until you got it. I also hate pixel hunting which game got in a few places where I got stuck and had to look up how to get past.

I also found the acting a bit jarring at times but it seems to be all over the place. For this, it has some charm that I like.

Like I said, the story is fantastic and I would much rather have read a book about the story than dealing with some of the pixel hunting and "try all the items until it works." puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022793090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1468517925}
review:
It's a good game, but I don't recommend it. How's that possible? Let me explain.

I don't much care for puzzles in point and click games – some people call them illogical, some absurd, some charmingly crazy. For me they're fun, although, in this particular case, I had to peek into a walkthrough a couple of times because I've missed some almost-pixel-size items. The point is – gameplay contains everything you would expect from this genre. And it's OK.

My reservation concern the most important element of the game – the story. There are no good characters in „Technobabylon”. By good I mean morally good, not well written. There is a struggle at the top of the food chain between overly controlling cyberpunky-antiutopian AI and a bunch of plutocrats/oligarchs. We see debauchery, hypocrisy, hubris and greed all around. Even our protagonists aren't really characters to root for. One of them is an internet junkie (or, to be precise, trance junkie, futuristic VR version of the internet), who's addicted to information stream, bright colour-flickering images bombarding senses, for whom real world is too slow and too demanding; other one being an ex-bioengineer who used to make suicide bombers, a pro-eugenics scientist, shady (at best) in bioethics field, now a good ol' grumpy cop.

I was getting further and further into the story, yet getting more and more impatient that there is no person in the game's world who I wanted to succeed. And then it hit me. It's exactly how it supposed to be. After all the title of the game is „TechnoBABYLON” – it's supposed to be a moral depravity feast. But the plot missed something, something crucial for this type of story. It missed it's „idiot”, it's good guy, it's Shatov (Comparing „Technobabylon” to Dostoyevsky is unfair, but his works, in this case especially „Demons”, are a good example of stories exploring demoralized circles).

I understand that the creators' vision is a depressing one. But do I need to spend a few hours watching multitude of ways in which humans can be bad? I know they can be evil, I'm one of them. The game shows a world filled with decadence, but I may as well look out the window. And may even be surprised what I'll found. Even if you think that goodness can't prevail or is naive – show it. Create a character like Simon from „Lord of the Flies” and show him fail. You can argue that our main heroes are trying to do some good, but actually they're just trying to get out of trouble they got in during the course of the plot (still, Regis is getting „redemption arc” at the very end).

If you just want to relax after a day of hard work, you'll be satisfied. Characters are likeable, pacing is all right and pixel-arty environments are quite pretty. My problem is, that beyond that the game touches an interesting topic –  bioethics – but doesn't have anything clever to say about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071598284', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1468328652}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970989321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1470040290}
review:
Point and click très réussi !
Les énigmes ne sont ni trop faciles ni trop dures (d'ailleurs on peut en résoudre certaines de plusieurs manières), l'ambiance cyberpunk est excellente, les questions soulevées sont pertinentes, et les personnages sont bien travaillés. D'ailleurs j'aime beaucoup le fait qu'on bascule entre plusieurs personnages. ça donne une histoire riche vue sous plusieurs angles.

Bref: j'ai adoré !

author: {'steamid': '76561198035273467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1462579612}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051741198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1467823262}
review:
Главное впечатление от игры — очень детально проработанный мир будущего, который представляется вполне реалистичным: биокомпьютеры, генная инженерия, печать еды на аналогах 3d-принтеров, растения с защитой от копирования днк, новый аналог интернета, взаимодействующий напрямую с мозгом, и много всего другого. Ощущение, как от хорошей научной фантастики.

По геймплею это традиционный квест. Загадки гораздо чаще логичны, чем нет. Интересные персонажи. Много диалогов. Пиксельная графика нарисована с любовью. Озвучка и музыка очень хороши. Обязательно знание английского.
 
Рекомендую всем ценителям квестов и любителям научной фантастики, которых не отпугнула графика. На маке без проблем запускается через wineskin (в настройках нужно выбрать вывод через directdraw).

author: {'steamid': '76561197984658225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1464632549}
review:
Wadjet Eye Games, was soll ich noch sagen? 
Ein Publisher der seine Nische gefunden hat und sie dermaßen gut füllt, 
das ich wie ein kleines Kind auf das nächste Spiel warte und im Dreieck springe wenn ein neues Spiel angekündigt wird.

Zum Spiel.
Man spielt 2 Polizisten und eine Süchtige in einer hochtenologischen Welt, in der Genmaipulation zum Standard gehört. Als neue Droge gibt es Trance, eine virtuelle Welt in der man jemand ist.
Die Stadt wird von einer KI überwacht die alles und jeden kontrolliert. Zuviel verraten wäre blöd, aber es geht um Mord und Verschwörungen.

Rätsel:
Wirklich ein angenehmer Schwierigkeitsgrad, hat mir gut gefallen. es gab teilweise mehre Wege zum Ziel. Wobei die Rätsel nie unfair waren. Wie bei jedem Adventure einfach rumprobieren.

Grafik:
Wadjet Eye Stil, kein Unterschied zu anderen Spiele des Publishers. Wobei mir das Zukunftsszenario wirklich gut gefällt.
Ähnlich wie Gemini Rue oder Blade Runner.

Sound:
Sehr gute Sprachausgabe und gute Sound- sowie Musikeffekte. Man erkennt mitlerweile die üblichen Sprecher die Wadjet Eye einsetzt, z.B. Abe Goldfarb. Leider hat das Spiel keine deutsche Sprachausgabe oder Untertitel. Der Hintergrund ist einfach der Markt für Adventures, die Kosten einer Synchronisation sowie der Kosten/Nutzen-Faktor. 

Spieldauer:
Eine normale Dauer meiner Meinung nach, nicht zu kurz. Ich habe ca. 11 Stunden gebraucht.

Weiterhin gibt es Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057386857', 'num_games_owned': 4168, 'num_reviews': 820, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1562090963}
review:
Хорошая игра. Не такая «дождливая», как Gemini Rue, но зато способная похвастаться приятными и последовательными «нацелься и кликни» головоломками.

Technobabylon умело погружает игрока в утопичную вселенную будущего и не даёт вырваться, постоянно дразня динамично развивающимся сюжетом и подбрасывая по кусочкам информацию о биотехнологическом мире 2087 года.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043141500', 'num_games_owned': 4720, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1466199727}
review:
Traditional pointn'click still has its charm, when it comes with a well-developed story and  interesting, well-integrated puzzles. Wadjet Eye's releases have proven that point time and again. Luckily, Technobabylon is no exception. It is not the first dystopia in the publisher's books (that would be Gemini Rue, and later they have released the post-apocalyptic Primordia), but it might very well be their best one.
The technosceptical story builds a world that at its best moments is at par with William Gibson's Neuromancer and treads similar grounds concerning AIs, digital life, life in the digital and autoritarian societies. And yet, all this heady social critique does not become moralizing grouchiness. The multi-plot narration - done with very competent voice-acting for all dialogue- keeps players engaged with interesting, deep characters and some nicely staged twists (though admittedly some are not as twisty as the writers obviously thought them to be).
The puzzles are exceptionally well done, notwithstanding one or two lesser specimen. No spoilers here, but should you get stuck in a kitchen, you'll know what I mean. But all of them are fitting with the characters and the plot; there is nothing haphazardly glued into the game to bolster playtime, no lazy logic puzzles, not much walking around and no backtracking. Top notch design!
I only played it a year after release, but I have to say that all the laurels Technobabylon gathered in 2015 were well-earned. Definitively one of the best adventure games 2015/16!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000422381', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1458982782}
review:
Wadjet Eye publishes yet another great point-and-click adventure game!

This part of this game that sets it apart from others is a VERY well realized semi-near futuristic setting, similar to Ghost in the Shell in its focus on the internet (and opting to go the route of nanomachines rather than cybernetics).  A lot of its dystopian themes seem very plausibly real and dont stray too much into the realm of science fantasy to break my suspension of disbelief.  Add on top of that some very well acted characters (Charlie and Max specifically) and villains, a heavy plot that balances itself very well without overdoing it, and you have a great game.  

There is also a nuanced influence of dialogue choices that impact the game's responses and dialogue without going the route of being an aparrent and forced good-neutral-bad ending choice factor, while still feeling relevant to the story.  I liked it.  If there's anything I disliked, its that Latha's character felt too one dimensional and tangential to the rest of the story, and that her specific sections involving using the web were lacking a robust realization like the rest of the setting.  I forgive them though, since most all other stories in the near-future scifi genre haven't come up with a really robust way to depict a brain-to-machine immersive version of the internet.

Puzzles and mechanics-wise, the game is solid.  As always there is 'that one puzzle' that necessitates a guide, but that is always true of the genre and is not something I look down upon.  There are failstates, but only in a few specific points of the game.  Be warned, some of the scenes in the game can be particularly gruesome and unpleasant to watch (namely the flashback scene with [spoiler]the maidservant gynoid violently disembowling its hallucinating owner after he kills his spouse[/spoiler]), but they are treated with severity and not present to glorify the gruesomeness of the act.

Altogether the game runs about 10 hours if my playtime on steam is accurate.  I enjoyed this game a lot, I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010016565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1465763127}
