author: {'steamid': '76561198040222113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1417, 'last_played': 1465739446}
review: Best point and click game I've played since The Secret of Monkey Island. Awesome writing, all lines are voice acted. Most of the puzzles can actually be solved by thinkig, i.e. no trick puzzles / whatever (though some of them are a bit far-fetched, but luckily do not reach Monkey Island level absurdity.) Didn't particularly care for the soundtrack though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021087888', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1518478293}
review:
Being something of an old-time adventure game veteran and and old-fart literary buff I'm conflicted about what to say on  Technobablyon. I've also often found that people are easily impressed by mediocre fare in just about anything, so me saying something is "passable" could mean it's the best thing you've ever seen in your life. That really depends on what you're used to more than anything. Having said that:

The episodic format shows.The game kind-sort-of felt as if it wasn't made as a cohesive whole, and that individual "episodes"  were too "tight" to really let you soak in the atmosphere. Which is a shame, as there was plenty of atmosphere, and the individual epizodes were rather good overall.

However, it did feet like it was going out of it's way to put the player in one "room escape" scenario after another. The overall plot was a bit too grand which made various things feel a bit too drastic. It seems to have elements in place, so to speak, for large multi-plot games like, say, Discworld: Noir, but it turns out to not really be that kind of game. I guess the plot feels strangely linear, because the game has the old style grapics groove going on, but lacks a central semi-non-linear "open world" item chase chapter that's a staple of the old non-episodic classics. Making one of those is a nightmare, and it would've made the game twice as long, but the game felt like it needed more time to develop it's various characters, and more space to disperse it's dialogue, world-building and commentary in. For a game which makes dialogue so fun and easy to perform and enjoy, it doesn't really do enough with the dialogue because secondary characters are either villains or only there for one scene.

For example, I feel the "comm" feature was an incredible idea, one that's probably been kicking around many point-and-click and detective game enthusiasts heads. Except it's hardly ever used in the most obvious way it would be used in most games - to cut the time it takes to walk around various locations when you just want to talk to a character. I can think of dozens of games which  that feature would've made much better than they were (many of them are classics). In this game it's usability is severely limited because the game lacks that central faux open-world part. Big props to to the person who went and put that into their game, finally, as it might influence someone else to put it in a game that makes more use out of it. Heck, you could take all the shooty / RPG bits out of Fallout 2, rewrite it as a straight point-and-click / dialogue thing, add that feature to the radio so that you can contact folks over distance, and you'd be rolling in money.

Which is to say there's some really good stuff here. The android related puzzles were impossibly cool, the actual "investigation" episode was also very cool, there's great stuff all over the place. But there are also a few too many instances of characters being able to perform certain actions without the actions making sense at the time. I think I just stumbled onto the solutions to many puzzles, and at times I was stuck because I didn't realize certain actions could even be performed, so I would be lacking a step in an otherwise logical sequence of moves. This might mean that a few things had a step-or-two too many, and for this, I blame the episodic format again - if actions required to accomplish something didn't have to all involve so discreet scenations the flow would be much better.

I've heard complaints about the graphics from folks who can't appreciate symbolic art over "realism". I've mixed feelings about it. I'm not necessarily in love with the pixels, as I found the recent remasterings of Lucas Arts stuff quite fine, and I did at times feel like this game could've benefited from a bit more resolution. I'm not sure it would have benefitted from more "realism" which that would end up creating - the gory bits, and there ARE gory bits, would've stood out more, and the naive bits, and there ARE naive bits, would have stood out more, too. Since pacing makes certain plot related things a bit jarring, more detailed graphics wouldn't have necessarily helped there. Plus, quite a bunch of the art is gorgeous as is.

Now, most of this soounds like criticism, but when you get down to it, I've not really played a more ambitious point-and-clicker that actually delivered as much as Technobabylon did in quite a while. It did more for me on the cyberpunk front than the Shadowrun games, too. I feel like the folks who made it deserve their money, and that the game isn't really dissapointing as much as it stimulates the player afterwards to think about how they would have done it better. Which is a great thing.

I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072812047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1464602822}
review:
Wadjet Eye levererar ännu en gång ett välproducerat, ambitiöst och snyggt äventyrsspel i dystopisk sci-fi-miljö där du guidar tre olika karaktärer genom ett konspiratoriskt mysterium i futuristiskt samhälle där bioteknik och cyberspace integrerats in i vardagen och självmedvetna AI:s är verklighet. 

Bra grafik, klassisk point-n-click kontroll, intressanta karaktärer och en handling som lånar lagom mycket från både andra äventyrsspelsklassiker såsom Benath a Steel Sky och sci-fi-filmer såsom Blade Runner och eXistenZ. I likhet med många andra nya spel i genren kändes det möjligen lite kort, men som helhet är Technobabylon en synnerligen underhållande combo av klassiska sci-fi-idéer med gedigen äventyrsspelsinramning.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995346624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1464995799}
review:
At the end of the credits is written "Thank you for playing", my answer is :

"My pleasure ! Thank you for making this great old school point & click full of love for the genre and anticipation science fiction."

author: {'steamid': '76561197981576634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1464697817}
review: An excellent game. The solitions to the puzzles require a bit more emersion than is allowed by this style of game, however hints are usually not far off. Very much a game where you really have to read between the lines if you want help, although some are outright unfair (found myself looking at the walkthrough and uttering outloud "What the hell!"). I was more of a Normaility fan when point and clicks came to my door 1st of all, but this has to be one of the best adventure games I've ever played, very much sticking to the "3 is a crowd" style of storytelling. Plenty of game design tropes rolling around in this one, but defines itself away from any other type of game like a finely composed score... old, new and beutiful, all at the same time. Many minds made this game, many styles approched it, they found a way to compromise and create a consistant gaming narrative, by giving everything a space in its own world that is delibratly jenky and seemless at the same time. Good show, also loved Shardlight that lead me to this game! Please make more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028043106', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1464969828}
review:
Just like any other game, published by Wadjet Eye (look up Blackwell series, Gemini Rue, Primordia and Resonance), this one does not disappoint. This time the plot is set in a cyberpunk future, and although the atmosphere is great, the downside is that you are likely to have difficulties learning how certain concepts work. Especially in the beginning. However the puzzles are quite good and entertaining, the voice acting is great and the plot twists will appear whenever you are not expecting them. 

A solid recommendation for those who appreciate a good point-and-click adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987462019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1464677559}
review:
Point-and-Click perfection.

On second thought; the puzzle solving is a little too linear and the game has too many side-objectives to get past simple obstacles. However, the story, atmosphere and immersive lore compensates makes up for this. If you have point-and-click cyberpunk nostalgia, you'll love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971153258', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1464157839}
review:
I really like this game. Even if its not very long, but more medium-length, its a very nice game and pretty easy to grasp what to do once you finish the first apartment.

The game is a longer variant of the "point of click" games that exist on the internet, but with a very nice science-fiction setting.

HOWEVER. This jumping back and forth in the storyline timeline, makes me confused and its pretty impossible to piece together the storyline. For example the [spoiler]subway bomb event and the apartment bombing[/spoiler] could have been placed before the [spoiler]apartment event in the very beginning[/spoiler]

So, if you like storytelling, this game is pretty confusing, but for enjoyment and a good puzzle game, this game is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975160202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1463934731}
review:
A great cyberpunk point and click with the right amount of difficulty and flow. Nice to have multiple approaches to some puzzles.
Would wipe memory and play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964099717', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1472036518}
review: This is the first adventure game I've EVER liked. And yes, I've been playing games since C64s, including all the legendary classics, eg. Monkey Islands, Sierra titles, Lucasart titles etc. Way too random for my taste. But Technobabylon - awesome job. At least starts super strong!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116098408', 'num_games_owned': 3520, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1460574901}
review:
[h1][i]如果你是解谜游戏爱好者，又喜欢像素风，且对科幻类型感兴趣，那么这款游戏绝对合你胃口。[/i][/h1]
[i]其实[url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?publisher=Wadjet%20Eye%20Games]Wadjet Eye Games[/url]的游戏都特别合我胃口:P[/i]

由于当初通关是急着写指南，测评方面就隔着，今天突然想起来才特地补上，我就简单摘要点写写吧。

[h1]优：[/h1]
+ 宏大的科幻世界观
+ 语言十分有特色，比如wetware、trance等，还有女主常说的"doom it"
+ 剧情悬念设置到位
+ 谜题难度大体适中，而且可以有不同的解法
+ 许多剧情都有可选分支，但实际上不会对结局造成太大变动
+ 对话全程语音
+ 游戏对话或场景时不时地加入中文要素使华人玩家觉得会有亲切感

[h1]劣：[/h1]
- 没有中文，部分谜题要求英文水平过硬才能解开
- 启动游戏时，有时候鼠标会悬停在画面中间，无法移动，只能关掉重开
- 在游戏进行中，切回桌面再回到游戏，Esc键会无限抽风，此时剧情对话会狂跳，要随便按个英文键才能解决这问题

总的来说，作为一款科幻解谜冒险游戏，Technobabylon在游戏性及解谜上并没有太大的瑕疵，而在剧情上，我觉得还有待提高，悬念的设置不如Gemini Rue给我带来的震撼要大。
只可惜因为语言问题，可能大部分中国玩家都与[url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?publisher=Wadjet%20Eye%20Games]Wadjet Eye Games[/url]的解谜游戏无缘。

另外这个厂的节操很硬，这游戏去年上架，但史低折扣也就五折，其他游戏入包都比较久远，不过有几个游戏上个月倒是进过豆团的慈善包。等夏促对这游戏感兴趣的可以尝试一下（有个Demo也可以试玩一下）。

其他科幻解谜游戏：
http://store.steampowered.com/app/80310/?snr=1_7_7_230_150_1
http://store.steampowered.com/app/227000/?snr=1_7_7_230_150_1

author: {'steamid': '76561197968508978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1463510009}
review: I really enjoyed this game. The story and way it played out was interesting and kept my attension. Personally I thought the ending was a bit sudden, it really needed some music too. Dont just look at the graphics, there is a great game here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 649, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1463313917}
review:
Perfektní point&click adventura ze staré školy nabízející jeden z nejlepších cyberpunkových příběhů, jaké se ve hrách kdy objevily. Inspirace starou klasikou Beneath A Steel Sky je zcela očividná. Herně jde o skvěle vyváženou hru. ve které i velmi komplexní akce dávají smysl. Hra navíc dodává různé indicie v rámci nepovinných dialogů a při prozkoumávání prostředí, což skvěle sedí do detektivní atmosféry. Nutno pochválit také velmi slušnou hrací dobu, v mém případě to bylo přes 13 hodin.
Drobné výtky mám jen dvě. Jedna je technická: Po přepnutí na Steam overlay a zpět se začnou špatně zobrazovat textová okna; jen na zlomek sekundy probliknou a zase zmizí. Hru je pak nutné restartovat. Druhou stížnost mám na minihru Gravball. Vůbec nesedí do stylu hry a je ukrutně těžká. Při normálním průchodu jde snadno vyhrát tím, že hlavní postava bude podvádět, ale pro získání achievementu musíte minihru vyhrát fér. A to obnáší desítky minut frustrujících pokusů, kde víc než cokoliv hraje roli náhoda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090955648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1444178123}
review:
Best music.Best puzzle.Best point and click.
Sci-fi.Mature themes.Life and death decisions....

WHY HAVEN'T YOU BOUGHT THIS GAME ALREADY!?

author: {'steamid': '76561197970352902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1463006870}
review: This is by far the best Wadjet Eye adventure game yet and even one of the best non-humourous point & click adventures ever made, almost on par with the likes of The Longest Journey when it comes to the setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048977350', 'num_games_owned': 2307, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1462722102}
review:
A call-back to old school adventure games, delivering excellent writing and a well executed take on a seemingly cliched premise. The plot isn't [i]completely[/i] original - once you look at it closer, you'll notice strong inspirations from Beneath A Steel Sky and Neuromancer, including a few of the puzzles - but it holds its own without feeling derivative. 

I did have a few gripes with the game: in particular, some of the lines recorded for Max sounded very differently from the rest and the pixel-art style is less than perfect on a few occasions - seeing "half pixel" lines was kind of jarring, and there's a loose plot thread - unfortunately, one rather relevant to the plot (we never really find out why [spoiler]both clones[/spoiler] were created). The game includes an autosave on the start of each chapter, which turned out quite handy in when I ended up in what's probably the only dead-end situation in the game (no way to progress without interacting with an item you can't backtrack to [spoiler]when you climb outside the airship[/spoiler]).

The limited amount of objects you can interact with in the game's locations has both upsides and downsides - in the 90's adventure games, they often provided a lot of colorful, sometimes humorous, exposition on the game's plot and setting, but from a design perspective, less items for the player to work with means less red herrings (there are a few, such as [spoiler]the toilet cleaner[/spoiler])

In a nice touch, not all of Technobabylon's puzzles are linear: in several chapters there's more than one solution, and the game rewards you with achievements for discovering each. While they do not alter the course of the game's plot (apart from one in the final chapter), later chapters sometimes contain callbacks to the choices you made earlier.

Over all, the game is not [i]perfect[/i] but thoroughly enjoyable regardless - if you buy it, you won't regret that decision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249237304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1462641104}
review:
It seems as if, nowadays, adventure games straddle one of two extremes. They are either interactive works of fiction that don’t offer much in the way of traditional challenge, or they are traditionally difficult point-and-click games with traditionally broken logic. Games that combine a rich story and world building without feeling like a DVR simulator are somewhat rare. Being one of those rare titles is what makes Technocrat Games’s Technobabylon a remarkable experience. First began life as a freeware title, Technobabylon benefits from better production values (evident in the voice acting), revamped and stylistic pixel visuals, and a well assembled adventure experience thanks to the involvement of Wadjet Eye. 

[h1] A bit of background [/h1]
Technobabylon takes place in a sci-fi setting that is not to dissimilar to what what we’ve seen in adventure video games and other forms of media and entertainment. As you sink into the premise, setting and characters of Technobabylon, its influences become apparent in its nuances. Technobabylon will remind you of classic movies Blade Runner, cult classic games like Policenauts, iconic anime/manga like Ghost in the Shell and even newer anime like Psycho Pass. 

In a city called Newton, a place where science has risen above ethics and morals, and everyone plays god with free-form genetic engineering. Advances in computing power have led to massive advancements in AI, that mostly put to use for monitoring and controlling citizens. Social media and inter-web interaction has gone up a few notches, with the virtual-reality medium called Trance giving people a platform to interact in a virtual world and not deal with the real world responsibilities. Genetic engineering has made stunning advances as well – when an organic nanomachines called "wetware" are invented for many different purposes. Such freedoms and technological progress come at a price, however, when it created a generation of addicts (known as “thralls”) who have no jobs and spend most of their time in "trance", or when a genetically engineered children with explosive bones can be made as a suicide bomber. 

[h1] The protagonists [/h1]
Meet Regis, He’s the typical “too-old-for-this" cop, and boy is he too old for this. If Regis could wear a Rage Against the Machine shirt to work, he would. Assuming people remember Rage Against the Machine in post-nuclear 2087. Surveillance cameras, computers, phones, cyborg-style implants—Regis hates the whole lot, and most of all he hates the city’s overzealous artificial intelligence, Central. 
Then there's Lao, an ordinary girl with her cheerfulness and spark keeps her partner Regis’ cynical doom-and-gloom attitude at bay for most of the game and brightens up the atmosphere considerably. In a game that has such a dark plot with so many terrible things happening, Max’s character provides the perfect balance to the mix, adding the sense of hope the story so desperately needs.
And finally Latha. She brings the game its biggest breath of fresh air, as she is able to enter the Trance. From here, she can interact with other users and even AI systems she encounters, displaying them through humanistic avatars complete with unique personalities. Here, the game flexes its creative muscles at not only providing unique gameplay, but also at delivering dialogue with wit and humor as well.

The way it shuttles you between these three viewpoints is probably one of my favorite aspect of the game. It feels like we learn a lot about the world, thanks to our split perspective. 

[h1] Puzzles n' stuff [/h1]
Speaking of puzzles, we can agree that the most important part of any puzzle-based games is the presentation of the puzzles themselves, and this is where Technobabylon really delivers. Not every puzzle has the same wealth of approaches, but in general things adhere to each character’s skills—low-fi investigation from Regis, high-tech hacking from Latha, and a bit of both from Lao. It’s a clever conceit that helps make each character feel functionally distinct even within the limited mechanics of a point-and-click adventure game. Whether its remotely piloting drones, manipulating AI personalities, or even solving how to enter through a locked doorway, Technobabylon makes figuring out how to get to the next destination an enjoyable experience. Visually, Tecnobabylon carries a style akin to the DOS adventure game classics from yesteryear, and the pixelated graphics are put to good use to create some detailed environments and character sprites. Neon colors/lighting mixes nicely with the darker contrast and undertones to create an artistically charged setting. Except for the character portraits that pop up in conversations, the game looks like an early 1990s LucasArts adventure game.

[h1] Some minor complaints [/h1]
Despite the overall positive experience, the playthrough wasn’t without its own set of problems. There are moments when I got confused about what the objects are or how they function, as it is often unclear without clicking on them to get a text description. The low fidelity visuals also contribute to the problem of not always knowing what you can grab from the environment and what you can manipulate. It is easy to miss out on a drawer or a wrench since so many useable items blend into the background. In addition to that, some of the voice acting – in particular that of Regis – was a little too monotone, which made even the more dramatic scenes a little less moving. Not to mention that Trance is somewhat underutilized too. We get glimpses of Trance’s potential, especially the part where Latha is constantly swapping between the virtual and physical worlds to solve puzzles. But in general the game doesn’t do enough with a world that has literally zero rules. 

[h1] Bottom line [/h1]
Honestly, I feel like I can write an essay or two about this game. Like drawing some comparison between Central (Newton's overzealous artificial intelligence) and The Sibyl system from Psycho Pass, whether the escapism provided by Trance a blessing in a world gone to hell, or is it merely enabling people to give up on the real world and many other topics to cover. But surely if you managed to make it this far, you want to see my thought about it. While there is no shortage of choice when it comes to adventure games — especially on Steam — Technobabylon is not just another face in the crowd. It doesn’t make you feel you are just a passenger along for the ride, nor does it make you feel like you need to be a mind reader to figure out how the developers want you to solve a puzzle. A little fix might have made game more enjoyable in a couple of ways, but the game is still a very easy one to recommend, especially since it's only 15 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108099827', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1541598336}
review:
Technobabylon is:


- The best story wirten in cyberpunk game industry from far, dialogues, everyword is a masterpiece of anticipation concerns

- (for me) an hardcore enigmas based gameplay, I've been stuck a lot of times (used clue 3 - 4 times)

- strange artistic designing (in my op' it should be better without this pixel art)

- First game I played with an interesting approach of cyberspace/hacking gameplay


In other words, it's an absolute must have for all anticipation fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018514111', 'num_games_owned': 3257, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1462388176}
review:
It's pretty good! But also pretty formulaic – not surprisingly, I suppose. I'm strongly reminded of the Wadjet Eye catalogue in general, and especially the cyberpunk Resonance. Wadjet Eye has a certain type of point and click game they like to produce over and over, but I'm liking it so far.

The ending goes, unfortunately, the way of – well, it's not a button press to decide the fate of the world, but you can see one from there. You can also see the Versalife building's neon adverts, for what it's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973402038', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1462204412}
review: nice games like many others from wadjet eye games

author: {'steamid': '76561197966787042', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1462047246}
review: Another solid point and click set in a cyberpunky world with a fantastic story. Some satisying puzzles and likeable characters with a healthy balance of humour and dramatic stakes. I hope they make a sequel to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027930990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1462024814}
review: Very well done futuristic point and click. It's not cutesy like the the classic Lucas Arts games or even the Unwritten Tales series, but it's not dour either. It does share one thing with Unwritten Tales in that you are in control of different characters throughout the game. Puzzles that make sense and the story is well done. Try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027887433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1615737364}
review: I'll admit: I'm a sucker for this new era of retro point-n-click adventure games. I loved Primordia, I loved Gemini Rue, and I absolutely adored Technobabylon. The story is top notch, the setting is well developed and fleshed out with art that really brings it to life, the voice acting is, well, it's definitely not terrible and never took me out of the game. The puzzles are all logical with none of the inane head-scratchers that this genre is typically known for. If you're at all into this genre, or maybe you once were back in the heyday of Lucasarts and Sierra, give this a shot. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968581162', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1461882152}
review: This is an excellent point-and-click adventure, quite reminiscent of Beneath A Steel Sky, with a gorgeous pixel art cyberpunk aesthetic and deep, involved storytelling. Some of the puzzles are a little esoteric but on the whole it makes sense, and I can't recommend it enough for fans of the genre. Awesome music too.  10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078861574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1461559608}
review: Really great game. Definitely reminiscient of older Sierra adventure games. Maybe better in some respects, even, because I actually managed to finish this one. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066812772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1461779893}
review:
I am a huge fan of old school adventure games, I am also a huge fan of SCI-FI, cyberpunk in particular. Things that attract me to the genre include; neon lit futuristic worlds, crazy looking characters who often have their own street lingo, integration with technology, people having their snazzy wee devices (comm links, data pads etc), mad plots & conspiracies...The list goes on.

What Technobabylon has; A bright, neon lit futuristic city, cool devices called travellers that you can use to phone people browse the web etc, people who live in cyberspace and are very much integrated with tech and a mystery that threatens to bring the entire city to collapse.

I loved every minute I played of Technobabylon, it is a very welcome step back to the adventure games of old, in the vein of Beneath a Steel Sky or Broken Sword. The world and characters are layers deep, as mentioned above, you can browse the net in game, play games, read the news, even check your mail. The characters have multiple dimensions that give them (and by extension the player) motivation to make questionable decisions. Also something I find quite novel for a point n' click, there are often multiple ways to resolve a given situation instead of having to find the right items to be used in the right way to advance. It has a fantastic story and typical of any SCI-FI piece, throws loads of nouns at you to wrestle with bringing you deeper into it's world.

TL;DR Great game with fantastic characters & story, any SCI-FI fan particularly of things from Bladerunnrer to The Matrix should definitely check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988214150', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1461621946}
review:
Absolutely amazing cyberpunk experience.
9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048036109', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1540695507}
review: I highly recommend this game to anyone that loves adventure games. The sci-fi storyline was fun to follow and the new items that were introduced for use were logical and became second nature very quickly. The puzzles just made sense. As usual with Wadjet Eye games, the voice acting was great and there was plenty of it. The attention to detail is amazing (Try calling every number in a phone listing and getting an answer for every one). I felt a connection to the characters. Really just loved every second of this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198299277469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1461510410}
review:
Un jeu qui m'a réconcilié avec les point&clics.
 Écriture très mâture, ambiance et background hard scifi retranscrits comme il faut, persos clichés juste comme il faut et j'ai  trouvé les énigmes pas trop tirées par les cheveux. Et les musiques.... 
Bref j'ai passé un super moment (assez long vu que le durée de vie est aussi au rdv)

author: {'steamid': '76561198159865004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1461476318}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048700793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1435362657}
review:
Ne nous le cachons pas : Technobabylon fait largement honneur au jeu d’aventure. Malgré une inégalité dans l’intuitivité et la difficulté des énigmes et certains passages un peu trop saturés en parlotes (le restaurant), c’est avec un immense plaisir que nous parcourons la cité de Newton et que nous découvrons les tenants et les aboutissants de son scénario. Côté graphique, la direction artistique est très réussie mais souffre parfois des limitations du moteur AGS. Enfin, le doublage intégral de l’ensemble des personnages ainsi que la bande-son, certes discrète et sans grands thèmes forts mais qui colle impeccablement à l’ambiance font de Technobabylon un must have du point’n click qui mérite toute votre attention.
Le test complet sur IndieMag.fr :
https://www.indiemag.fr/tests/technobabylon-perle-du-jeu-daventure

author: {'steamid': '76561198014813010', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1461073693}
review:
Excellent point and click avec une histoire qui tient la route, une monde futuriste crédible et pas si éloigné et quelques choix moraux qui, même si ils ne forcent pas un replay du jeu, sont suffisament ambigues pour réfléchier quelques instants avant de cliquer.
La difficulté n'est pas inaccessible, essentielement car tous les puzzles se résolvent sur 2/3 tableaux, et on arrive assez facilement à la résolution des puzzles (exception faite d'1/3 de puzzle à la fin, qui se base sur un élément du décor négligeable...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031651888', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1460900818}
review:
Encore un excellent jeu de Wadjet Eyes ! 

Comme toujours, le scénario est vraiment prenant. L'histoire tourne ici autour des concepts de réalité virtuelle, d'intelligence artificielle, le tout saupoudré d'une enquête policière intéressante. Tout cela donne un résultat à la hauteur de Gemini Rue.

En outre, la durée de vie est assez importante. Les énigmes sont de bonne qualité, bien qu'on ne reste pas bloqué très longtemps. Je regrette juste qu'il n'y ait pas beaucoup de terminaux où le joueur est invité à faire des recherches par mots clés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014817484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 1854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1636292911}
review:
Man do they make great Point&Click adventure games at Wadjet eye games! 
I've been searching and playing different games from different studio's and the way
 I see this is a studio always have a recipe for making games that they will maintain 
and use for new games they release.

So to give you an example i've bought a pack of 5 games from Deadalic games and....
well it is just not my cookie. There is no logic in their puzzels is plain frustrating and
 the graphics won't make up for this but that's my view and it is subjective..

I had no experience with Wadjet eye games before Technobabylon and i'm playing 
through my first game how ever i feel that i have gained enough experience to give 
a review of this game and maybe about theirways of proceding in creating these stunning adventure games.

I must be a nerdy guy but i like pixelate games, given they are innovative like 
Void & meddler or.. in this case like Technobabylon, the ui is working like a 
charm and better the story is really good! 
The fact they don't charge huge amounts for their games says they are down to earth 
and realistic that's also a major.

I just bought the Shivah a second ago and the other games will be in my library too soon, because i think they well deserve it for keeping the Point & Click genre alive and putting their hart and soul into their games. 

I say big KUDOS for Wadjet eye games! can't wait for future games and i hope they will make more Cyberpunk genre games because i think this will be the favorite genre for the upcoming years! 

So first off the Soundtrack is a-w-e-s-o-m-e  it's been like never since i've heard such a great soundtrack the music is high quality and fits the game like man and wife.
The graphics are what you would expect and they added faces that expres how they think and feel, this is what you will be looking at while playing and they are of higher quality then main scene. 

I've had no problems what so ever finding items and completing the story, it's all very pleasant to
do, eg, like the puzzels are logic and linear thinking. again a Major.

You play with multiple protagonists and this enhances the story in a positive way, like the story is comming together. 

all in all i think you should buy and try this game, you could also try the demo and keep the save game i you decided to buy it after playing the demo. 
But i guarantee,  tyring = buying!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085745255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1460567708}
review:
This game ate six hours of my life, and I loved it. If you recall with fondness point and click adventure games from the nineties, but feel that they haven't aged well (*rhymes with mucous farts*), you should give Technobabylon a try. It channels influences from Gibson's works, Blade Runner, and a number of other cyberpunk influences flawlessly both in artistic style and story.

Gripes? With the exception of the two female lead vocal actors, none of the voice acting is going to impress you- some of it is downright terrible. However, everything is subtitled and you can click your way rapidly through any characters that you may find grating.

Puzzles range from the obvious to the complex, and the final two chapters will gove you a good mental workout. Remember that like all graphic adventures to mouse over *everything* you can see everywhere that you can reach  if you're stuck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198184385459', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 12028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3531, 'last_played': 1464475301}
review: This is a masterpiece.  If you are curious about this genre of game then this is a perfect entry point (as it has none of the moon-logic puzzles that other games do).  The plot is exciting, the activities you perform are fun and delightful.  Get this game . I can't imagine how you could be disappointed.  The graphics are retro-styled but they work well and are appealing and sufficently detailed not to intefere with the game.  The voice acting is first-rate

author: {'steamid': '76561197966573552', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1444789562}
review: Excellenct mesh of science fiction ideas that stay relevant to the plot and kept me engaged all the way to the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960860345', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1459556424}
review: All-around wonderful game. Great characters, compelling story, and very reminiscent of the adventure games I grew up loving. The puzzles make sense rather than requiring luck or a lot of trial and error to solve. It was challenging but not to the point where you want to pull your hair out. Love overall aesthetic, as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985217016', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1459548674}
review:
Must Have если вы с ностальгией вспоминаете Blade Runner и Beneath a Steel Sky. Умный, логичный и стильный квест с атмосферой того самого "синего" киберпанка 90-х. Генная инженерия, виртуальная реальность и весь этот ваш high-tech-low-life обеспечены.

Must have if you are nostalgic about Blade Runner and Beneath a Steel Sky. Clever, logical and stylysh adventure featuring athmosphere of good old "blue" cyberpunk from the 90's. Gengineering, virtual reality and lots of high-tech-low-life stuff are guaranteed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986449028', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1459546899}
review: Very nice Sci-fi adventure game right in the same mould of Beneath a Steel Sky. Good voice acting, interesting puzzles and a great story combine to make this a very enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072072986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1464354466}

A gorgeous retro themed point and click adventure set in a cool cyber punk world! It has a very well developed story and atmosphere.
I am sure it won't disappoint the lovers of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981655644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1459322828}

Realistically extrapolated sci-fi with a retro sheen and a complex story. The puzzles actively explore the setting and let you mess around with cool future technology. If you like point-and-click ad­ven­ture games at all, this is a must-play.

Full review [url=https://davidyat.es/2016/03/30/review-technobabylon/]here[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198072182182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1458966957}
review:
[i]Technobabylon[/i] is an excellent addition to publisher Wadjet Eye's ever-growing catalog of gorgeously lo-fi adventures.  The most striking thing about the game is that it does a far better job at building a fascinating science fiction world than most AAA productions; in this aspect it more closely approaches a good novel than a game, bringing to mind great cyberpunk authors like Rudy Rucker or William Gibson, while at the same time maintaining its own creative identity.  Food, sports, cyberspace and IRL addictions, crime, criminal justice, politics -- it's all handled in an unobtrusive and intriguing way that draws the player deeply in.  The puzzles, which are all of about medium difficulty, all make sense in the context of this world and its tech, coming across more as outgrowth than obligatory tack-on.  It would be a shame for Technocrat's painstakingly crafted milieu to go to waste, and fortunately, there are indications, both in [i]Technobabylon[/i]'s narrative and in the developer commentary, that a sequel may be in the works.  
   
There are a few questions that I would like answered about the mostly *very* impressive story (especially the import of a certain apartment bombing) but these gaps don't trip up the plot for me in the least; some of these can be left for the sequel I suppose, while the remainder can be left to player interpretation without strain on narrative continuity.  The voice acting, as in all Wadjet Eye productions, varies from actor to actor.  It is never bad, but never perfectly professional; it puts me in the mind of an obviously talented community theater troupe rather than a stable of career voice actors, and actually intensifies the hip "indie" vibe of the whole production.  I did encounter one minor bug in the game -- a wrench that I could not yank out of a gear because a partition blocked its hotspot -- but it only set me back about about a minute of playtime.

(There were many awesomely odd little incidents that really helped me suspend my disbelief.  For example:  in a scummy VR-hosting dive, the player character must pry off a layer of crusted old wetware -- signal-broadcasting, nanomachine-rich goop that people smear on devices to interface their own internal wiring to those systems -- before she can apply her own and access a machine.  It's visceral details like this that make all the difference!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005658902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1458701243}
review: Tremendous game; the pacing is pitch-perfect, and it strikes a great balance between dialogue and inventory puzzles, with several great mechanics to combine the two. The atmosphere is dead-on cyberpunk, and the music and voice acting is top-notch. I particularly appreciate the way it makes each scene a fairly small number of locations, and makes it clear what the overall goal is from the outset then turns you loose to achieve it in the context provided; it's a smart design to provide that sort of direction for the player. Outstanding traditional point-and-click game, which no fan of the genre should miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203204624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1458466230}
review:
I had as much fun playing this as I did playing Bladerunner years ago. Its like that and Monkey's Island. If you enjoyed those two and the newer Shardlight, I recommend this one. 
The story is really interesting, and keeps you wanting to play it straight through. 
Definitely funny, and twists at times. 
I give it a 9/10 only because I wish I had a little more play time out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029233591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1458495803}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967060366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1457738605}
review: Excellent adventure game with a good story, characters and puzzle design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013196360', 'num_games_owned': 1143, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1458189893}
review:
[h1]7/10 - Solid adventure game[/h1]
In many ways Technobabylon gives a fan of the genre what we really want.  A solid story with a few branches, nice environments, and good-enough characters.  I wasn't a huge fan of the pixelated art style, it felt more lazy than artistic, but that's subjective.  Also, strangely, interacting with anything in the Steam overlay breaks fthe chat speech bubbles when returning to the game.  I probably restarted the game 10 or so times due to that.  Simple fix, turn off the overlay.

I recommend this to fans of the genre.  It's not going to win over anyone else though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967688327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1457933284}
review:
Having just completed the game I feel compelled to share my feedback. Technobabylon is nothing less than a masterfully-made game. The visuals are beautiful, the story and music are excellent, and the likeable characters have plenty of depth (along with impeccable voice acting). Many funny, fascinating, subtle and smart surprises. If you are a cyberpunk fan, do not miss this game!

10/10, wishing for Technocrat and Wadjet Eye to produce many more games in this style/storyline!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961885489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1457893113}
review:
I can highly recommend this game. It excels on many levels :)
- The good voice acting considerably increased the immersion into the game's atmosphere
- Very nice graphics
- Good and compelling story
- A lot of thought went into the game's world, and there are a lot of opportunities to let you glimpse into what kind of world this is (e.g. newsfeed, side-dialogue, etc.) 

I very much liked the fact that they managed to build such an interesting world paired with good voice acting and a nice story - loved it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968397930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1687836891}
review:
After playing Gemini Rue, I knew that I would be on the lookout for any further games from Wadjet Eye Games.  Fortunately, Technobabylon doesn't disappoint.  

The game pulls you into a great story through strong and relatable characters with clear motivations that you can get behind.  It dangles the mystery like a carrot on a stick, but gives you enough payoffs to keep you going.  The real star, however, is the amazing sense of world-building and atmosphere.  Technobabylon builds an incredibly believable world that builds off of our current technological and societal trajectory and takes it in some very scary directions.  Its atmosphere and soundtrack are also wonderful, creating a completely cohesive and immersive world.

The interactions between the characters are well done, and there are some standout supporting characters that are a real hoot.  The dialogue can get VERY expositional at times, especially when the plot twists start cropping up near the end, but overall the dialogue is very snappy and well done.

The gameplay is solid, using great puzzles and exploration that make sense but are still challenging.  It doesn't fall into the normal nonsensical adventure game puzzle tropes, which I'm very thankful for.  You can usually piece together what you need to do from your surroundings and resources, but you still feel smart for figuring it out.  There are a couple of times when what you're supposed to be doing isn't made clear (as in, what your objective is or why you're somewhere in the first place), but these points were few and far between.

I picked this game up, and couldn't put it down until 9 hours later.  It is a fantastic adventure game and I give it a wholehearted recommendation to any fan of of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972364092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1457646264}
review:
Technobabylon has the look and feel of the later Sierra adventure games after they made the leap to 256 colours and dropped the text parser. The game has a great story, very nice graphics and good music and voice acting. The puzzles are logical enough and there are a few alternate solutions along the way. The only points where I got stuck is where I missed something in the background that I could have clicked. I also like that there is no game over state.

In summary I heartily recommend this game. I hope it gets a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043779887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1527319224}
review: Probably one of the most stunning cyberpunk, sci-fi game, if you don't mind s!tty AGS engine. Because it's simply ruining the game's visual quality, especially sprites. Unfortunately every single Wadjet Eye Games published project ripped by the same fate. Even after the all technical messes, the game deserves your full attention. It's simply earned it. Just give it a chance and don't judge it with only the screenshots, I bet you won't regret and probably you gonna say "where was I am when this game first came out".

author: {'steamid': '76561197961367991', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1457584056}
review:
They had me at Wadjet Eye.  ;)

I've enjoyed playing Gemini Rue (favorite so far), Primordia, and now Technobabylon.  You should get this game if you a) love Blade Runner.  b) love Gemini Rue.  or c) JUST GET IT!  You won't regret it.  The game has great music, storyline, voice acting... should be enough reasons to justify purchase for this point & click adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092291917', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1457421024}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994079322', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1455832048}
review: One of the best adventure games out there. Puzzles are constructed perfectly throughout, even in a great adventure there's usually a couple that leave me frustrated, but I couldn't think of a single one that didn't feel adequately signposted, without being "easy". In every section the story gets more and more interesting, and you uncover more depth to the characters. I highly recommend this to adventure game fans, or anyone curious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971408449', 'num_games_owned': 1013, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1456733430}
review: Cool story, nice art. If you liked the Blackwell games you should try this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039679458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1455884987}
review:
TL/DR - If you like Cyberpunk, dystopian-like futures, well paced stories and character development, then you could do a lot worse than Technobabylon. (Love the reference to Big Blue Cup)

I find a lot of point and click adventures to be a little tiresome these days, some are a little too rooted in conventions set by their predecessors, while others find themselves wrapped up in overly convoluted and obtuse puzzles. Technobabylon manages to find some fresh perspective on these puzzles, keeping most of their components within reasonable grasp and still manage to deliver a fantastic plot with engaging characters at the end of it all.

Presentation is beautifully executed, as i have come to expect with Wadjet Eye games, thus enables the player give in and throw themselves into the experience completely. There were some really cool and interesting puzzles involving the "Trance", along with a lot of humour stitched effortlessly next to some gruesome and possibly even barbaric scenes. I did find that one or two puzzles that involved the dreaded pixel hunt, and one puzzle in particular involved a reflex mini-game...which i hate with a passion in these types of games.

Fantastic game and well worth the price of admission. It really shows what a quality team can do with AGS and I'm glad to see it has come so far over the years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099013029', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1455475936}
review:
[b] Technobabylon 4/5:[/b] Vážná kyberpunková point and click adventura klasického střihu, která dělá tolik věcí dobře, že těch pár kde jí to drhne, bije do očí o to více. Co potěší je citlivá práce s přesahovými tématy „budoucnosti nastavující zrcadlo naší současné společnosti", která nejsou lámána přes koleno a cpána za každou cenu do popředí. Co potěší ještě více jsou dospělé dialogy, u kterých nevzniká pocit, že takto se vyjadřují videoherní postavičky a ne skuteční lidé. A úplně nejvíce potěší, že v každé z deseti kapitol jde o něco jiného; jednou budete vylučovací metodou zjišťovat pachatele atentátu, jindy se snažit nepozorovaně uniknout ze zdánlivě opuštěné továrny a poté třeba ve virtuální realitě „vylidňovat server".

 Tvůrci si vystačí v průměru s třemi až čtyřmi obrazovkami na kapitolu a ani nezahltí hráče předměty či aktivními body, přesto umí vytvořit nelehké, nápadité a komplexní „mnohaúrovňové" puzzly, které ani zdaleka nejsou jen o správném používání předmětů a rozhodně vám nepomůže zběsilé zkoušení všeho na všechno; zapojení mozku se prostě nevyhnete. Hlavní puzzly ve většině kapitol mají více než jedno možné řešení; zpravidla tři v nejlepším možném odkazu žánrové klasiky [i]Indiana Jones and The Fate of Atlantis[/i].

 Tolik ke kladům. Nyní však ta ale. Předně dějové vyústění v posledních dvou kapitolách je velkým krokem zpět oproti nadějnému rozjezdu. A vyloženě naštvou občasné adventurní excesy. Je jich sice minimum, ale do takto vyspělé a vnitřní elementární logiku vyznávající hry sedí asi jako Santa Claus k tradičním českým Vánocům. Jeden příklad za všechny: místo vraždy, hledání vražedné zbraně skrze podomácku vyrobený prut, zmagnetizované ramínko a bazének s vodou zakalenou krví, grrr! Takovéto řešení by sedlo do odlehčené adventury ve stylu Monkey Islandu, nikoli do vážné a řádně temné adventury.

 Každopádně celkově sympatická, nikterak krátká a středně těžká adventura s vyspělými charaktery i tématy. Takových je pomálu a je tedy dobré si zdařilých pokusů na tomto poli náležitě vážit. Zvlášť když je taková zábava je hrát.
------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561197968300492', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1455211257}
review:
Five Word Review: Interesting story in interesting world.
Favorite Thing: I really do love the world building. I'd like to see another game take place here.

+ For an indie game the voice acting is above average. In particular, I found Latha's actress to be most excellent.
+ Did I mention the world building?
+ An interesting story, played from multiple perspectives.

Playtime: ~ 9h
Enjoyment: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071608439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1450850820}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152549185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1455557248}
review:
Lo consiglio per la storia interessante, i personaggi e i colpi di scena.
Il gameplay è un point and click dove si sfruttano lo scenario e alcuni oggetti che si possono trovare in esso, ogni oggetto ha la sua utilità, quindi cercate di accumularne il più possibile ed esplorate ogni scenario.
Purtroppo il gioco è tutto in inglese, compresi i bei doppiaggi, quindi dovete conoscere la lingua.
Molto soddisfatta :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197965609940', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1455810914}
review:
Ich bin echt gepackt.

Es ist bis zum Schluss ein echt guter Point&Click Thriller. 
Die Story ist gut verschachtelt, wirkt aber nicht überladen erdrückend. 
Das Voice-Acting ist herrvoragend und rundet zusammen mit den charmanten Portaits ein nachvollziehbares Charakterbild ab.

Ein Tolles spiel, dass mich an div. Kino filme der frühen 90er erinnert :) was auch zum Look des Spiels passt.

ganz ungeschoren kommt mir das spiel allerdings nicht davon, denn gegen Ende besitzen die ein oder anderen Figuren teils omnipräsentes wissen, was etwas fragwürdig ist... wo man aber drüber hinwegsehen kann, grade wenn man nicht drauf achtet.

Ich persönlich finde es schade, dass es "schon vorbei" ist und wünsche mir mehr solcher Titel.

wer ein Rating braucht. 4/5 , 89% , 8/10 sucht euern liebling aus :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198196483307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1456331741}
review:
I most definitely recommend this game to lovers of the genre.

Technobabylon is a breath of fresh air! The storyline is amazing & well executed! No annoying plotholes! Every relevant piece of information was sufficiently developed & clarified throughout the whole game.

Even though there were quite a bit of technical terms implemented in this game (which sometimes felt like I was learning a new language) I most definitely enjoyed the game! I found it very interesting & exciting!

The puzzles were of a satisfying difficulty. There was a good balance of "flow" & "resistance" in regard to game progression (for me, personally).

What I mean by this is that puzzle difficulty allowed for smoother progression at some times, and at other times I felt I was required to think a bit harder before I could proceed (without doing my head in  though).

So I was very pleasantly surprised by how the developer team pulled this off! 

I figured out most on my own, but did need to cheat about 2 times (hey!, that's not too bad!).

This game contains different fun elements:
- beautiful character design & environment + fitting music
- natural voice acting (although the way it was scripted made some reactions seem over-the-top)
- well written dialogue (made sense)
- multiple & meaningful character introductions
- intuitive & original puzzles (with some exceptions, but definitely doable)
- flashbacks
- choice & consequence
- virtual reality & AI theme
- ethnical diversity
- taboo & shocking details

There's a total of 3 main characters (which are each playable at some point, and even interchangeably so near the end, so as to have them act as a team - very fun!).

Just wished they had implemented that possibility sooner!

I pretty much loved everything about this game :). I could see myself replaying it over & over again in a couple of years from now!

This game gave me the chills (in a good way), the way Blade Runner did back in the day! It's so refreshing & different!

I'm hoping there will be a sequel to this! There has to be! The ending (as is) is acceptable, though I'd love to see more :)!

So worth the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038710884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1453671727}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987747368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1549794101}
review: If books like Neuromancer, Altered Carbon and Snow Crash are your thing, then you'll love Technobabylon. A well crafted story, delivered from multiple perspectives, with logical puzzles and great presentation. My only gripe would be Regis' voice acting and how brutally low resolution it is (640x400), no amount of filter options are going to make it look great on today's large modern screens. Ultimately these minor criticisms didn't hinder my enjoyment

author: {'steamid': '76561197965814755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1444944260}
review: Just buy it

author: {'steamid': '76561198009388099', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1453918570}
review:
This is a point and click adventure game like Police Quest or Larry Laffer from the 90's.

You have to figure out what conversation or item use will advance the game.

Often these kinds of games can be frustrating as you try and guess what you have to do next.  This game takes the cake though.  I got stuck in the first room because how to advance the game is completely illogical and unguess-able.  You essentially have to try everything, and then after finding one solution, try everything again in case something changed.

About as fun as trying to brute force guess your friend's Facebook password.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971552630', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1453262736}
review:
Technobabylon is one of those games I bought on a whim and ended up absolutely LOVING. A believable setting, very well-written characters with great dialogue, challenging puzzles that avoid being illogical/downright infuriating and a story with just the right amount of twists and turns made this one of my favorite adventure games of recent memory.

The story is masterfully balanced between serious, heavy moments and enjoyable touches of levity/humor; it avoids being a grimdark nightmare like so many cyberpunk games, yet also doesn't rely on tongue-in-cheek references to genre classics to score nostalgia points. Technobabylon is simply a fantastic cyberpunk adventure game that stands on its own with the best the genre has to offer. If cyberpunk fiction is up your alley and you enjoy classic adventure games, I can't recommend this enough.

(I'd also love to see a sequel that explores Max and Dr. Regis' origin stories!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999027324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1453606134}
review:
Superbe point 'n click à thème polar cyberpunk qui va faire sentir chez eux tous les fans de Blade Runner et de Beneath a Steel Sky. Old-style dans tous les sens du terme : graphismes à gros pixels, musiques électro/ambient qui auraient pu être composées par Vangelis, pas de système d'indices ni de suggestions d'emplacement des items... manque plus que l'interface SCUMM et on se dirait dans un bon vieux jeu Lucasarts.
Le gameplay est très équilibré et varié ; on joue trois persos différents, on ne fait guère toujours la même chose, les énigmes ne sont jamais ni évidentes ni impossibles à résoudre et peuvent parfois être résolue de deux ou trois manières distinctes, et enfin les manipulations via le wetware/CI-splitter c'est tout simplement hyper fun.
Mais plus que toute autre chose, le jeu a un scénario de OUF (remarquablement cohérent au passage pour une oeuvre de SF) et des personnages extrêmement bien développés.

Je ne saurais pas assez recommander ce titre à tous les fans de point 'n click et de cyberpunk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970368457', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1453235578}

You get hooked and don't want to quit until having finished it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003302546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1452702709}
review:

Had trouble with ingame mouse acceleration with a logitech mouse, no drivers installed. Although the issue seems hardware sensitive, be warned that you might have to get used to it to play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072570138', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1452811867}
review:
Technobabylon ist ein Point and Click Adventure im Retrostil das mit seiner komplexen und dabei sehr konsistenten Cyberpunk Welt und der gut erzählten Geschichte überzeugt.

Pluspunkte:
+ Sehr stimmungsvolle Inszenierung sowohl was den konsequent durchgezogenen Grafikstil als auch die passende Musik betrifft.
+ Ein MUSS für jeden Fan von "Beneath A Steel Sky"!
+ Man erfährt nebenher viel über die Stadt und den Zustand der Welt sodass man sich als Spieler gut in die Charaktere hineinversetzen kann.
+ Es gibt zu vielen Rätseln mehrere gültige Lösungsansätze. Der Spieler hat somit oft das Gefühl, dass eine logische Idee auch funktioniert, statt die einzige richtige Lösung zu jagen.
+ Die Perspektivwechsel sind nicht aufgesetzt sondern kaschieren Zeitsprünge perfekt und unterstützen die Story gut.

Kritik:
- In manchen Szenen passiert es, dass Teile der Grafik viel hochauflösender sind als in den zugrundeliegenden Pixelgrafik Stil passt. Dadurch sind manche Szenen leider optisch nicht so stimmig wie sie sein könnten.
- Ein kleinerer Hänger des Spiels, konnte durch einen Neustart leicht behoben werden.

Die Minuspunkte sind geringfügig und sollten niemand vom Kauf abhalten. Jeden Cent wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030824576', 'num_games_owned': 1494, 'num_reviews': 495, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1452268741}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967525401', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1451860965}
review:
Every game associated with Wadjet Eye is worth buying IMO. This may not be the strongest thing they have produced, but it still has a number of good ideas.

There are a bunch of high level sci fi concepts put into the characters and set pieces. To mention any of them would take that discovery away from you so I won't really say too much, just suffice that it exists and it's fun to see what Technocrat came up with.

The actual writing is passable, but not super strong. The star here is really the sci fi ideas, not the characters themselves. I don't even want to criticise too much because it would require spoilers.

The actual puzzles are a mix of a bunch of different ideas too, and sometimes there are some minor UI issues as a result. Often it feels more like trying to understand how the game functions more than solving actual puzzles. But they work more often than not.

Overall a solid adventure game, even more so if you are a sci-fi nerd. It's also surprisingly long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070812953', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1451778834}
review:
Ambientação excelente, conseguiram criar um universo cyberpunk muito interessante com claras influências do clássico Neuromancer (e até um pouco de Laranja Mecânica).

Quebra-cabeças inteligentes, que fazem sentido (nada obscuro) e desafiam sem saturar a cabeça.

História envolvente com personagens bem construídos e diversificados (com direito a um personagem transexual numa posição de destaque na trama)!

Enfim, talvez não seja um jogo de entrada para o genêro, mas com certeza recomendo para quem gostar!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977196862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1472205383}
review:
I have had my eye on this game for some time and decided to give it a try. 

It's good timing as I have been reading 1984, A Brave New World and just watched Blade Runner. I think that Technobabylon creates an excellent futuristic dystopian world. If that is something of interest to you I would highly recommend this game. There are some really good concepts which are unlike anything I have really seen before. I especially like the "Trance" which is a form of internet which adds an extra element to problem solving.  

From my progression so far, 3.2 hrs in, does a really good job of drawing you into the characters and building a genuine reason to progress them through the story. Not only are they likeable but the background which is organically brought up gives them depth. The little splatters of dark humor is a really nice touch.

The gameplay is similar to a solid classic point and click adventure. Personally I think the graphics are perfect for the style and I found myself enjoying the slightly pixilated images and animation overalyed with the detailed facial expressions for dialogue that work so well to bring the world to life.

Overall, I think this game has a compelling story and ultimately is really fun to play, as a game should be. Definitely worth a my hard earned cash.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999177498', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1451695065}
review:
Un point and click old school dans la même veine que la série des Blackwell et du même éditeur, ça ne pouvait que m'intéresser.
Comme pour les Blackwell, l'histoire est intelligente et le gameplay tout bête et plus tout neuf est toujours aussi efficace. La durée de vie est plus que correcte avec une quinzaine d'heures au compteur. Petit bémol pour les graphismes, une résolution plus élevée n'aurait pas été de refus. Mais bon c'est vraiment pour pinailler et ça participe à l'ambiance.
Comme d'hab avec les jeux Wadjet Eye, un niveau d'anglais correct est requis pour comprendre ce qui se passe.

Bref c'est du bon, vivement le prochain !

author: {'steamid': '76561197990131474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1436115488}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029038933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1451518426}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011492308', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1592973787}
review: I usually get bored with and/or frustrated by adventure games before getting very far in them. However, Technobabylon captivated me from start to finish and the puzzles were always simple enough to figure out with enough time and logic - no bizarre solutions here! The storyline is intriguing and the characters are interesting enough to match it. A solid 4 out of 5, I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013141287', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1451274627}
review: 'Technobabylon' is a marvelous sci-fi / cyberpunk story-driven game, with memorable characters and intricate, thought-provoking dialogue. Well worth buying, one of the best games I've seen this year and yet another great story brought to us by 'Wadjet Eye Games' after 'Resonance' and 'Gemini Rue' - keep them coming please!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961734538', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1451016295}
review: This is a solid modern adventure game. The story is really big-concept biopunk, and there is plenty of melodrama and conspiracy to keep it interesting all the way through. It's not really as emotionally charged as the perennial top dog Gemini Rue, perhaps because the characters didn't really click with me, but it is very much worth your time if you are into well-realized sci-fi worlds or adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960670016', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1448910064}
review:
Story sounded boring to me at first but i got dragged in by the characters (Even the damn cooking machine avatar) and the idea behind the story. Great storytelling and narrative.

Puzzles are all fair but sometimes a little odd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010398157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1448648844}
review:
Technobabylon is an absolutely fantastic Point'n'Click Adventure with retro-style pixel graphics.
It takes place in a mega city in a somewhat dystopian future, which felt like from Bladerunner at times. That setting bears many details which you can find out about in dialogues or news feeds and so makes for a complete world.
The story is really well written and so are the characters. They have personality, a past and thus motivations.
All conversations are actually spoken. Though it is kind of sad, that this isn't the standard today.
I really recommend playing it and if you enjoy it, check out Gemini Rue as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070967169', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1522625918}
review:
If you liked Gemini Rue and Resonance to a lesser extent you will enjoy Technobabylon, we simply need more games like this on PC, great setting, great story that makes you ask questions of your own existence and the people behind the scenes running the show, like the part about corrupt news media. I will admit there are some puzzles that defy logic and understanding but there are walkthroughs for those situations ;) technobabylon is simply an enjoyable point & click cyberpunk adventure game with a believable story and Characters that you can always relate to in some form, it is a nice break from all the brain numbing triple A pew pew shooter games we seem to be drowning in these days, i simply want more games like this on PC, plus Technobabylon has the Wadjet Eye Games stamp of point & click approval :D

Buy it, if you enjoy Cyberpunk themes and point & click games you will not be dissapointed.

GG Technocrat Games

author: {'steamid': '76561198125217977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1443504680}
review:
Downloaded, game didnt work. Reached out to forums speaking with everyone that pretty much told me to do the same things over and over...Nothing. I was disappointed to have the game for less than an hour and have to refund it :(. As far as the story and gameplay itself that ive seen on youtube, i love the concept and Recommend people to play it.

But i am choosing that i DONT recommend it as of yet because there is no disclaimer from the developer here that details this game may not work with Windows 10. Nothing about my PC should have a hard time with this game except the fact that i have Windows 10 Pro x64. Probably a good idea to put that disclaimer here and possibly look into the issue and release an update?

author: {'steamid': '76561197971123919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1447603876}
review: Nice voice-acting, an interesting plot and world and enough play-time to leave you satisfied. There were definitely a few areas where I had to look up the solution and was frustrated with the answer, but most of the time the solutions were intelligent and satisfying. I understand that the nature of the script and how the parts were delivered makes this difficult, but the amount of times someone would realise that X had been done by Y, then you'd speak to them afterwards regarding another topic and have them yet again display their surprise at X and Y, was a little immersion breaking at times. But overall I enjoyed it. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197997813449', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1446415705}
review:
In order to keep me going until the very end, an adventure game needs to do two things right:
The first are puzzles that are not too hard and not too easy so that solving them feels rewarding and doesn't get too frustrating.
The second is a story that is interesting enough to make me want to keep trying until solve them.

Technobabylon excels in both fields like few games I have ever played.
The setting is unique and unbelievably rich for a game of this nature, the dialog really bringing the city to life.
The characters are interesting, complex, unconventional - the kinds of protagonists that feel like old friends by the end of it all.
Dialog and story are superbly written. If there is ever a sequel, I'll be first in line.

Even if you have only a passing interest in point-and-click adventures, this one is worth your time for the story alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968506604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1446110235}

review:
